Submit Forms from SAPUI5 mobile
text:
Hi,



how would a form in SAPUI5 mobile be created and how would a submit action
look like ?
author: Marcus Schiffer
Simon Kemp
text:
Hi Marcus,



You can build the form using the SAPUI5 UI controls, there is even a Form UI
control but it is not strictly part of the mobile library:



<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.commons.fo
rm.Form.html>



The submit action would be an event that you attach to the submit button, in
that even I expect you would use an AJAX call to the backend server to post
the values from the form fields.



Hth,

Simon

SAP UI5 translation
text:
Hi,



I have some doubts regarding the steps involved in getting the texts
translated and using them in the SAP UI5 applications.



I have gone through following links:



<http://vesapui5.dhcp.wdf.sap.corp:1080/trac/sapui5.tools/wiki/SAPUI5Tools/ABA
PTranslationOfSAPUI5Texts>

<http://veui5infra.dhcp.wdf.sap.corp:8080/demokit/#docs/guide/UI5BSPRepository
TaskTranslation.html>



As far my understanding, we have to place the texts to be translated in the
.properties file and then use the resource bundle to access them in SAPUI5
application. Using some reports will enable us to insert entries into
appropriate tables, which is then used by translation team to translate and
move it back accordingly into same tables with translated text along with
language code. Later there will be an handler which does the job of providing
the appropriate .properties file (If the file exists it will return the file,
else it will dynamically generate one and return).



So,

1\. Is this the general process involved for getting the texts translated? or
is there any alternative/better approach

2\. According to the first link, the reports and classes suggested are local
to YI3 system (i mean to say they are Z objects). So do we have to make
similar copy of these in our XDP/500 system? or is there any other way to get
them?

3\. Assuming even if we do make a manual copy, how reliable can it be?
(suppose some issues arise with respect to these classes and reports, whom do
we contact?)



We are working on a SAPUI5 project - version 1.12, with backend system as XDP
500/550.



Thanks in advance,

Vinay C

title: Reusable view in UI5
author: Zaghman Arshad
Ajain Vivek
text:
try changing the id value in setting view



id : "createContentView", -> id : "someThingelse"
title: Re:Reusable view in UI5

author: Zaghman Arshad
text: Changed id but still getting same duplicate element ID error....
title: Re:Reusable view in UI5

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Zaghman,



the problem is the ID of the Link created in your View definition: by giving a
static, hardcoded ID, this Link would have the same ID in every copy of the
View. Thus, the Link ID would not be unique anymore.



In the declarative View types (XMLView, HTMLView,...) UI5 automatically takes
care of adding the View ID as prefix to make the content IDs unique.

But in JSViews you are using the constructors directly, so this cannot be done
automatically.

So the solution is to use the "View.createId(...)" method to create dynamic
IDs:



**var name = new sap.ui.commons.Link(this.createId("nameLabel"), {**

** text: "Name",**

** width: "200px",**

** enabled :false,**

**});**



And when you want to access this element from the controller by its ID, you
also have to take care of this by using this.byId() instead of
sap.ui.getCore().byId(). But this is equal in all View types.



This whole topic is documented here:
<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/MVC.html>

But the control creation in the JSView case is admittedly not pointed out very
clearly. We'll improve that.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Reusable view in UI5

author: Zaghman Arshad
text:
Thanks your mentor . great
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/happy.gif) . issue sorted
title: Re:Reusable view in UI5
bindelement method does not send out OData service request
text:
Hi,

 There is a weird behavior in our application that sapui5 does not make
OData service request (I use Chrome to monitor network activity)

as we try to bindelement with a particular entity.



We are able to make OData service request against NW Gateway to retrieve a
collection.

(create ODataModel instance and make it global by using
sap.ui.getCore().setModel(myODataInsance)

and then a sap.m.List calls bindAggregation method with /Courses path to
get Courses collection)

Everything seems fine. However as we try to calll bindElement and do
something like this

oControl.bindElement(

"/Courses('123456')/") It seems looking into OData model in the memory (no
request is out) The problem is

the collection does not have course detail information.

I hadcode the course id with a random number and then I can see the request is
out. (but of course it will return 400 since the course id does not

exist).

The temporary solution in our side is to create a new ODataModel (so. no
calling collection first) and then oControl to bind element.

However I think they are using the same service so it does not make much sense
to use two ODataModel instance. Any thought we may

do something wrong?

do we have a tool like sencha cmd in sap ui5
text:
ui5 library size is too big, i can not put it in the hwc app. how can we get
the used library out like the sencha cmd?



thanks!
author: Nan Wang
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi,



there is a (maven-based) build process which is currently used to create the
different bundles/archives, but it is not officially documented and at this
time not meant for public use.



But you will find a file called "sapui5-mobile-static.zip" in the SDN download
which is a reduced bundle which only contains the runtime resources of the UI5
core, the sap.m library and the makit charts.

This file has less than 4 megabytes and can still be reduced in size by e.g.
deleting all *-dbg.js files, the theme (sap_mvi/sap_bluecrystal) you do not
need or the whole makit library.



The next version (1.14) of the demokit will document this better; here is a
copy of the respective section:



## _OPTIMIZING THE PACKAGE SIZE: DELETE UNNEEDED FILES_

_While the above file is already pretty small (and small enough for inclusion
in hybrid apps), the size can be further reduced and optimized for specific
applications by deleting unneeded files:_

  * _In `/resources` you can delete either `sap-ui-core-nojQuery.js` if you reference UI5 normally, or `sap-ui-core.js` if you reference the nojQuery version and reference jQuery separately (e.g. because you run in a Sybase Hybrid Container)._
  * _In `/resources/sap` you can delete the entire `makit` folder when you do not need the makit charts._
  * _In `/resources/sap/ui/thirdparty` you can delete the entire `jquery` and `jqueryui` folders when you use the normal `sap-ui-core.js` file for bootstrap (they may only be needed when using the `sap-ui-core-nojQuery.js` script, and even then you may have another copy of jQuery available, so that folder can still be deleted)._
  * _In `/resources/sap/ui/core/themes` and in `/resources/sap/m/themes` you can delete the "base" and the "sap_bluecrystal" folder (unless you are using this theme, then you can delete "base" and "sap_mvi")_



_Of all JavaScript files there is an optimized and a "-dbg" version of each
file, so when deleting the above files make sure you always delete both
versions of them! _

__  
_If you do not want to allow easy debugging and you want to go for minimum
installation size, also ALL *-dbg.js files can be deleted from the "-opt-
static" package._



_Further files can be deleted, but the size reduction is limited and finding
out what is not required gets increasingly difficult._





So in the end you will have between ~1 MB and 4 MB, which allows you to
achieve a reasonable size for your Mobile app.



In case you do not use the sap.m library but intend to use the desktop
controls on mobile devices (which will not offer the best experience), you
have to add the respective folders, but always can delete the "test-resources"
subfolder.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:do we have a tool like sencha cmd in sap ui5

author: Ajain Vivek
text:
Hi Andreas,



Is there any way to choose the required controls rather downloading whole
library something similar to jQueryUI Download Builder.



I believe inclusion of Custom Library Builder in SAPUI5 would help in
resolving the size drastically.



Regards,

Ajain
title: Re:do we have a tool like sencha cmd in sap ui5

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Ajain,



actually there is such a download builder tool, but it is experimental and not
contained in the SDN download. The main reasons for that are:

  * It introduces a manual step which may be fine if you want to create a web site, but really breaks the tool chain when you build a product and want to continuously stay on top of the latest library version
  * Frankly, UI5 covers much more aspects of UI development than jQuery UI and it has 10-15 times as many controls etc. and the modules are more fine-grained, so the number of modules is much higher - and unfortunately this makes the tool harder to use. Of course dependencies can be followed by the tool, but still the overall experience is not what one would expect.
  * This tool only covers JS, but not CSS.
  * Partly due to the above reasons, full effort has not been put into this tool, so it is not ready for productive use.



[![download builder.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/
2-14219657-249885/450-266/download+builder.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/Ji
veServlet/showImage/2-14219657-249885/download+builder.png)



Nevertheless, it is very obvious that at least for certain usage scenarios a
sort of optimization build is required. E.g. in mobile networks you want to
minimize the number of server requests and in weak mobile devices you want to
minimize the loaded code, even when run from hybrid contaners. And this covers
not only UI5 code, but also the application code which can be quite scattered
when using lots of Views.

So I'd say you can expect some news on this front.



Andreas
title: Re:do we have a tool like sencha cmd in sap ui5

author: Ajain Vivek
text:
Thanks for useful info Andreas
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/happy.gif)
title: Re:do we have a tool like sencha cmd in sap ui5

title: how to do with json model
author: Shen Peng
R Vereijken
text:
Hi Shen,



1: I'm assuming you have loaded your JSON data into a JS object. To alter this
you can simply add or push (for arrays) data to one of the object's nodes.
There are plenty of examples on Google. A quick search gives me e.g.:
<http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9787204/how-to-push-data-into-a-json-
variable> and <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/736590/add-new-attribute-
element-to-json-object-using-javascript> .



2: Take a look at <http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.extend/> for information on
how to merge two models.
title: Re:how to do with json model

author: Frank Welz
title: Re:how to do with json model

author: Ajain Vivek
title: Re:how to do with json model

author: Roshan Jalgaonkar
text:
Hello,



1.JsonModelEarlier ---> The Earlier JsonModel which has the Data.

2.JsonModelUpdated ---> The Newer JsonModel which has the Data and
which is to be updated in earlier JsonModel.



\----Code Start

**for(var i=0;i<JsonModelUpdated.getProperty("/results").Length;i++){**



** JsonModelEarlier.getProperty("/results").push(JsonModelUpdated.getProperty("/results/"+i));**



**}**

\----Code End

Thanks and Regards.

Roshan

Dialog not working in iOS webview (Phonegap) <\- it does.... my mistake
text:
Hi,

I have implemented an authentication solution for SAPUI5 phongap hybrid apps.
The solution overrides the ajax setup and prompts the user via a dialog to
enter his/her credentials based on various response statuses from the json
ajax calls (i.e 401)



This works fine on Android but the iOS webview fails to open a dialog. (Even
tested an app with a only simple dialog without any other functionality).

In safari the popup works. Anyone have had similar issues regarding the dialog
component?



/Njl



EDIT: It turns out iOS webview is just more sensitive to initialization than
Android. I corrected the init script and now it works perfectly.

title: submitting form after hitting enter key
text:
Hi,



In my application I have login page with two PasswordField controlls and login
button, which look similar to form.



Currently i'm sending data after user press a Login button, but i want to
allow user to be able to send form also by pressing enter (like regular form
in html).



I know change event is triggered after hitting enter but I'm currently using
change event to check if value of fields meets criteria (4-12 length, no
slashes, quotes), and if not show appropriate error window. I don't know any
way to distinguish when change event is fired after control lost focus and
when by pressing enter.



Also I'm using MVC which holds me back to insert this form in plain html using
sap.ui.core.HTML. (I've binded values to controller).



Thanks in advance,

Ian MacGregor

author: Ireneusz Kozlowski
text:
Hello Ian,

thanks for your replay, it almost working but keydown event is triggered
before change event. So in model I still don't have value user entered before
hitting enter. If you have any idea how I can make it work I would really
appreciate it. I've tried using fireChange but i don't know what i should pass
to function.
title: Re:submitting form after hitting enter key

author: Ian MacGregor
text:
Hi Ireneusz,



You can try using keyup instead of keydown, I think this should be triggered
after the change event.



Hope this helps.



Cheers,

Ian

Thanks,

Fiori & Responsive Web Design
text:
Hi,



I am wondering if anyone can explain to me how Fiori (built on SAPUI5) manages
responsive web design (RWD)? The apps seem to work well and adjust to whatever
device (desktop, smartphone, tablet) it is running on. Does it use the SAPUI5
desktop or the mobile libraries - I guess the desktop libraries but would like
some clarification if anyone knows.



Thanks,  
Simon
author: Simon Kemp
Simon Kemp
text:
Think I might have worked this out, in case anyone is interested here is a
link to the SAPUI5 SDK where it explains the ResponseLayout and Form controls:



<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#test-
resources/sap/ui/commons/demokit/ResponsiveLayout.html>



I am guessing Fiori makes use of these. Anyway, perhaps others can add to this
discussion anyway.

  
Thanks,  
Simon
title: Re:Fiori & Responsive Web Design

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Simon,



Fiori uses mostly the "sap.m" mobile library, but also some controls from the
"sap.ui.commons" desktop library, namely the Form with the ResponsiveLayout
(you found that one already) and one or two other layouts.



Apart from that, responsiveness mainly comes from the sap.m.SplitApp control
which shows either one page only or two pages, side-by-side, depending on the
screen size, and from the sap.m.Shell control which is invisible when the
screen has tablet size or less, but gets a sort of frame (with title, logout
link etc) on larger screens. There's quite some additional minor detail about
responsiveness in the sap.m.Shell control, like if a customer has configured a
logo in the theme designer, it might appear above or next to the main content.

Then, there is the sap.m.List in table mode where it is configurable which
columns should disappear or go into a row popin when the screen width gets
less than a certain threshold. And there are some more controls with minor
adaptation cpabilities.



You can have a look at a Fiori-style UI5 sample application (and maybe get a
glimpse of the sources) here:

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/test-
resources/sap/m/demokit/inbox/index.html>

(the server seems to be slow right now, though...)



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Fiori & Responsive Web Design

author: Simon Kemp
text:
Thank you Andreas, that is exactly what I was looking for! Will look at all
the items you mention in more detail. Would be good to have a "How to build a
Fiori style app" guide <hint, hint, if anyone is listening>
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/silly.gif)
title: Re:Fiori & Responsive Web Design

author: Jason Scott
text:

course): <http://localhost:8080/ui5/desktop/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/inbox
/?sap-ui-xx-fakeOS=ipad>

Filter in a HTMLView
text: Hi , I have an HTML View and now I will apply a $filter on the List for my odata Modell . In the Documentation I doesn't found any parameter to set a the $filter parameter from HTMLView. Have someone any tipp or a workaround ? HTMLView
author: Daniel Rothmund
Frank Welz
text:
Hi Daniel,



in your aggregation "items" for the control _id="wfItems"_ you do the
aggregation binding via the attribute: _data-
items="{wf>/WorkflowTaskCollection}"._



To define a filter in a declarative view like html, you can do so by switching
on the "[extended syntax for calculated
fields](https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/CalcFields.html)" by
changing you configuration in the bootstrap:

<script id="sap-ui-bootstrap"

 ...

 data-sap-ui-xx-bindingSyntax="complex">

 </script>



Please note the following:

> ## Extended syntax for calculated Fields

>

> The extended syntax for calculated fields can be used in declarative views
such as html and xml views.

>

> Note: This functionality is marked as experimental and ...



Then you can define a filter like this:



data-items="{path: 'wf>/WorkflowTaskCollection', filters: {
path:'wf>/WorkflowTaskCollection/status', operator: 'EQ', value1:
'done'}}"



Here you have a filter with expects that the collection contains a field
"status" and you would like to select only those entities with the value
"done".



Regards, Frank
title: Re:Filter in a HTMLView

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi Frank,

Good job getting that far, I tried for quite a while and couldn't get close.



I have tried your solution with the ODataModel and cannot get it to work, I
will run you through what i have seen.



First off ODataModel.bindList expects an array of Filters

> sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel.prototype.bindList =
function(sPath,..aFilters..)

So I added an Array and it starts to process the filter

> <div id="tc" data-sap-ui-type="sap.m.TileContainer" data-
tiles="{path:'/Categories',

>

>  filters:[{path:'CategoryName',operator:'LE', value1:'C'}]}">



The issue i can see is that in sap.ui.model.odata.ODataListBinding-dbg

line 656

> sFilterParam = that._createFilterSegment(oFilter.sPath, oFilter.sOperator,
oFilter.oValue1, oFilter.oValue2, sFilterParam)

Should look like

> sFilterParam = that._createFilterSegment(oFilter.path, oFilter.operator,
oFilter.value1, oFilter.value2, sFilterParam);



From the pic below the object oFilter does not have attributes sPath,
sOperator, oValue1.

It has path, operator, value1

[![odata_filter_declaritve.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloa
dImage/2-14214399-248763/450-298/odata_filter_declaritve.png)](http://scn.sap.
com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-14214399-248763/odata_filter_declaritve.pn
g)

I extended module and made the change and it seems to work.



Cheers

jsp
title: Re:Filter in a HTMLView

author: Frank Welz
text:
Hi John,

thanks for going the last mile
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/happy.gif)

Regards, Frank
title: Re:Filter in a HTMLView

author: Daniel Rothmund
text:
Thanks Frank and John for your input. I give it a try at monday .....

What I must say I learn each day so much new things about SAPui5 .

SAPUI5 is a great framework for html5 applications , but I think sometime it
so complex and you have so much ways to solve your problem. (f.e HTML
/JSON/XML/JavaScript View)



I will collect my learning points from current project. And will then create a
blog about it ( I hope find the time for it)





Regards



Daniel
title: Re:Filter in a HTMLView

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi Daniel

Please do write a blog, there is a lot to know, for example I learnt from
another one of your questions that you can get SAP OSS support, never knew
that.



One of the things i like about SAPUI5 you mention above, there are many
different ways to solve a problem. Having many different techniques does mean
complexity in the undocumented features, but also means that on the whole
SAPUI5 is more extensible and not as opinionated as other libraries and
frameworks and that is a good thing.



cheers

jsp
title: Re:Filter in a HTMLView

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi Frank

![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/happy.gif) thanks for giving the
hint needed to get it working.



Here is gist for the fix [https://gist.github.com/jasper07/4e6f6f1bd1b5a441394
a,](https://gist.github.com/jasper07/4e6f6f1bd1b5a441394a) in my code i put
the script which contains the redefined createFilterParams after the
ODataListBinding module has been loaded.



I am not sure if this is the correct approach.



If Daniel wanted to implement the fix i suggest, what would be the recommended
SAP way to make the needed change?

title: Re:Filter in a HTMLView

author: Daniel Rothmund
text:
Hi,



thx john.



With your gist it works ! I have inserted a
jQuery.sap.require("sap.ui.model.odata.ODataListBinding"); in your coding at
the front ....



I looking forward what frank will say to your javascript.



Regards
title: Re:Filter in a HTMLView

author: Daniel Rothmund
title: Re:Filter in a HTMLView

author: John Patterson
title: Re:Filter in a HTMLView

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Daniel, John and Frank,



declaring filters in declarative (HTML-)Views is only supported starting with
version 1.14 which is due soon.

Currently the "fix" works because the filter information is still somehow
getting there, but not in the proper format (as Filter object).

In 1.14 the code which you fixed will work fine (which means your fix might
break it. The "instanceof" check may prevent the code from breaking, but the
best solution would be to remove the fix once you upgrade, or even to check
parseFloat(sap.ui.version).



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Filter in a HTMLView

author: Frank Welz
text:
Hi Daniel and John,

first of all, I'm not the one that can provide an official SAP answer to this
question ![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/sad.gif)

For that you still need to make use of SAP OSS support... .

But to my knowledge, the approach to overwrite the "erroneous" methods after
the bootstrap-tag looks quite good to me. Still, you need to make sure that as
soon as the problem is fixed, you need to remove you own coding.

Regards, Frank
title: Re:Filter in a HTMLView

How do i insert/append rows into a UI table.



Ex : I have one Table, Text field and one button.



My requirement is that like , if i enter something in the Textfield and press
Button the value in the field should be inserted into the table as a row.



I tried by adding the below code :



**var table = new sap.ui.table.Table("table1");**

**var row = new sap.ui.table.Row({ });**

**table.insertRow(row);**



getting error like insertRow or addRow cannot be used programatically .



Could any one help me in this ?





Thanks in advance.

Aisurya.**  
**
author: Aisurya Puhan
Graham Robinson
text:
The method is addRow - it works fine for me. If you still can't figure it our
maybe you should post a more complete example of your code.



Cheers

Graham Robbo
title: Re:How to append or insert rows into the UI table in UI5

**  // Create a vertical Layout**

**  {content: [label,text,table]});**





**v_layout.placeAt("content");**

** }**





**});**



===================================



**func_add_row** : is a customized function.

resources/sap/ui/table/demokit/Table.html).

JavaScript start-up API (ABAP Backend) response is slow
text:
Hi experts,



I dont know if it is the adequate place here, but I'd like to try...



For accessing user information from the SAP Backend the ABAP UI Addon provides
a JavaScript start-up API. Using this API, a SAPUI5 Applikation deployed on
the ABAP server can read several information about the backend user.



The good point is: It works! :-)

But the very first call of the JavaScript start-up API takes about 40 seconds
until a response returns. Other server responses (e.g. the SAPUI5 application
itself) are returned pretty fast, so I dont guess it is an infrastructure
problem.



Does anybody made similar experiences? What might be a reason for that?



Regards

Stefan

[![startup_api.jpg](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-141
90182-243921/450-65/startup_api.jpg)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/s
howImage/2-14190182-243921/startup_api.jpg)
author: Stefan Ltterle
DJ Adams
text:
Hi Stefan



That does seem a long time. I've just tested and recorded it here - the same
call, same depth, takes 135ms. I'm not saying that was the first time it was
called, but it's probably worth you doing some performance analysis on the
execution starting with HANDLE_REQUEST of /UI2/CL_START_UP_HANDLER.



cheers

dj
title: Re:JavaScript start-up API (ABAP Backend) response is slow

author: Stefan Ltterle
text:
Hi dj,



thanks for the answer.

It seems like the follwoing call takes a long time:

    
    
    lv_menu_info = lo_start_up_menu->serialize_menu_tree( i_unique_id = eval_request-unique_id
     i_depth = eval_request-depth
     ).



The corresponding JSON answer is

    
    
    menu: {
    id: "1",
    children: [ ]
    },



So, not a big list :-)



Could it be a problem, that it is a IDES system?



Regards

Stefan
title: Re:JavaScript start-up API (ABAP Backend) response is slow

author: DJ Adams
text:
Hi Stefan



A pleasant early afternoon found me with my laptop at my favourite coffee
place in Manchester (North Tea Power). I thought I'd analyse the call from my
end (it's in a demo SAP system) and show you what I found. Perhaps you want to
do the same?



To log and to performance analysis on the call (sorry if you know this
already), do this:



  1. Transaction SICF
  2. Find & select corresponding node in the hierarchy: /default_host/sap/bc/ui2/start_up
  3. Select Edit->Runtime Analysis->Activate
  4. Logon to the launch/homepage to cause the call from the browser to be made to that resource
  5. Have a look in transaction SE30 at the analysis



Here's what I see:

[![perf.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-14198439-2
45454/450-180/perf.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-14
198439-245454/perf.png)

Cheers

dj
title: Re:JavaScript start-up API (ABAP Backend) response is slow

author: Stefan Ltterle
text:
Hi Dj,



thank you, that was really helpful! I hope you will continue to drink power
tea and provide those good answers! :-)



I found out, that the duration of the call depends on the user. I could not
found not whats the difference between those users by now...



I'll keep this thread updated...



Regards

Stefan



User A:

[![start-up01.jpg](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-1420
7897-247452/450-155/start-
up01.jpg)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-14207897-247452
/start-up01.jpg)



User B:

[![start-up02.jpg](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-1420
7897-247466/450-155/start-
up02.jpg)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-14207897-247466
/start-up02.jpg)
title: Re:JavaScript start-up API (ABAP Backend) response is slow

author: Stefan Ltterle
text:
Hmmm, okay.... seems like User B has 0 entries in his user menu, so as a
fallback(?) the whole sap menu (about 75000 entries) is searched? Compared to
about 75 entries in the User A user menu.



When we assign a small user menu for User B then the call is as fast as for
User A. Interesting...
title: Re:JavaScript start-up API (ABAP Backend) response is slow

author: Knut Thies
text:
Hi Stefan,



this is an already known bug that will be fixed with SP5 of the SAP UI addon.

-> see also SAP Note 1852769.



Best regards

 Knut
title: Re:JavaScript start-up API (ABAP Backend) response is slow

author: Stefan Ltterle
text:
Thanks for the information, Knut.



P.S.: Seems like an internal Note...



Regards

Stefan
title: Re:JavaScript start-up API (ABAP Backend) response is slow
Change bootstrap theme depending on device type
text:
Hi,



depending on a device type, I would like to load another Theme
(Goldreflection) in the SAPUI5 bootstrap, instead of the sap_mvi Theme.

How would I do that?



Regards

Stefan
author: Stefan Ltterle
Stefan Ltterle
text:
Okay, got it...

    
    
    sap.ui.getCore().applyTheme("sap_goldreflection");



Regards

Stefan
title: Re:Change bootstrap theme depending on device type

json model cache problem
author: Shen Peng
Shen Peng
text:
Another thing maybe makes difference:



Use request the url, page redirected to logon page.(UME logon)

after logon, redirect to itself with post method.



The expert can explain?
title: Re:json model cache problem

author: Ian MacGregor
text:
Hi Shen,



If you are in control of your JSON generation, you could look at adding
appropriate HTTP headers to prevent caching.



<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_header_fields#Avoiding_caching>



So for example, if you were serving JSON from a SICF service handler, you
could try something like...



 server->response->set_header_field(  
 name = 'Cache-Control'  
 value = 'no-cache;no-store;max-age=0' ).



Cheers,

Ian
title: Re:json model cache problem

author: Shen Peng
text:
I find out that, some browser use cache, but

model.getProperty(..) will get undefined.



I set no cache for the model, but not work.
title: Re:json model cache problem

author: Ian MacGregor
text:
Hi Shen,



Not too sure I'm following when you say that model.getProperty(..) will get
undefined, or why no-cache for the HTTP header field cache-control of your
JSON would not be having the desired effect. Have you tried the technique
Andreas mentions below?



Cheers,

Ian
title: Re:json model cache problem

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Shen,



as Ian said. Caching is really something between browser and server, based on
the HTTP headers.



But if you are sure you NEVER want the cache, you can append a random URL
parameter (e.g. timestamp) to the URL which is ignored on server side. For the
browser it is then a different URL and it must access the server.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:json model cache problem

author: Shen Peng
text:
What does the method mean?

# Class sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel

**[forceNoCache](http://localhost:88/demokit/docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel.html#forceNoCache)**(force)



loadData(sURL, oParameters_?_, async_?_, sType_?_, bMerge_?_, bCache_?_,
mHeaders)



Load JSON-encoded data from the server using a GET HTTP request and store the
resulting JSON data in the model. Note: Due to browser security restrictions,
most "Ajax" requests are subject to the same origin policy, the request can
not successfully retrieve data from a different domain, subdomain, or
protocol.

Parameters:

{string}| **sURL**| A string containing the URL to which the request is sent.  
---|---|---  
{object|string}| **oParameters**_?, Default:_| A map or string that is sent to
the server with the request. Data that is sent to the server is appended to
the URL as a query string. If the value of the data parameter is an object
(map), it is converted to a string and url-encoded before it is appended to
the URL.  
{boolean}| **async**_?, Default: true_| By default, all requests are sent
asynchronous (i.e. this is set to true by default). If you need synchronous
requests, set this option to false. Cross-domain requests do not support
synchronous operation. Note that synchronous requests may temporarily lock the
browser, disabling any actions while the request is active.  
{string}| **sType**_?, Default: GET_| The type of request to make ("POST" or
"GET"), default is "GET". Note: Other HTTP request methods, such as PUT and
DELETE, can also be used here, but they are not supported by all browsers.  
{boolean}| **bMerge**_?, Default: false_| whether the data should be merged
instead of replaced  
{string}| **bCache**_?, Default: false_| force no caching if false. Default is
false  
{object}| **mHeaders**| An object of additional header key/value pairs to send
along with the request
title: Re:json model cache problem

author: Shen Peng
text:
Thank you.

It seems json model request is set to no cache.

But response is not.

So I changed the server side, add cache control to the response header.

Hopefully it will work,

Still testing.
title: Re:json model cache problem

How to read UI5 table of data in javascript
text:
UI5 Gurus,



I have created SAP Netweaver Gateway service to create Sales order and tested
from REST client and works fine. Now trying to build UI5 app for the same.
To build SO line items, i am using UI5 table control with all initial values
like the code below.



**var** aData = [

 {Item:

"", Material: "", Plant: "", Quantity: "", UoM: ""},

 {Item:

"", Material: "", Plant: "", Quantity: "", UoM: ""},

 {Item:

"", Material: "", Plant: "", Quantity: "", UoM: ""},

 {Item:

"", Material: "", Plant: "", Quantity: "", UoM: ""},

 {Item:

"", Material: "", Plant: "", Quantity: "", UoM: ""},

 ];

**var** SOItemsTable = **new** sap.ui.table.DataTable({

 id : "soitems",

 title : "Sales Order Items",

 width : "100%",

 visibleRowCount : 5,

 ExpandedVisibleRowCount : 20,

 selectionMode : sap.ui.table.SelectionMode.Single,

 editable : **true** });

when i click 'Create Sales Order' button, i am calling javascript function
[separate file in the project] where i want to read line items from this table
and pass it to Gateway service. How do i do that. Individual text elements
can be read like

var docdt_tf_var =
sap.ui.getCore().getControl("docdt_tf").getValue();



But how to read table control and pass it to gateway service.







Thanks
author: NAGARAJ APPAVOO
Frank Welz
text:
Hi Nagaraj,

your example above looks like you are binding a JSON model to the table. If
so, I would recomend to use "two-way binding" which enables you to get the
values of the table via the JSON model. For more information on data binding,
check <https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/UsageInApp.html> . The
"two-way binding" is on of the supported "Binding Modes" which are explained
there too.

Regards, Frank
title: Re:How to read UI5 table of data in javascript

author: DJ Adams
text:
Hi



Frank is correct, it would be a good idea to bind the table to the model two-
way.



But I wanted to add that if you are intending to post to a Gateway* service,
you probably want to have an OData model that you can use to cause the OData
CREATE operations to happen.



See <https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/ODataWrite.html> for
more details.



*Gateway, i.e. NetWeaver Gateway



cheers

dj
title: Re:How to read UI5 table of data in javascript

author: NAGARAJ APPAVOO
text:
Thanks a lot for quick response Frank & DJ. I will try and get back to
you. Thanks again.

But my question is that how can i show empty table for Sales Order items to

Thanks

\--Naga

title: Re:HTML View Aggregation of buttons

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Daniel,



the cause of the problem is the attribute name "data-contentRight".

HTML attributes are case-insensitive, hence camelCase, so property/aggregation
names need to be transformed to lower-case, separated by dashes (like CSS
property names in JavaScript where the dash needs to be transformed to
camelCase).



(Remark: IE9 seems to handle HTML attribute names case-sensitive, so in IE9
your code should probably work - accidentally)



This is documented here:

[https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/docs/guide/DeclarativeSupport.html 
](https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/docs/guide/DeclarativeSupport.html
)

"Important: If you need to define a property which contains upper case
characters you have to "escape" them - similar to CSS attributes - with a dash
character"



I now added the same remark to the place where aggregations are described.



See <http://jsbin.com/aku-htmlview-databinding-mobile-app/1/edit> for a
running example.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:HTML View Aggregation of buttons

author: John Patterson
text:
Well spotted.



<http://jsbin.com/uxogog/2/edit> your example using

    
    
     data-sap-ui-modules="sap.ui.core.plugin.DeclarativeSupport"



jsp

'_mHiddenAggregations' is about to be removed (with 1.12 latest). Hidden
aggregations like 'sap.m.SplitApp._navMaster' instead can be declared like
normal aggregations but with visibility:'hidden'.
author: Nadir LOUTFI
Frank Welz
text:
Hi Nadir,

to get more information on the SplitApp control just check the [Developer
Guide](https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/SplitApp.html) which
states the following:



> Therefore the SplitApp? control provides three different modes how to
display the master and detail view when the device is in portrait mode:

>

>   * **ShowHideMode**  
This is the default mode, which will hide the master view automatically when
the user switches the device into portrait mode.  
To show the master view the user can swipe right on the detail view or use the
button which will be placed in the header of the detail view.  
The master then will slide in from the right. The user can then chose another
list item, which will update the detail view and automatically hides the
master view again.

>   * **PopoverMode**  
This mode will place the master view inside a Popover, which can be opened via
the button in the header of the detail view.

>   * **StretchCompressMode**  
This is the only mode where master is shown in both the portrait and landscape
mode of the device. Hence the detail view will have less space when in portait
mode.



You might want to take a look at the
[DemoApp](https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/DemoApps.html) for
the SplitApp too.



Regards, Frank

Trouble loading table 2 based on a row selected in table 1
text:
Hi,

I am facing some trouble while loading a secondary table. I have explained the
scenario below.



**Scenario:**



Business Partner (Header level details) which consists of business parter
details. Each business partner have many contacts, business partner's contacts
is displayed in a table (table 1). Similarly each contact of a business
partner have many multiple contactNumbers. We want to display contactNumbers
for each contact selected (from table 1) as another table (Table 2) and want
to refresh the contactNumber table on selection  
of a new contact (in table 1).BusinessPartner s displayed in a dialog for
appropriate BusinessPartner selected and dialog has three elements Header
field collection (in a Matrix Layout), Contacts table (table 1) and
contactNumbers table (table 2). Header and table 1 is loaded on load of dialog
screen, contents of table 2 should be displayed based on row selected in table
1.



**Issue:**



Data in table 2 is not getting displayed for rows other than the first row
from table 1 (first contact in table 1), irrespective of the order of row
selection in table 1. We traced Gateway calls and found appropriate calls
being made to Gateway for all selections (row 2 or 3 from Table 1) and yet UI
is not able to display any data (displays no data) for any other row selection
from table 1. And also Gateway service is checked to be working fine for all
calls to fetch ContactNumbers for various contacts. We tried various options
like refreshing the binding, attaching table 2 to UI etc. but none of them is
working.



**Code Snippet:**



oTableBPContacts.attachRowSelect(**function**(rEvent)



{



var currentRowContext = rEvent.getParameter("rowContext");



oTableBPContactNumbers.bindRows(currentRowContext
+"/BusinessPartnerContactNumber");



});







Kindly suggest a solution for this problem.



Cheers

Bijentimala K
author: Bijentimala Keisham
Frank Welz
title: Re:Trouble loading table 2 based on a row selected in table 1

author: Bijentimala Keisham
text:
Hi Frank,



My problem got solved using the setBindingContext method. Thanks a lot.



Cheers,

Bijentimala
title: Re:Trouble loading table 2 based on a row selected in table 1

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi Bijentimala

if you are trying to set context via the path try

    
    
    oTableBPContactNumbers.bindRows(currentRowContext.getPath( )+"/BusinessPartnerContactNumber");



hth

Bijentimala K

How to Compute logic for Arithmetic Expression in a string variable?
text:
Hello all,





I am performing Arithmetic Operations on my Odata service and When I want to
perform these operations dynamically in my Data Provider Class Ext(DPC_EXT), I
am unable to do as the Query Operation is returning the Expression into a
string variable, so I have to compute this expression dynamically and return
the expected result based on this operation.





For Eg: My string variable consists of lv_str = ((Price + (( 6 + 6)/5)) >
800))

 Where price is Field of my Internal Table.



I have to compute this expression dynamically and return the records which
have price greater than 800...



The lv_str variable changes based on the Query Operation every time...





Can anyone please help me on this...





Thanks in Advance

Harsha
author: Harsha Vardhan
John Patterson
text:
Hi Harsha

You wrote this request in the UI5 forum, probably best to ask in one of the
Gateway Forums.



Interesting question though.



I had to do something similar last year, added query string operations which
weren't supported by Gateway,introducing un-supported syntax meant the whole
query didn't get parsed into filter select options and i had to re-write the
ABAP code myself to parse the query string into select options.



see <https://scn.sap.com/thread/3170195><https://scn.sap.com/message/13379559#
13379559> this is an early iteration, I think the code references the old
filter expression parser, i had to use a visitor pattern and a good set of
tests to ensure i didn't keep breaking things. Also had to look at other
Producer libraries to see how they parsed the operations eg OData4J and
Jaydata.



hth

jsp



UPDATE: you may want to check
<http://www.odata.org/documentation/odata-v2-documentation/uri-
conventions/#41_System_Query_Options> section on Arithmetic Operators, I think
you should be using 'gt' and 'add' and not '>' and '+'.



If Gateway doesn't support the operators you need look at <https://bitbucket.o
rg/fihtisham/odata4j/commits/e61518886b41c982567b99716427091b142c8e9c> the
OData4j commit that adds "support for arithmetic operations in filter, with
test cases (JSON)"
title: Re:How to Compute logic for Arithmetic Expression in a string variable?

SAPUI5 Fiori
text:
I was just looking at the SAPUI5 Fiori demo apps in the latest release of the
demo kit here:



<http://veui5infra.dhcp.wdf.sap.corp:8080/demokit/#test-
resources/sap/m/demokit/demokit-home/index.html>



I would like to create a local copy of the epm approve purchase orders app
(or any other app). I have tried downloading the webpage and pulled the files
from the 1.12.1 SAPUI5 demokit but cant get it all working. I have edited the
html file to properly point to sap-ui-core.js, etc but i cant get it to work
correctly (its just a static webpage that does nothing, even when running on
apache tomcat) is there any way of acquiring the 1.13.2 demokit or to easily
be able to download & run the app locally? I have tried many things and am
not sure what im doing wrong or if its even possible. All the files appear to
download correctly. I will include some screenshots of my modified static
webpage app and file directory.



Any help is greatly appreciated!
author: Nader Sabra
DJ Adams
text:
Hi Nader



I'm afraid us mere mortals cannot access the URL you give, above - it's
internal to SAP, so we can't really see what you're looking at.



However, even in the publically available 1.12.1 release of SAPUI5, there is a
really nice Fiori-style (sap_bluecrystal themed) inbox demo with Leave
Requests and Purchase Orders apps. In the past I've successfully managed to
mod and run these apps locally.



<https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/test-
resources/sap/m/demokit/inbox/index.html>



Is that what you're after, perhaps?



cheers

dj
title: Re:SAPUI5 Fiori

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Nader,



it looks like you used the browser's "save as" functionality to get a copy of
this web app. This usually does not work (try it with Gmail!) because browsers
modify all sorts of content and links and HTML which is normally created
dynamically is now part of the HTML file etc.



As DJ wrote, the demokit is available as web app ("war" for Java servers,
"zip" for any other web server) and the app you mention is contained in it.

As opposed to the publicly available version 1.12 what you are seeing has been
developed further a bit. Version 1.14 is being wrapped up right now, so it
should soon be available on SDN etc.



Please note that there is also an internal UI5 community at
<https://community.wdf.sap.corp/groups/phoenix/content> where we can share all
the internal links to monthly drops, nightly builds and the Git repository. If
you repeat your question there, you can get the current state of everything.
(I wish this was possible publicly soon...)



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:SAPUI5 Fiori

author: DJ Adams
text:
Of course, I knew I'd seen it somewhere before: "phoenix". Perhaps the reason
behind the logo detail?



[![https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/resources/sap/ui/core/mimes/logo/icoon
ly_white_100x80.png](https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/resources/sap/ui/cor
e/mimes/logo/icoonly_white_100x80.png)](https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/r
esources/sap/ui/core/mimes/logo/icoonly_white_100x80.png)



Anyway, whatever you can do to help share internal SAPUI5 stuff, more power to
you, Andreas!
title: Re:SAPUI5 Fiori

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Yes, absolutely: the logo comes from that earlier codename of UI5.



("Phoenix" was chosen as reference to the first human spaceship reaching warp
speed in Star Trek 8: <http://en.memory-alpha.org/wiki/Phoenix>. Why? Because
"Lightspeed" is the name of the current HTML rendering layer of Web Dynpro and
warp speed is sort of the next thing after light speed...)



Andreas
title: Re:SAPUI5 Fiori

author: Nader Sabra
text:
Hey Andreas,



Is there a specific way to send this using gmail or are you using an extension
to extract the webpage?
title: Re:SAPUI5 Fiori

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi,



sorry, I did not intend to suggest that you try downloading with gmail. What I
was trying to say is that downloading a page with the browser's "save as"
functionality will in most cases not result in a working web application on
your hard disk.

You could try the same way of saving with all kinds of web applications (like
gmail or the SAP portal or ebay or amazon) and it will not work for any of
them.



Andreas
title: Re:SAPUI5 Fiori
SAPUI5 Blackberry 10 issue
author: Christiaan Bredenkamp
Ian MacGregor
text:
Hi Christiaan,



I think you may find that "NEW" and "SEND" are not valid HTTP request methods.
Below is an extract from the [SAPUI5 documentation](https://sapui5.netweaver.o
ndemand.com/sdk/#docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel.html#loadData)
(which is also stated in the [jQuery.ajax
doc](http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax/)):



_The type of request to make ("POST" or "GET"), default is "GET". Note: Other
HTTP request methods, such as PUT and DELETE, can also be used here, but they
are not supported by all browsers._



These links may help to explain further:

<http://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_httpmethods.asp>

<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer>



Cheers,

Ian
title: Re:SAPUI5 Blackberry 10 issue

author: Christiaan Bredenkamp
text:
Thanks Ian



Although you can use any descriptive name for your HTTP request method, it is
not always supported supported.



In my case BlackBerry does not support it.



Below is a helpful link if you want to test your browsers capability:



<http://www.mnot.net/javascript/xmlhttprequest/>
title: Re:SAPUI5 Blackberry 10 issue

text:

details to sap gateway service using SAPUI5  Application project in Eclipse
tool..

title: Re:How to built and consume a registration form service in SAPUI5 application.

author: DJ Adams
text:
Hi Ravi



Ok, so for the form design itself, there are many controls which you might
want to use, they are documented in the Controls section of the official
SAPUI5 documentation which is available here:



<https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/#content/Overview.html>



In fact, as well as the Controls section, I'd recommend you read the Developer
Guide also as it gives some info on Experimental OData Write support
<https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/ODataWrite.html> which you
may want to use for your form submission.



If you're new to SAPUI5 then the examples in the SDK are really good to get
started with, and I also suggest you clone the sapui5bin repository from
Github <http://github.com/qmacro/sapui5bin> and have a feel for how it fits
together.



cheers

author: Tobias Arnold

title: Re:Jquery XML read

author: Tobias Arnold
title: Re:Jquery XML read

author: Ben Wolf
text:
Hi Tobias,



I would suggest using Franks solution.

Since JQuery is inluded in SAPUI5 anyway, you should use the benefits it
offers to you.



Btw: With your coding you start an asynchronous request, which means that the
application will wait for your request until it's finished (see
<http://www.w3.org/TR/XMLHttpRequest/> at 4.6.1).

Using a callback function like in Franks example is the "cleaner" way (until
you really need asynchronous requests.)



If you want to learn more about ajax requests with JQuery I would recommned to
read this:

<http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax/>



Kind regards,

Ben

Server-side example for the FileUploader UI element
text:
Hi All,



SAP only provide the example code for the client side of the FileUploader

sample for the servlet. I'm using a Java Servlet to handle the server-side
processing. Has anyone got a simple example that they are willing to share?

author: Richard Tucker
John Patterson
text:
Hi Richard

If you look in the demokit you'll see SAPUI5 uses commons-
fileupload-1.2.1.jar, you can get the source from
<http://commons.apache.org/fileupload/>



update: if you are using the eclipse plugin, goto the plugin directory and
find the utils jar

C:\eclipse-jee-juno-win32-x86_64\eclipse\plugins\com.sap.ui5.utils_1.4.3.jar

in here you will find the com.sap.ui5.fileupload package which has the classes
for the service and FileUploadIntrospectorServlet used by the
FileUploadIntrospector control which renders the upload check.

eg. <https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#content/Controls/ValueHolders/
FileUploader.html>



Cheers

$count request does not send the custom headers specified in the oDATA Model
text:
Hi,

 Our oDATA service requires a set of custom HTTP header key value pairs
to be sent along with each and every the oDATA request. These custom headers
are required for an additional or shall I say custom authentication
validation. While creating the oDATA Model in SAPUI5 1.12 we have provided the
custom headers in the constructor of the oDATA. These custom headers are sent
in the $metadata request and also when the service is bound to a table by
using Table.bindRows() method.



 But the custom HTTP headers are not sent in the $count request and as a
consequence this $count request fails. Please see the screen shot given below
which shows that $metadata request succeeds and so does the
"BankCollection?$skip=0&stop=110&$inline" request. But notice the
$count request which has failed, this $count request is given in RED.

[![odata service.jpg](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-1
4158819-237721/450-281/odata+service.jpg)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServ
let/showImage/2-14158819-237721/odata+service.jpg)



 Observe the custom HTTP headers key-value pairs,
"MyCustomKey:MyCustomValue", highlighted in orange, getting sent in the
$metadata request

[![odata service 1.jpg](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2
-14158819-237723/450-253/odata+service+1.jpg)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/Jive
Servlet/showImage/2-14158819-237723/odata+service+1.jpg)



 Also observe that the custom HTTP header key-value pairs
"MyCustomKey:MyCustomValue", highlighted in orange, are sent as a part of the,
"BankCollection?$skip=0&stop=110&$inline" request, i.e. when the
Table.bindRows() method is invoked

[![odata service 3.jpg](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2
-14158819-237724/450-251/odata+service+3.jpg)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/Jive
Servlet/showImage/2-14158819-237724/odata+service+3.jpg)



 But observe the HTTP headers sent with the $count request, as given in the
screen shot below. As one can see the custom HTTP Header key-value pairs are
not sent along with it.

[![odata service 2.jpg](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2
-14158819-237734/450-175/odata+service+2.jpg)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/Jive
Servlet/showImage/2-14158819-237734/odata+service+2.jpg)





 Why are the custom HTTP Headers not sent along with $count request? Also
how can we send custom HTTP Headers along with $count request?

________________________________________

Regards

Amardeep Verma
author: Amardeep Verma
John Patterson
text:
Hi Amardeep



if you don't need to know the count call set oModel( ).setCountSupported(
false )



else, take a look at the following method which i believe does the count.



sap.ui.model.odata.ODataListBinding.prototype._getLength

<https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/resources/sap/ui/model/odata
/ODataListBinding-dbg.js>



the headers aren't included in the jQuery.ajax call, not sure why, they are in
the request from the model if you need them.



you could extend the method (locally) in the list binding to include headers

eg.

    
    
    jQuery.ajax({
     url: oRequest.requestUri,
     async: oRequest.async,
     cache: this.oModel.bCache,
     headers: oRequest.headers, //add this line
     username: oRequest.user,
     password: oRequest.password,
     success: _handleSuccess,
     error: _handleError
    });



Cheers

John P
title:
Re:$count request does not send the custom headers specified in the oDATA
Model

author: Amardeep Verma
text:
Hi,

 Yes I set the

    
    
    setCountSupported( false) 

on the ODATAModel Object and the $count request was not sent.



 This is a very bad hack. I was hoping that SAPUI5 will take care of
sending all the custom headers that I set in the constructor of ODATAModel
Object. Before we go live I will raise an support request with SAP and try to
get this rectified.

_______________________

Thanks

Amardeep Verma
title:
Re:$count request does not send the custom headers specified in the oDATA
Model

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi Amardeep



Glad you got it working.



Really depends on which definition of hack you are using.



Out of interest what is the requirement you are meeting by mandating custom
headers on GET calls and how are you handling them on the Gateway side, sounds
interesting.



Cheers

John P
title:
Re:$count request does not send the custom headers specified in the oDATA
Model

author: Amardeep Verma
text:
Hi,

 We are using a reverse proxy in our environment. That reverse proxy
requires a certain set of Key-Value pairs set in the HTTP header for each and
every request to be processed. If these key-value pairs are not sent then the
request is not forwarded to the intended server for processing.



 In the Gateway one of the key value pairs is read and is used in
processing of Request. One of the parameters that we plan to send will have
certain attributes of the mobile device. While in the UI we are able to
hide/shield certain fields from the customer based on the device type, we
would like to stop the data associated with these hidden/shielded fields,
being sent to the client at all.

 Our main aim was to reduce the network bandwidth, as we plan to use this
in places where cellular network is either weak or is expensive. We would like
to send this "metadata" (not to be confused with the oDATA Metadata) on every
request, so that we have a very light session.

_____________________________

Regards

Amardeep Verma
title:
Re:$count request does not send the custom headers specified in the oDATA
Model
Onclick Action on Carousel image
author: Zaghman Arshad
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Zaghman,



what you are doing with this code is trying to register an event handler to
the "click" event of the commons.Carousel. However, that control does not have
such an event. This is why nothing happens.



You seem to be displaying images inside, so are these sap.ui.commons.Image
controls? Those do have a "press" event and you can attach to that one
similarly as above.



Otherwise you can also listen to native browser events:

oCarousel.attachBrowserEvent("click", function()...});

But in this case you need to think about touch and keyboard interaction
yourself. The "press" event of the Image handles this for you automatically.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Onclick Action on Carousel image

author: Zaghman Arshad
title: Re:Onclick Action on Carousel image

author: Frank Welz
text:
Hi Zaghman,



if you follow your option 1, you can get a reference of the image either by
"inspecting" the event parameter that you named "oControlEvent" or by going
via the sap.ui.getCore().byId() function. (In addition you could try if "this"
works too, but I'm not sure...)



In your example, all event handlers have a reference to the local variable
"img". And after the for loop is finished, "img" points to the last image.



Regards, Frank
title: Re:Onclick Action on Carousel image

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi,



as Frank wrote: the local variable "img" is constantly being updated in your
loop. This is a JS language speciality. You could put it into a closure to
overcome this tricky situation.

Or as Frank wrote: attach the SAME function to all images and I also think
"this" inside the event handler should be the image control, so it would be
very easy to continue from there.



In option 2 the third parameter is optional, you can just omit it.

IF you set it, whatever you give there will be the "this" inside the event
handler.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Onclick Action on Carousel image

author: Zaghman Arshad
title: Re:Onclick Action on Carousel image

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Ok, but in this case be aware that the ID might be NOT an image ID, but the ID
of something else, e.g. parts of the Carousel.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Onclick Action on Carousel image

author: Zaghman Arshad
title: Re:Onclick Action on Carousel image

Table Paginator Issue
text:
Hello Guys,





I have a doubt regarding the sap.ui.table.NavigationMode.Paginator object used
for navigation for table. I do not know how can i access the page event for
this Paginator object.





The paginator control which is normally used is



var oPaginator = new sap.ui.commons.Paginator("paginator2",{



page : function(oEvent) {alert('Page changed);}

 });







But for Tables the Paginator Class used is
sap.ui.table.NavigationMode.Paginator hence the methods and propperties are
not accessable directly





Please Help!!!!





Regards



Arush
author: Bharat Tiwari
Frank Welz
text:
Hi Arush,

could you state the reason why you would like to access the Paginator?

Regards, Frank
title: Re:Table Paginator Issue

author: Arush Taneja
text:
Hi,



I wish to perform some action say select a particular row of the table (1st
Row) of the page everytime a new page is selected



Regards



Arush
title: Re:Table Paginator Issue

author: Frank Welz
text:
Hi Arush,



I'm not aware of a table event that you could attach a handler to for getting
called when the page
changes.![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/sad.gif)



You could register a handler to the "click" event for the whole table via the
function "attachBrowserEvent". But then you would need to find out by
"inspecting" the event object if and which "part" of the paginator has been
clicked on... .



Regards, Frank
title: Re:Table Paginator Issue

title: How to find child view from controller and replace it with new content
text:
Hi All,



I am using sapui5 MVC of version 1.12.1  
I have one parent View which consist of two child views

say ChildView1 and ChildView2 (both are jsView.)

On click on childView1 I want to find and replace content of ChildView2





How to find specific child view from controller? and then replace that child
view with new childView





Any help is appreciated.  
Thanks in advance
author: Sanket Pathre
Frank Welz
text:
Hi Sanket,



instead of replacing the content of a view, I would recommend to use an
application frame like the [shell control
](https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#test-
resources/sap/ui/ux3/demokit/Shell.html)for a desktop application. There you
replace the content of the association "content".

If you are building a mobile app, please take a look at the [Best Practice for
Building Mobile Applications](https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/
guide/BestPractice.html). And for tips on how to do the navigation, you might
want to look at the[ Demo Apps
](https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/DemoApps.html)esp. the
one for Navigation.



Regards, Frank
title: Re:How to find child view from controller and replace it with new content

SAPUI5 + NW Gateway Localization // Internationalization
text:
Dear Gurus,



I'm currently searching for a solution regarding the **i18n.properties** file
in SAPUI5.



Actually I have a GW OData Model built on transaction 'SEGW' using a DDIC
structure from within the ABAP Dictionary.



In my Eclipse I built a sample SAP NetWeaver Gateway -> Starter Application
Project, which generates automatically my i18n.properties file in 1 language.



Is there a possibility to automatically generate the i18n.properties file in
another language - thus, the newly generated file should use the information
stored in the ABAP dictionary.



Thanks,



Konstantin
author: Konstantin Kletzander
Frank Welz
text:
Hi Konstantin,

if you would like to access the texts from the ABAP dictionary and use them as
labels on the UI5 controls, you might consider using the [getServiceMetadata](
https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.model.odata
.ODataModel.html#getServiceMetadata) function of the oData model. The
resulting object e.g. contains the field labels in the language of your
backend user. From that object you can create a JSON model and bind it to the
labels of the controls without the need to explicitly create property files.

Regards, Frank
title: Re:SAPUI5 + NW Gateway Localization // Internationalization

searching for the method similar as getSelectedRow in SAP UI5
text:
Hi,



I am searching for a method similar as getSelectedRow/getSelectedRows on table
of SAP UI5. I checked the help as well as the code, could not find out a
similar method. Can anyone help me to get the method which does the same?(I
don't want to use events on row selection to capture these values). Please
share your suggestions and guidance.



Regards,

Sukanya
author: sukanya mullick
Ian MacGregor
text:
Hi Sukanya,



Have you checked out [getSelectedIndex](https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/
sdk/#docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.table.Table.html#getSelectedIndex) (or [getSelect
edIndices](https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.
table.Table.html#getSelectedIndices) for multiple row selection)? These would
give you the selected index and then you could use getRows and work with the
selected index of this result...something like this...



    
    
    selectedIndex = oTable.getSelectedIndex();
    rows = oTable.getRows();
    console.log(rows[selectedIndex]);



Cheers,

Ian
title: Re:searching for the method similar as getSelectedRow in SAP UI5

author: Ian MacGregor
text:
Hi Sukanya,



On second thoughts you probably want to get the data from your model rather
than getRows as getRows will only return the visible rows in your table and
selectedIndex represents the index of all your data.



Cheers,

Ian
title: Re:searching for the method similar as getSelectedRow in SAP UI5

author: sukanya mullick
text:
Hi Ian,



Thanks for your reply. These does not help when I need to read selected UI
data. All these fails when UI table is Sorted , Filtered or Column Shuffled.



Please provide suggestion.



Regards,

Sukanya
title: Re:searching for the method similar as getSelectedRow in SAP UI5

author: Ian MacGregor
text:
Hi Sukanya,



You could try using the [getContextByIndex](https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.
com/sdk/#docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.table.Table.html#getContextByIndex) method, I
think this should be able to refer you back to the correct data in your model,
even after your table is sorted, filtered or column shuffled...something like
this:



    
    
    selectedContext = oTable.getContextByIndex(oTable.getSelectedIndex());
    myValue = oModel.getProperty("myval",selectedContext); 
    console.log(myValue);



Regards,

Ian
title: Re:searching for the method similar as getSelectedRow in SAP UI5

author: sukanya mullick
text:
Hi Ian,



Thanks for the code. It worked. This is helping me to come out of PHP - Drupal
mode to SAP UI5 mode ![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/happy.gif)



Regards,

Sukanya
title: Re:searching for the method similar as getSelectedRow in SAP UI5

data is not getting bind to label. As soon as Add control in view it bind

**

toggle(show/hide) as I click on anchor tag

title: Re:Unable to bind Value in ToolPopup Control

author: Manuel Lopez
text:
Hi Sanket,



I had the same problem and I solved it setting the data context to the
ToolPopUp ID in the controller:



sap.ui.getCore().byId("ToolPopUP-content-ID").setBindingContext(dataContext);



And now the ToolPopUp shows data correctly.



I hope it helps.



Regards.
title: Re:Unable to bind Value in ToolPopup Control

author: Sanket Pathre
text:
Hi Manuel  
Thanks for your reply  
I figure out it by some other mean.  
In my case I have not added that control in View. Because of which label is
not getting bind to Model which is applied to view.  
I added ToolPopUP control in View and set its parent element display to none
by CSS class.



But still wonder if control is not added in view then how it is
toggle(show/hide) as I click on anchor tag.
title: Re:Unable to bind Value in ToolPopup Control

author: Michael Baginski
text:
Hmm.. the way over the data-model seems plausible to me.

This works with a small modification/remark, that the data object is



mytable.getModel().getData() .modelData, because the data-Array itself is
stored in

{"modeldata":[{"data":"value"},...]}



@Bibhas Das:

I didn't try this out, but I could imagine, that it does not work for my case,
because:

if your model has - let say 30 rows, and the table property
"visibleRowCount:" ist set to 10, then the function oTable.getRows() returns
an array with 10 entries; so I think adressing a row beyond 10, you will
receive an arrayIndexOutOfBounds.exception or else.

For the case in the screens it works fine.



I learned that whatever you do globally to a table, you have to go over the
model and not the Table itself.. (that's a little sad..)



Greetings,

Michael

Welz.

Unable to select sap.ui.core.HTML-content via $()
text:
Hello everyone,



i'm working on a mobile application based on sapui5. Now i need a canvas for
drawing graphics (no images).

So i've created a new HTML-Control:

**var** htmlCanvas = **new** sap.ui.core.HTML({

 id : "htmlCanvas", // sap.ui.core.ID

 content : "<canvas id=\"myCanvas\" height=\"700\" width=\"700\"
style=\"border: solid lightgrey 1px\"></canvas>",

 preferDOM : **true**, // boolean

 sanitizeContent : **false**, // boolean

 afterRendering : [ **function**(oEvent) {} ]

});

and set it within my page.



Unfortunately in my controller i can't access/get it with:

**var** myCanvas = $("#myCanvas");

console.log(myCanvas);



Could you please help?

Thanks in advance,

Andreas
author: Andreas Zollner
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Andreas,



WHEN do you try to do "$("#myCanvas");"?

The HTML might not exist yet. Just instantiating a control does not instantly
create the HTML and put it into the body.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Unable to select sap.ui.core.HTML-content via $()

author: Andreas Zollner
text:
Hi Andreas,



thanks for your reply.

i'm developing in google chrome and in the web console the canvas exists:[![Un
benannt.PNG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-14165686-2
38939/640-35/Unbenannt.PNG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/
2-14165686-238939/Unbenannt.PNG)

I'm instantiating the canvas/html-control in the createContent-method of my
view and trying to get it in the beforeShow-method of my view which calls a
controller-method (should be fine?).

The only way to get the canvas is to handle the click event and give the
canvas-reference to another method.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Unable to select sap.ui.core.HTML-content via $()

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Andreas,



beforeShow is fired even before the View HTML is created. Try afterShow
instead.



You could also try to register a zero timeout to access the canvas before any
slide-in animation or whatever is happening, but it's a better idea to do
canvas stuff only once everything is rendered and settled down...



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Unable to select sap.ui.core.HTML-content via $()

author: Andreas Zollner
text:
Hi Andreas,



many thanks for your reply! I've tried it with the onAfterShow-method of my
view.

Didn't work either... I changed $("#myCanvas") to
document.getElementById("myCanvas") and it's working fine. Thought jQuery
would do the same.



Best regards

Andreas
title: Re:Unable to select sap.ui.core.HTML-content via $()

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Umm... that's really strange, because as you wrote $("#...") should do
exactly the same! It _does _do the same.

I think there is something else going wrong... But good to hear it works now.



Andreas
title: Re:Unable to select sap.ui.core.HTML-content via $()
SAP UI5 Charts in a WebDynPro iFrame
text:
Hi All,



Ours is a Java WebDynPro based application and one of the WebDynPro screens
has the requirement to display UI5 charts on it.



So far, we have beemn using applets, which are embedded inside an iFrame on
the WebDynPro page.



Now, we need to achieve the same by showing the new SP UI5 Charts on that
screen.



The problem is that the **UI5 Charts are designed to run in the
'Compatibility' Mode on IE9**, whereas, the **WebDynPro pages are to be run in
the 'Quirks' Mode **of IE9.



Due to this conflict, if we keep the browser in Quirks Mode, then Charts do
not render and if we run it in 'Compatible' mode, then the webdynpro page gets
distorted.



How to get both running together?
author: Rutika Bodas

title: Makit Column Chart - Two Values per Category
text:
Hey guys!



We are developing a mobile ui5 application based on a desktop application.
With VIZ we easily define two measures within a column chart and the result is
two columns per "dimension". With makit it is a little bit different and i
thought this will do it:



var oChart = new sap.makit.Chart("Chart_r1",{

  height: "100%",

  width: "100%",

  type : sap.makit.ChartType.Column,

  showRangeSelector : false,

  category : new sap.makit.Category({ column :
"regionCategory", displayName : "Region" }),

  values : [new sap.makit.Value({ expression : "revenueValue",
format : "currency", displayName : "Availability" }),

  new sap.makit.Value({ expression : "lossValue",
format : "currency", displayName : "Loss"}) ],

  categoryAxis : new sap.makit.CategoryAxis({
displayLastLabel: true }),

  valueBubble : new sap.makit.ValueBubble({

  style: sap.makMaiit.ValueBubbleStyle.Top,

  showCategoryText: true

  }),

 });



 oChart.addColumn(new
sap.makit.Column({name:"regionCategory", value:"{REGION}"}));

 oChart.addColumn(new
sap.makit.Column({name:"revenueValue", value:"{AVAILABILITY}",
type:"number"}));

 oChart.addColumn(new sap.makit.Column({name:"lossValue",
value:"{LOSS}", type:"number"}));

 oChart.setModel(oModel);



However, it only shows the first column (revenue) and i have no clue why.
Further, i didn't found an example for a column chart with two columns expect
the "Multi-Series Chart" but i can't adapt it to our case.

Thanks!
author: Manu Schmitt
Bibhas Das
text:
Hi Manu Schmitt,



Please see the below example.



[![testUI5.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-1416717
6-239259/566-380/testUI5.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImag

Unable to trigger a click-event in onAfterRendering
text:
Hello everyone,



In our desktop application I have built the main navigation using button
controls, where each button loads a defined view. My idea is that the default
view is loaded by triggering a click-event on the first button once the page
has loaded. Unfortunately, it's not working as expected.



The basic code I am running is:



``

`onAfterRendering : function() {`

` $('#navigation button').eq(0).click();`

`},`



After which nothing happens. What confuses me though is that if I run:



`onAfterRendering : function() {`

` console.log(``$('#navigation button').eq(0), ``$('#navigation
button').eq(0).click);`

`},`



I get exactly what you'd expect; the right button and the function reference.



`

Object[button#__button0.sapUiBtn] function()

`



So the button is present in the DOM, it can be found and the function
click(...) exists. Furthermore, if I run the code in e.g. Firebug's console,
the event is triggered just fine.



What am I missing here?
author: R Vereijken
Ian MacGregor
text:
Hi R J,



It looks like you may be wanting to trigger the press event of the UI5 button
control...one option you could try is using the below code in your
onAfterRendering function...



    
    
    sap.ui.getCore().byId( $('#navigation button').eq(0).attr("id")).firePress();



Hope this helps.



Regards,

Ian
title: Re:Unable to trigger a click-event in onAfterRendering

author: R Vereijken
text:
Hi Ian,



that does help, thanks.



Kind regards,

R J

Change in Table-control are lost after scrolling
author: Ben Wolf
Jan Mller
text:
Hi Ben,



I think this is because the oData Model doesn't support the two-way-
bindingmode, but the JSON Model does.

The two-way-bindingmode describes that changes will be applied in the
direction from model to view and vice versa.



You can look it up here:

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/UsageInApp.html>



Regards,

Jan

soon...

author: Ben Wolf
text:
Hi guys and thanks a lot for your answers.



I've just set up a local dev system and encountered this error again.

It's quite easy to reproduce - you just need to create an element like this



    
    
    var test = new sap.ui.commons.form.FormContainer("F1C2",{});



and the failing request will appear. (So I dont't think it's an translation or
ajax issue...)



I'm using the latest beta from here: <http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-
center/front-end>



Thanks again for any help!
title: Re:messagebundle_de_DE.properties not found

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Ben,



your browser is apparently set to the content language "de-DE". This is why
UI5 attempts to load the respective language file. (containing translatable
texts in UI5 controls, but the same mechanism is also used for translatable
application texts)

UI5 is translated to 37 languages, but there is only "de", _not _"de-DE", "de-
AT" etc. So the fallback mechanism should kick in and
"messagebundle_de.properties" should be loaded properly. (In case of not-
available languages it would fall back to English.)

Does this happen?



(I assume you did not deploy the WAR files, but the static version of UI5?)



So basically the 404 is expected and no reason to worry (except that it adds a
useless request, of course...).



To avoid the useless request, at least on Java servers (not sure about the
ABAP implementation) the optional server-side component of UI5 (the resource
handler) will do this fallback logic on the server and directly serve the best
suitable file even if a non-existing laguage is requested.



Does this clarify what's happening?



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:messagebundle_de_DE.properties not found

author: R Vereijken
title: Re:messagebundle_de_DE.properties not found
Latest version of SAPUI5 for use in PhoneGap
text:
Hi,



I am looking for a location where I could find an up-to-date version of SAPUI5
to deploy it in PhoneGap.



It seems like we can only find the latest version of the framework via the
[hana tools update site](https://tools.hana.ondemand.com), as the evaluation
package available on [SDN](http://www.sdn.sap.com/irj/sdn/go/portal/prtroot/do
cs/webcontent/uuid/c08465d5-b833-2f10-e59d-f67a5cb54d2f) is not really up-to-
date (1.12.1 from SDN whereas 1.12.2 is available from
tools.hana.ondemand.com/).



My problem is that I would like to have a direct access to the js files in
order to copy them in my PhoneGap app, but all I can find is the lib embedded
in the jars of the eclipse plugin. Debug files seems to be missing (on
purpose?) and I would really appreciate to avoid unzipping every single jar
file...



Is there a way to find those js files directly, as in the evaluation package
(but always up-to-date) ?



Regards,

Jerome
author: Jerome Morino
Jan Thomas Nygaard
text:
Hi Jerome,

1.12.2 can be downloaded through SAP Note 1865808

1.12.3 is available through note 1871371

SAP Note 1747308 is the central note and contains installation guide (pdf for
download in bottom of note) and links to all the versions of sapui5.



In the installation guide it says you can also downlod from SAP marketplace
like this:

_For the UI add-on installation, download SAPUI5 from SAP Service Marketplace
as follows:_

_1\. _

_Launch the SAP Software Download Center on the SAP Service Marketplace ([http
://ser](http://service.sap.com/swdc)vice.sap.com/swdc)._<http://service.sap.co
m/swdc>

_2\. _

_Search for SAPUI5 TOOLS IDE PLUGIN 1.00 and SAPUI5 TEAM PROV IDE 1.00 and
select the respective platform version._

_3\. _

_Add both packages to the download basket._

_4\. _

_Download the corresponding archive files (zip) to a local directory_.



Br Jan
title: Re:Latest version of SAPUI5 for use in PhoneGap

author: Jerome Morino
text:
Hi Jan,



Thanks for your reply.



Unfortunately, this does'nt help. I am looking for the exact equivalent of the
package that can be downloaded as "Evaluation Package" on SDN, but kept up-to-
date. It contains all the js sources (minified and debug versions), the
documentation, some application samples (war files), and so on...



The SAPUI5 tools from the SAP Notes you mentioned only contains a jar-packaged
version of the framework. For a use with PhoneGap, it's a real pain to unzip
all the jar files in order to have access to the js files, and it may be a
huge source of mistakes as well.



Regards,

Jerome
