SAPUI5 versus SAP NW PI
text:
Does somebody know whether it is possible to consume services from SP NW PI
from SAPUI5 (next to services from Gateway)?



Does somebody have a recommendation for service consuming in case we need
services pulling data from SQL database next to SAP. As far as I understand
SAP NW Gateway can only handle data from SAP backend systems or did I miss
something?



Eclipse/ SAPUI5 related question: is there a check in/check out mechanism
available (in case of multiple developers working on a mobile project)?



looking forward to your input!



regards

Angelique Heutinck
author: Anglique Heutinck
Graham Robinson
text:
Hi Angelique,



lots of questions. ![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/happy.gif)



Is it possible to consume services from NW PI in SAPUI5. Absolutely - you can
consume services in SAPUI5 from anywhere you like. SAPUI5 includes controls
for XML, JSON & OData but you can also create your own if you like.



Pulling data from non-SAP database. Many years ago I wrote a blog about this
called [Using ABAP to access non-SAP
databases](http://scn.sap.com/community/abap/connectivity/blog/2008/10/27
/using-abap-to-access-non-sap-databases) that might give you some ideas. Since
that blog was written SAP have released the ADBC API for native SQL. The [ABAP
Geek 15 - ADBC](http://scn.sap.com/people/horst.keller/blog/2009/09/16/abap-
geek-15--adbc) blog from [Horst
Keller](http://scn.sap.com/people/horst.keller) shows how this works. Of
course once you have the data available to your ABAP system you can then
create gateway services to consume it.



Is there a check in/check out mechanism in eclipse - absolutely yes!



Cheers

Graham Robbo
title: Re:SAPUI5 versus SAP NW PI

author: DJ Adams
text:
To illustrate Graham's point, just yesterday evening I found myself building a
simple SAPUI5 mobile app that pulled data from a Google spreadsheet. This
utilised the scripting component of that platform to expose the data, plus the
use of jQuery (available within SAPUI5) to make a JSONP call to retrieve the
data.



So as Graham says, "from anywhere you like"!



dj
title: Re:SAPUI5 versus SAP NW PI
How to add a data into Model in ui5
text:
Hi All,



I have a requirement to add/append some data into a UI table , i.e from
getting the value from Text field.

However have some static data in model , but want some data to be inserted
from text field into table.



Please help me in this.





Thanks,

Gouri
author: GOURI SHANKAR
Tufale Ashai
text:
hello Gouri,

 the model data is a JSON array. To add/append the data you would just have
to "push" that data into the array.





For example,







So now when you have to append you would do...





get the original JSON

==> var json = table.getModel().getData();





if its an array then push or get array from json and then push, the newer
element should be a json too.

==> json.push({name:name3, address:address3});



Set it again

==> model.setData(json);

==> table.setModel(model);



Regards

Tufale

seems, like you did not create and/or deploy the war/ear for the sapui5
framework correctly.



Usually http(s)://<yourportal.de>/sapui/index.html should give you a
valid result if it is deployed according my guidance. If this is not working
you made something wrong ;-) What's te result? 404?



Did you set the context root correctly? Take a look at
http(s)://<yourportal.de>/nwa/logs when you deploy the sapui-ear. Are
there any warnings? Take a look at NWDS, deployment perspective, there your
deployed sapui framework should be listed, too.



Hard to say, what's wrong exactly. Maybe publish your ear-somewhere and I'll
take a look....



Regards,

Jens



P.S.: Why are you always exporting things? Can't you deploy directly via NWDS?
(DC-Build/Deploy)

In my HTML page for loading the SAPUI5 library I am writing the line

**src='<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/resources/sap-ui-core.js>' **instead of **src='resources/sap-ui-core-all.js'. **The second option was not working since the SAPUI5 library was not deployed on the server.

text:
Hello Saurabh



I had exactly the same issue as you. I suspect that you need to change
"src=\"resources/sap-ui-core-all.js\"" to "src=\"/sapui5/resources/sap-ui-
core-all.js\""

For some reason at runtime on the Portal SAPJ2EE the runtime library for UI5
is within \sapui5. This is very annoying if you are trying to switch from
testing on tomcat to SAPJ2EE.



See if this makes a difference.



Thanks



Mike

SAPUI5 initialization parameters
text:
Hi All,



I have done a few projects with SAPUI5 now. All of these projects were
standalone applications. These worked great and I was using SAP Gateway for
communication with SAP. All these apps would be deployed on the Netweaver AS
ABAP.

I have been able to do most of the things I wanted to do, but one of my recent
projects has needed me to start an application with a certain property
provided.



Let me explain with an example:



Let's say we are making an application called "Profile Viewer", the whole
point of the application is that you provide a username to the application and
it loads up the profile of that username. Of course in HTML it is possible to
pass parameters through the link as GET parameters. Is this the best practice
when it comes to SAPUI5? In my previous tests, GET parameters don't work when
the application is being used on NWBC.

I know that deploying a SAPUI5 application onto the AS generates a BSP, so I
was wondering if there would be work to be done on the BSP to make the
parameters work...



If anyone has any ideas, tips I would appreciate a lot!



Thank you.



David Bellers
author: David Bellers
Simon Kemp
text:
Hi David,



You can pass HTTP query parameters with either GET or POST - but these get
sent in the HTTP request to the server (e.g .AS ABAP). I think you are right
you would need to modify the BSP to read the parameters from the HTTP request
and then initialize your application based on the provided value (e.g.
username). All the SAPUI5 processing is of course done on the client not the
server so SAPUI5 is not processing the HTTP parameters at all.



Perhaps others here on the forum can expand at bit more on exactly how to do
this. There must be a way for the server to pass back some initialization data
to the client side that can then be used for subsequent requests...

  
Cheers,

Simon
title: Re:SAPUI5 initialization parameters

author: David Bellers
text:
Hi Simon,



Thank you for the reply.

I was thinking the same thing about the GET/POST. The thing is that SAPUI5 has
no interation with the BSP application at all, by that I mean that I don't
know if you can actually have BSP parameters doing something to the SAPUI5
application.



I don't really have an idea of how to read this, but I think it is weird
nobody else has come across this kind of scenario, which I compare to starting
a Webdynpro with specific application parameters.



Greetz,

David
title: Re:SAPUI5 initialization parameters

author: Frank Welz
text:
Hi David,



if you would like to "store" parameters or properties in the ABAP Backend, you
might want to use what is described in the [Developer Guide for User Interface
Add-On ](https://websmp104.sap-ag.de/~sapidb/011000358700000944892012E)in
chapter 1.2.2.3

"Persisting Settings in Property Bags".



Regards, Frank
title: Re:SAPUI5 initialization parameters

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi David

Just trying to understand what you are after.



The applications you talk about are stateless all business logic and data
comes from the back end.

> Let's say we are making an application called "Profile Viewer", the whole
point of the application is that you provide a username to the application and
it loads up the profile of that username.



Wouldn't the retrieval of the users profile be a service call (or function)?



or are you talking about a header variable sent back after the users logon is
validated?



Cheers

John P
title: Re:SAPUI5 initialization parameters

author: David Bellers
text:
Hi guys,



thank you for taking the time to reply.



I think I need to explain a bit better.



So my idea is that you would have one application that expects an
initialization parameter.

Now let's say we have a menu system, when clicking on different items it
starts that same application but initializes the application with a different
parameter.

Like you would run a task on an object.



Best regards,

David

SAPUI5 Licensed vs Evaluation Package Version
text:
Hi,



I would to know what's the difference between the evaluation version and the
licensed version of the SAPUI5 - the one that's downloaded from

service.sap.com.  Are there additional components from the licensed version
that are not available in the evaluation?



We are currently developing apps using the evaluation SAPUI5, NWDS 7.3 and
XAMPP. Are there any restrictions on the use of the evaluation version?
author: Melanie Saldua
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Melanie,



technically both versions of SAPUI5 are identical.



(Note: I'm talking about the JavaScript library itself. Certain SAP products
may contain additional related tools or server-side functionality. But the
library itself is complete and the same.)



There are no technical restrictions. Legal ones... I'm not sure about the
details, sorry.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:SAPUI5 Licensed vs Evaluation Package Version

author: Simon Kemp
text:
Hi Melanie, you might find this discussion useful too:
<http://scn.sap.com/thread/3209655>



Seems like if you are a SAP Customer/Partner the SAPUI5 license is included in
your existing agreement with SAP. If you are not then it is still unclear.



If I were you I would probably download the non-evaluation version from the
service marketplace, esp. if you are an SAP partner or customer already.



Hth,  
Simon
title: Re:SAPUI5 Licensed vs Evaluation Package Version

author: Melanie Saldua
text:
Hi Simon,



I read the discussion you gave me. From it, what I got was if you are already
a SAP customer/partner, the license is already included. So if I want to
deploy my application on a SAP JAVA AS for example, I need to download the
non-evaluation version and install it on the SAP server. So it's still better
to download and install it.
title: Re:SAPUI5 Licensed vs Evaluation Package Version
MAKIT Chart Data Model
text:
Dear All,



I use the sap.makit.Chart and set the data model as follows:



oChart.setModel(oController.getSingleSeriesJSONDataModel());



The function getSingleSeriesJSONDataModel returns an instance of
sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel. However when I try to do it differently by
setting the model for the chart as the standard model with
sap.ui.getCore().setModel(model); the chart does not find the data. The
resulting problem is, I cannot refresh the chart. What is the right way to set
the data to the chart and to refresh it when required?



Thanks,

Sandeep
author: Sandeep Joseph
Alejandro Ezequiel Leoz
text:
Hi Joseph,



You have to set the model using oChart.setModel(..). This will effectively set
the model to the chart object.



The core.setModel() just registers the model to the Core object (it means that
it will be like a "global available" model), but it does't mean that it will
set that model to every Control (for example, your chart) in the application.

If you want to access to a core registered model, you need to call the
core.getModel(..) method.



Please refer to the API reference for sap.ui.core.Core object to get more
information.



Regards.



Alejandro L.
title: Re:MAKIT Chart Data Model

author: Sandeep Joseph
text:
Hi Alejandro,



Thanks a lot for the tip.



What would be the best place to call the oChart.setModel()? At the moment I
have this in createContent. But when the view is visited a second time, the
chart doesn't get updated as createContent is not called again.



Thanks,

Sandeep
title: Re:MAKIT Chart Data Model

author: Alejandro Ezequiel Leoz
text:
Hi Joseph,



If you use the JSONModel by default, it has a two-way-binding policy, that
means that the Control should be updated as the model changes (and also
viceversa, but it does not apply in this case as the chart doesn't modify the
model).



If you are experiencing problems with that, maybe you could think of force re-
setting the model "manually" each time out of the createContent function (just
as workaround to solve the problem). As you are creating a custom control,
maybe you could set it in the beforeRendering function, or even outside the
Control definition.



Hope it helps you.



Regards,



Alejandro L.
title: Re:MAKIT Chart Data Model

landscape, it will display 2 or 3, etc column list depending on whether we are
using a phone or a 7" tablet or a 10" tablet.

Hi Marc,



I am sure it is possible - but not sure how difficult to achieve.



The example I referred you to previously shows an example of building your own
delegate to modify the layout as the screen dimensions change. You could
probably draw from that example and maybe have two list controls side-by-side
in a HBox that use a filter so that the first one renders odd numbered items
and the second even numbered ones. Then when screen width falls below a
certain value hide the second list and remove the filter on the first.



Worth a go. ![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/mischief.gif)

on our abap stack and now need to replace it with version 1.8.5 but we can not
find it anywhere.



Does somebody know of a way to download this 1.8.5 libary version?

Kind regards,

  
Tim

Graham Robbo

author: T. Schuffelen
text:
Hi Graham,



We need this because the RIN for SAP SRM UI add-on 1.0 states that we should
only use this new UI add-on with SAP UI5 version 1.8.5. Therefore we have to
and need this older version. SAP SRM UI add-on 1.0 has been developed with SAP
UI5 version 1.8.5 and therefore (only) works best with that particular UI5
version.



Kind regards,

  
Tim
title: Re:SAP UI5 1.8.5 version download

author: Graham Robinson
text:
Interesting....and slightly worrying. My first reactions include....



  * Maybe library should be backwards compatible? (but then again maybe not)
  * Maybe multiple version of library should be supported on server?
  * Maybe SAP apps that rely on a specific library should just include that library in their code rather than rely on the customer installing a particular version on runtime server? 



But mainly I think this suggests there is something wrong here with the
delivery methodology that SAP need to resolve.



Cheers

Graham Robbo
title: Re:SAP UI5 1.8.5 version download

text:
Hi Tim

Try the SAP Service Market Place



Note 1793040 - Patch SAPUI5 runtime to version 1.8.5

not sure how you would roll back from the latest version on the ABAP stack
given the dependencies, may need to raise a message and ask how.



Cheers

John P

Problems using namespaces with UI5 and BSP
text:
Hi,



 I am trying out SAPUI5 to prototype a productive application. We are on the
7.02 NW release and we have the UI5 components installed.



 Our application is using a namespace - ex: /abc/someclass etc.



 Now to use UI5, I need to create a BSP application, so I have created an
application - /abc/application.



 Normally, the ICF node for this is created under /sap/bc/ui5_ui5/sap/*.
However, since we are using a namespace, the http requests looks for an ICF
node under /sap/bc/ui5_ui5/* directly. I have created the same and it works.



 However now the problem is that there are some resource mappings going awry.



 When I use page fragments to create views and controllers, then I need to
declare a sap.ui.localresources() in the index.html so that the page fragments
can be accessed. Now this works for regular controls, however for complex
controls that have its own property resources, it does not seem to work. The
table property files such as - messagebundle_en.properties run into JS errors
when used with a namespace.



 In case we use without a namespace, it works fine.



 Anyone have any suggestions on what could be done here?



Cheers,  
Prashanth
author: Prashanth K S
Silke Arians
text:
Dear Prashanth,



It seems that you use the UI5 App Handler under sap/bc/ui5_ui5.

If you create a BSP app with namespace, you also need to create the namespace
in the TA sicf under sap/bc/ui5_ui5.

When using the UI5 App Handler, please ensure that the text-based files are
BSP pages or page fragments whereas the binary files are MIME objects in the
BSP app.



But manually creating the BSP app and the content is not the supported
scenario by SAP - please use the SAPUI5 Application Development Tool instead
for creating the UI5 App in Eclipse and then upload it to the ABAP server via
the SAPUI5 Team Provider for >= 7.31 or the ABAP report for < 7.31. The
report is shipped via SAP note 1793771 "Up/Download SAPUI5 Application
into/from UI5 Repository" and within SP03 of the NetWeaver UI Add-On.



See also chapter "Synchronizing with the SAPUI5 Repository" in Demo Kit
(<https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/UI5BSPRepository.html>)



Kind regards

Silke

(SAPUI5 Tools)
title: Re:Problems using namespaces with UI5 and BSP

author: Prashanth K S
text:
Hi Silke,



 Thanks for your reply. I was tied up last few weeks and only got the time to
go back to my problem.



 I had originally tried to create the BSP application and ICF Node and page
fragments by hand.



 However I created this time the application using the supported report and
everything works perfectly now.



 The problem was two-fold

  1. I did not know that I could create an Eclipse UI5 project with a name XYZ and use it to create a BSP application named ABC through the report. 
  2. I had created the webcontent folder too with the namespace prefix (eg: /abc/*) and this was what was leading to the problem with finding the local resource.

 Thanks again for your help.   
  
Best Regards,  
Prashanth
title: Re:Problems using namespaces with UI5 and BSP
Created new View in Shell on Workitem-selection
author: Gerrit Lober
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Gerrit,



the "sap.ui.view(...)" call always creates a new View instance and since you
give an ID, there would be two Views with the same ID when the same one is
displayed for the second time.



There are two possible solutions:

1.) Call oShell.destroyContent() before calling setContent() to not only
remove the previous View, but to also free its ID

2.) Once you have created a View, store it and re-use it later. See
<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/test-
resources/sap/ui/ux3/Shell.html> for an example where a map called "aContent"
is used with the workset ID as key.



(Actually it should be "mContent" for correct hungarian notation... :-/)



For a limited number of Views option 2 might be better.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Created new View in Shell on Workitem-selection

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi,



setTooltip only works for strings. When you want to bind it, you need to use
"**bind**...".

For some properties there is the specific method bind<property>, but for
tooltips this one does not exist, so you call the generic method

"bindProperty(propertyName, bindingValue)"



So for you it is:

 oButton.bindTooltip({

 parts: [

 {path: '/ToolTipPart1'},

 {path: '/ToolTipPart2'},

 ]

 });





See <http://jsbin.com/aku-test-button-calculated-tooltip/1/edit> (not in IE)
for a running example.



Regards

Andreas

title: Re:Mobile application with list -> details binding

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Robbe,



your initial approach with the global model set on the Core looks good and
clean, so I wonder whether you are aware of "named" models:



When you say

...setModel(oModel)

you could also give the name of the model as optional second parameter:

...setModel(oModel, "myOtherModel")



So you could use as many global models as you want - one default model and any
number of also globally available named models.

There is currently one limitation: you cannot use named models to define an
aggregation.

But if your other model doesn't need to do that, you can keep your data model
as a global one and name the other one.



Regards

Andreas

author: Robbe Wuyts

I didn't know you could use more than 1 global model.

that solution.



Thanks anyways!

Size/length of ODataModel Collection
text:
Hi,



how can I determine the size/length of my ODataModel Collection?



Here is what I do:

  * Bind ODataModel Collection to sap.m.List.bindAggregation
  * Display items in sap.m.List

In my opinion, there are two way to get the size/length:

  1. Get the length from sap.m.List.getItems to get rendered items count
  2. Get the length from ODataModel



Can somebody give me an example for 1.) and 2.)? I tried a lot, but by now
with no success...



Thanks!



Regards

Stefan
author: Stefan Ltterle
Frank Welz
text:
Hi Stefan,

to get the length from the control, you might try the following:

    
    
    oTable.getBinding("rows").getLength()

Here I used a table control. The statement above is called in the
""onRequestCompleted" event of my model.

Kind Regards,

Frank

thanks, this is working! Method "attachRequestCompleted" is essential, because

Just an additional question:

Instead of

    
    
    var oModel = new sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel(); 

Iam using a named odata model (set up in the views controller onInit)

    
    
    var oModel = sap.ui.getCore().getModel("namedModel");



The control (List) shows the data of the bound namedModel, so I assume it is
set up correctly.



But on

    
    
    oModel.attachRequestCompleted(onRequestCompleted);

Iam receiving a " Cannot call method 'attachRequestCompleted' of undefined "



Any hints, why that is?



Thanks!
title: Re:Size/length of ODataModel Collection

author: Frank Welz
text:
Hi Stefan,



your coding looks okay to me and the event registration works for oData models
too.



The error message that you are seeing indicates that "oModel" has the value
"undefined"... . I would suggest some debugging to see if the statement

    
    
    var oModel = sap.ui.getCore().getModel("namedModel"); 

successfully finds the named model. After this the event registration via
"attachRequestCompleted" should be possible.



Regards, Frank
title: Re:Size/length of ODataModel Collection

author: Stefan Ltterle
text:
Hi Frank,



I was able to solve this. The model was set in onInit() of the controlller and
I tried "getModel" in createContent(), which is called before onInit().



See <http://scn.sap.com/thread/3372329>



Thanks!
title: Re:Size/length of ODataModel Collection
Can not get named model
text:
Hi,



it should be simple, but somehow I can not get a named model to attach a
attachRequestCompleted function.



controller.js ( onInit() )

    
    
    sap.ui.getCore().setModel(oModel, "myModel");



view.js ( in createContent )

    
    
    sap.ui.getCore().getModel("myModel").attachRequestCompleted(onRequestCompleted);



The error is

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'attachRequestCompleted' of undefined



There is also a list bound successfully to the named model in view.js:

    
    
    myList.bindItems("myModel>/Items", oItemTemplate, null, [oFilter1]);



Any ideas what may be wrong?



Regards

Stefan
author: Stefan Ltterle
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Stefan,



well, yes, the simple answer is that onInit() is called AFTER createContent().

(Because that's the place where the content may be adapted according to some
logic.)



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Can not get named model

author: Stefan Ltterle
title: Re:Can not get named model
Is there any specific control available in UI5 to embed third party plugins?
text:
Hi,

 In html, we can embed third party application plugins like flash, media
player with object tag. For example if I want to embed a media player then I
will write some html code like this



<object id="MediaPlayer" width="192" height="190" type="video/x-ms-asf">

<param name="FileName"value="videofilename.wmv">

<embed type="application/x-mplayer2" src="videofilename.wmv"

</object>



Now I want to do the same in UI5 with javascript controls. Is there any
specific control available for this? Please help me to solve this.



Regards,

Siva
author: Sivakumar M
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Siva,



you can use a sap.ui.core.HTML control to embed any HTML content. This content
is then preserved, so it can be a JS widget from a different kind of library.



You can even easily wrap those other widgets/controls as a SAPUI5 widget. One
very simple example creates a UI5 control which wraps the GoogleMap
API/widget:

<http://jsbin.com/aku-test-GoogleMap-as-Notepad-Control/1/edit>

(this example is not working in IE because of cross-domain issues when loading
UI5 from jsbin.com, so use Chrome, Firefox or so)



Regards

Andreas
title:
Re:Is there any specific control available in UI5 to embed third party
plugins?

author: Sivakumar M
text:
Hi Andreas,



 Thank you for the answer. I have created a new control with the help of
your example. Thanks a lot.



Regards,

Siva
title:
Re:Is there any specific control available in UI5 to embed third party
plugins?

author: Frank Stdle
text:
I think it's worth mentioning that you don't really have to wrap third party
components in a UI5 wrapper - since UI5 is just HTML5/Javascript you can use
UI5 components alongside any other HTML/Javascript component out of the box,
just remember to load the third party library using the <script> tag.

However, if you are a fan of UI5s imperative style of coding it makes sense to
wrap a third party component for better reuseability.
title:
Re:Is there any specific control available in UI5 to embed third party
plugins?

title: Bind Paginator to model?
text:
I was wondering if anyone had tried binding a [Paginator](https://sapui5.netwe
aver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.commons.Paginator.html) to a
model, to have the numberOfPages automatically set to the number of entries in
the model's row set.



As an example, I'd developed a simple Panel/HTML representation of my weblog
posts (in preparation for "[Re-presenting my site in
SAPUI5](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wZUXz5f1CHI)") and then added a
Paginator at the top to page through the posts. It looks like this:



[![sapui5_model_paginator.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/download
Image/2-13721895-165840/450-275/sapui5_model_paginator.png)](http://scn.sap.co
m/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-13721895-165840/sapui5_model_paginator.png)



In order to work out what value to set the numberOfPages to, I ended up using
jQuery to parse the source XML that the Model had consumed, and count the
number of 'entry' elements. You can see the code here: <https://github.com/qma
cro/sapui5bin/blob/master/snippets/model_to_html.html#L31>



I noticed in the docu that the Paginator inherits a number of bind methods
from sap.ui.core.Element, and was curious to see whether binding a Paginator
could auto-set the numberOfPages according to the data.



Anyone tried this?
author: DJ Adams
Andreas Kunz
title: Re:Bind Paginator to model?

author: DJ Adams
text:
Hey Andreas



Thanks for answering, and what a lovely answer it was too. Using property
formatters to bridge the gap between control properties and values that don't
actually exist explicitly in the model is a great solution.



I also learned something from the last bit of your code example: that you can
use placeAt() multiple times pointing at the same element id, and the controls
will simply be appended.



oPanel.placeAt("content");

oPaginator.placeAt("content");



Cheers, and all the best for 2013!



dj

title: Combine two property bindings to a StandardListItem
author: Stefan Ltterle
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Stefan,



if you really want to bind one text against two fields, you can use the new
"calculated fields" feature:

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/CalcFields.html>

An update to any field will then automatically be refreshed in the UI because
UI5 knows about all connections.



In contrast to that there has been the feature of "formatter functions" and
also of "custom types" (for two-way bindings) for quite some releases where
the text is officially bound against ONE data field, but there is a function
plugged in between model and control where you can adapt the data. This can be
used e.g. to add static text (as asked in a previous version of your post) and
you could also access the data context and get data from any other field. But
in this case UI5 only knows about the officilly bound field and will not
update the UI when an other of the used fields changes.

See <https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/BindingProperties.h
tml>, the section "Formatting Property Values".



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Combine two property bindings to a StandardListItem

author: Stefan Ltterle
text:
Hi Andreas,



thank you, the calculated fields was exaclty what I need, just like WD. ;-)



Seems like
<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/CalcFields.html> is not
linked from a menu (on the left) right now?



Just a proposal/question:

Is there already a documentation page, on which all properties of a mSettings
object are documented? I mean such values like parts, path, type, mode,
formatter, etc.?



Thanks!



Regards

Stefan
title: Re:Combine two property bindings to a StandardListItem

author: Stefan Ltterle
text:
Hi,



by now I couldnt find a documentation page of mSettings object.

Who can point me to the right place?



Regards,

Stefan
title: Re:Combine two property bindings to a StandardListItem
Table with 100% height
text:
Hi there,

I'm using a table control and wondering if its possible to set it to 100%
height instead to set a specific number of visible rows (and so the nunber of
visible rows should change dynamically in respect of screen resolution or
browser window size).



Thanks!
author: Ben Wolf
Frank Welz
text:
Hi Ben,



did you try the control property "visibleRowCountMode"? The documentation on
<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#test-
resources/sap/ui/table/demokit/Table.html> describes the behaviour you are
loking for.



  
visibleRowCountMode| VisibleRowCountMode| This defines how the table handles
the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is, that a fixed row count
is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is changed
by the table automatically. In manual mode the user can change the
visibleRowCount interactively  
---|---|---  
  



Regards, Frank

How to access models with a name
text:
Dear All,



How could I access nodes in a model if the model is set with a name as
follows?



**sap.ui.getCore().setModel(releaseModel, "rel");**



I would like to use the node '**releases**' to be displayed as a list. I try
something as follows, but doesn't work.



 |  releaseList.bindAggregation("items", {  
---|---  
  
** path : "{rel>/releases}", **

 sorter : new sap.ui.model.Sorter("name", false),

 template : new sap.m.StandardListItem({



Could you please help to refer to the model correctly? The JSON in the model
is as follows:



{

"releases":[

{"id":"1302", "status":"Released"},

{"id":"1305", "status":"In Development"}

]

}



Thanks,

Sandeep
author: Sandeep Joseph
Sandeep Joseph
text:
Hey, I think I got it. I just used the path as** path : "rel>/releases",**

now I'm trying to figure out how to reference the fields. The rows just appear
as blank now.



Is there any place I can read how this whole thing works? I'm just trying
things randomly.



Thanks,

Sandeep
title: Re:How to access models with a name

author: Sandeep Joseph
text:
Finally it works - coding below:



 |  sap.ui.getCore().setModel(releaseModel, "rel"); |  
---|---|---  
 |  
 |  var releaseList = new sap.m.List({headerText : "Releases"});  
 |  
 |  releaseList.bindAggregation("items", {  
  
 path : "rel>/releases",

 sorter : new sap.ui.model.Sorter("name", false),

 template : new sap.m.StandardListItem({

 title : "{rel>id}",

 description: "{rel>status}",

 icon : "{img>/icon/ui5}",



But I still want some good documentation to understand this syntax. Any help
appreciated.



Regards,

Sandeep
title: Re:How to access models with a name

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Sandeep,



good to see you found the solution.





Providing documentation which is considered "good" by everyone is not easy...
the basic description of databinding already shows the binding path in
multimodel scenarios without curly braces (this was your first issue):

"myModel>/items"

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/UsageInApp.html>



The aggregation binding documentation also shows the same, using exactly your
syntax:

items: {

 path: "/company/contacts",

 template: oItemTemplate

}

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/BindingAggregations.htm
l>

This same page also shows the syntax of binding properties in the template
control.

So I don't see an obvious problem with the current documentation. Maybe you
can propose how to improve it?





You can also find a working example (which is pretty similar) here:

<http://jsbin.com/aku-mobile-list-databinding/1/edit>



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:How to access models with a name

author: Sandeep Joseph
text:
Thanks a lot Andreas. I will be glad to propose improvements, will get in
touch with you.



Regards,

Sandeep
title: Re:How to access models with a name

present in XML model
text:
Hello Experts,

I am trying to bind the rows of a UI5 with a XML model. T**he problem is, even
though I have two entries in the XML data, the table only shows the first
****entry.**

Code for Table:



    
    
    var oTable = new sap.ui.table.Table("myTab",{ 
     columns : [ 
     {label: "Category", template: "d:CategoryName"}, 
     {label: "Name", template: "d:ProductName" },

Advantages of Gateways over ICF-based JSON service
text:
Hello experts,

I'm currently working on a thesis project thus I'm relatively new to the SAP
ecosystem. So please bear with me



IN A NUTSHELL: What are the advantages of SAP Netweaver Gateway over the ICF-
based REST/JSON service of this blog - besides nice little UI functionality?

[Building a CRUD Application with SAPUI5 and ICF REST/JSON Service - Part
1](http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/front-
end/blog/2012/12/07/building-a-crud-application-with-sapui5-and-icf-restjson-
service--part-1)





DETAILED:

My application is to have a three layered architecture of SAP HANA, ABAP AS
and SAPUI5. While researching how data might flow between the layers I found
two approaches to exchange data between the ABAP layer and SAPUI5.



SAP Netweaver Gateways seems to be the solution of choice. However it comes
with additional license costs. On the other hand I found a blog how to create
REST/JSON based web service in ABAP to provide data for SAPUI5 ([Building a
CRUD Application with SAPUI5 and ICF REST/JSON Service - Part
1](http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/front-
end/blog/2012/12/07/building-a-crud-application-with-sapui5-and-icf-restjson-
service--part-1) ). This blog comes with the initial requirement of using ABAP
and SAPUI5 without SAP Gateways. Skipping both the blog and information about
consuming ODate with Gateways from SAPUI5 I wonder about the difference
between the two approaches.



As what I can see the data will be handled just alike in SAPUI5 as it will
become a JSON model or OData model - both are similarly bound. So from the UI
perspective there shouldn't be a difference. Or am I missing something?



From the ABAP perspective I see that SAP Netweaver Gateway offers me a UI to
create my OData service, whereas the linked blog needs additional coding to
achieve that. However: the actual "doing" in the second approach should be
easily repeatable for every object.



I would expect the Netweaer Gateway to provide me with additional
functionality to build fancy new UIs if it demands licence costs. However all
my research about "advantage of SAP Gateways" points to fact that it uses REST
service. But that's exactly what the blog also does. If there's not more about
SAP Gateways, I don't see a good argument to pay for SAP Netweaver Gateways
(from the cost perspective of my boss).



I'm sure I'm missing something on that. But my research always points to the
"cross-platform" argument based on the fact that Gateways offer me REST based
services. Can anyone give me a hint? Or am I underestimating the amount of
work for the approach in the blog?





Best wishes,

Philipp
author: Philipp Hhne
Graham Robinson
text:
Hi Philipp,



a few observations.



Firstly, as you rightly mention, the Gateway tools effectively generate the
services for you without coding whereas you would need to code all this
yourself if you chose to use your own ICF handler. This is not necessarily a
huge task as with either alternative the back end functionality still needs to
be built. It may be that you can use existing functionality or you may need to
build it all yourself - this effort would be pretty much the same in either
scenario. But having a single toolset such as that provided by Gateway to
build, publish and manage the API's should make life easier, quicker and allow
the developer to focus on the important business functionality rather than the
plumbing.



Secondly, I do not believe there is any major differences in the licensing
requirements no matter whether you use a Gateway service or your own ICF
handler. As long as the end user is a so-called "named user" and therefore
licensed to use the SAP backend for the functionality they are calling then my
understanding is that the existing user license covers access to that
functionality whether it happens via SAPGUI, Gateway, ICF handers, or any
other method. If, on the other hand, your users connect as so-called "unnamed
users" my understanding is that you will need to obtain appropriate licensing
for such use. The good news about Gateway is that such a license arrangement
in on the SAP price list. For a custom ICF handler you would need to figure
that out with SAP. As always with licensing issues check with the SAP Account
Exec.



Thirdly, there advantages to using oData services, such as those provided by
Gateway, over the JSON example from the blog. Most obviously oData supports
standard attributes that allow the client to request very granular subsets
from a data collection. This has advantages if the UI controls, such as those
provided by SAPUI5, also support oData. So, for example, a tableView control
can just request the 10 records that it needs to display on the screen from a
large collection and the Gateway service will ensure only those 10 records are
returned. As the user navigates through the collection the tableView control
requests the relevant chunks of data from the backend. This all happens
without the developer having to code anything to support it.



Finally, Gateway includes a number of plugins for common developer tools such
as Eclipse, Visual Studio and XCode that can accelerate the development
process. There are also tools that allow you to take an entity data model file
and import it into Gateway to create the service skeleton that can
subsequently be implemented by the ABAP developer.



Cheers

Graham Robbo
title: Re:Advantages of Gateways over ICF-based JSON service

author: Jason Moors
text:
Hi Philipp,



You mention a 3 tier architecture, there is another possible option if you are
planning to use SAP Hana, and that is The _SAP HANA_ Extended Application
Services (_XS)_ engine which uses a combination of SAPUI5 and server side
javascript.



SAP are currently running a free training course.



<https://open.sap.com/course/hana1>



Regards,

Jason
title: Re:Advantages of Gateways over ICF-based JSON service

Binding an aggregation to Table (SAPUI5)
text:
Hi all,

did somebody ever try binding an aggregation (i.e. having an analytic view
with 4 attributes, 1 measure exposed via OData, but showing only 1 attribute +
measure) to a table?





Lets say I have attributes (Transaction, TaskType, Program, Month) and the
measure (Number of calls: Value)

Now I'd like only to look at Transactions+Number of Calls.

With OData, this is pretty easy:

../datasource.xsodata/Workload?$select=Transaction,Value

In the results there is only 1 line per transaction with the sum of calls.
(pretty much like a Select distinct Transaction, SUM(Value) as "Value")



But when working with the ODataModel in SAPUI5, there seems to be no way of
adding the $select parameter?



(t is a reference to the sap.ui.table.Table created in the view)



    
    
    var oModel = new sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel("../data/odata/performance.xsodata");
    t.setModel(oModel);
    t.addColumn(new sap.ui.table.Column({
     label : "Transaction",
     template: new sap.ui.commons.TextView().bindProperty("text", {path: "Transaction"})
     }));
    t.addColumn(new sap.ui.table.Column({
     label : "Calls (Period)",
     template: new sap.ui.commons.TextView().bindProperty("text", {path: "Value"})
     }));
    t.bindRows("/Workload");



When I try this, i have a lot of duplicate transactions (because they have
been called in different months or with a different task type). There is no
aggregation.



My "best" try so far was adding a



    
    
    oModel.createBindingContext("/Workload", null, {select: "Transaction,Value"},function(a){});



which actually triggers the right OData Request. It also updates the values in
the Table, BUT:

The number of Rows is kept :-(

Lets say with duplicates the result is 100 rows.

Without duplicates its only 40.

So with the createBindingContext, the first 40 rows are overwritten with the
new (right!) results, but the other 60 rows are not deleted - which makes this
not a viable solution.



I tried a lot of stuff - like using bindAggregation for the TextView instead
of bindProperty - or supplying the parameters in these functions - but nothing
works.



Did anybody do this before? Doesn't look like something special...



BTW: Whiling searching in the code I found an error in the SAPUI5 libraries:

in resources/sap/ui/core/Element-dbg.js Line 123 it says:

    
    
    this.mBindingParametes = null;

Actually it should be

    
    
    this.mBindingParameters = null;





Thanks for your help.

Fabian
author: Fabian Krger
Steven De Saeger
text:
Hi Fabian,



I am only just starting in the world of SAPUI5 so I am afraid I can't really
solve your issue ... The ODATA model does seem to have its flaws if you ask me
... the fact that you can't use the full ODATA potential (like filtering, etc
) when binding seems far from ideal ... and made me wonder already why on
earth we would use it ...



Have you thought about a potential alternative ... using a JSON data model so
you can provide the exact ODATA url and use any additional queries you like ?
To me that seems to be the only alternative at the moment to use the full
potential of ODATA ...



Regards,



Steven
title: Re:Binding an aggregation to Table (SAPUI5)

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Steven,



I'm not sure what you mean... of course you can use OData filtering, sorting
etc. when using an OData model:

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/BindingAggregations.htm
l>



And you can also give custom parameters to it:

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/ODataModel.html>



It is now extended to also allow custom HTTP headers.





Why on earth use an ODataModel?

One possible reason is that it allows you to get data available from an OData
server into a completely configured UI table (including paging, sorting,
filtering functionality etc.) with just about five lines of code:



var oModel = new sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel("url to odata service", true);

var oTable = new sap.ui.table.Table({

 columns : [

 {label: "Product Name", template: "ProductName",
sortProperty: "ProductName" },

 {label: "Product Sales", template: "ProductSales",
sortProperty: "ProductSales" }

 ]

});

oTable.setModel(oModel).bindRows("/ProductSales").placeAt("content");





Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Binding an aggregation to Table (SAPUI5)

author: Steven De Saeger
text:
Hi Andreas,



Thanks for your feedback ...



I was looking at the developer guide of version '1.4.3' which seem to have
alot less options :-)



Regarding the 'filtering' and 'sorting' .. I noticed those classes but I was
wondering whether the filtering & sorting is simply not done client-side
instead of having the model actual rendering the '$filter' parameters etc ...
That is not really clear in the documentation.



Thanks,



Steven
title: Re:Binding an aggregation to Table (SAPUI5)

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Steven,



yep, that explains a lot! :-)



Sorting and filtering with the ODataModel are done on the server.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Binding an aggregation to Table (SAPUI5)

author: Rasmus Stokholm
title: Re:Binding an aggregation to Table (SAPUI5)

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Fabian,



the typing mistake had already been detected and fixed, but thanks!



I'm not 100% sure I understand what you want: are data elements coming like:



TransactionX, January, 50

TransactionX, February, 33

TransactionY, January, 100



And you want to display:



TransactionX, 83

TransactionY, 100



Is this what you want? Aggregating over transactions, no matter the month?



Then I think this is not what a Table can do at the moment.This would be
something to do in the server. The Table displays the elements coming from
OData one-by-one.





Beware that the "select" statement in OData is not the same as an SQL select
where you can specify aggregation. OData select just limits the number of
transmitted properties to the specified subset.

See <http://www.odata.org/documentation/uri-
conventions/#48_Select_System_Query_Option_select>

So in your {select:Transaction,Value} example you only reduced the transmitted
"row width", you did not cause the server to aggregate rows and send the
reduced number of rows where transactions are unique.

I am no OData expert, but I don't think it can do that.



There are currently experiments with grouping in the Table, which seems to be
close to your requirement, but there's nothing final, so nothing can be
promised.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Binding an aggregation to Table (SAPUI5)

author: Fabian Krger
text:
Hi Andreas,

thanks for your reply.



Yes thats exactly what I want, Aggregating over transactions, no matter the
month.



The point is, **OData is able** to select and aggregate. (not only reducing
the "row width" but also the number of rows)



My Service definition is like

"some.hierarchy::CV_TRANSACTIONS" as "Workload" keys generate local
"GENERATED_ID" aggregates always;



The "aggregates always" results in aggregation for all Measures defined in the
Calculation View.

So if my Attributes are "Transaction" and "Month" and "Value" has been defined
as a Measure,

the {select:Transaction,Value} will produce the behavior you described:



> TransactionX, January, 50

>

> TransactionX, February, 33

>

> TransactionY, January, 100

>

>

>

> \--> Result:

>

>

>

> TransactionX, 83

>

> TransactionY, 100



Thats what OData delivers - and the table would be able to show it.



The only problem is, I cant specify the select parameters while binding the
data. Therefore the parameters are not included in the OData URL and therefore
the table cant show this aggregation (since the OData then delivers the non-
aggregated results).





However, my current workaround is defining a second OData service and
specifying the select in the service definition:



"some.hierarchy::CV_TRANSACTIONS" with ("Transactions","Value") as
"Transactions" keys generate local "GENERATED_ID" aggregates always;



This way I can bind the aggregation by bindRows("/Transactions") and the full
data by bindRows("/Workload") without creating another calculation view.

The problem remains that I have to predefine the aggregations - this means I
can't add or remove single columns on demand (for example let the user decide
which columns to show).



Regards

Fabian
title: Re:Binding an aggregation to Table (SAPUI5)

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Fabian,



ok, so I learned something new - google told me it's not possible... but I
admitted I'm not an expert for OData...

So the request to aggregate is in the service definition, not in the URL, as I
expected. But you need the URL to be right, so it would trigger aggregation.



<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/ODataModel.html>

explains at the bottom how you can add $select parameters. Apparently this did
not work? I just tried and also did not get the expected result in the URL.



BUT the same page also explains (at the top) how you can add any parameters to
the service URL, and this did just work fine for me: they were added to the
request URL:

var oModel = new sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel("[http://services.odata.org/Nor
thwind/Northwind.svc/?$select=ProductName](http://services.odata.org/Northwind
/Northwind.svc/?%24select=ProductName)", true);



Maybe this would have worked for you as well. But at least you found a
workaround...



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Binding an aggregation to Table (SAPUI5)

author: Fabian Krger
text:
> Andreas Kunz wrote:

>

>

>

> <https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/ODataModel.html>

>

> explains at the bottom how you can add $select parameters. Apparently this
did not work? I just tried and also did not get the expected result in the
URL.

Hi Andreas,

thanks for this hint!

I was just looking for documentation in the API Reference (<https://sapui5.net
weaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.table.Table.html#bindRows>).
This function mentioned above is not documented here...
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/sad.gif)



But it is working! Thanks :-)



Anyway, is there a documentation what arguments can be passed to the
bindRows() function besides "path: " and "parameters: "? How to specify a
sorter or filters (like it is possible with the "

bindRows(sPath, oTemplate, oSorter, aFilters)" function?

You could possibly find out by try&error but I wonder why this function is
not documented in the reference?
title: Re:Binding an aggregation to Table (SAPUI5)

author: Fabian Krger

author: Stefan Ltterle
text: Great hint, Fabian. Thanks!

author: H R
text:
@ Rasmus,

I am new to SAPUI5. I find the documentation pretty hard to keep track-
tutorials are not very extensive. So please bear with me if the questions are
pretty basic :-) I would really appreciate if you could answer a few
questions:



a) Looking at the documentation: <http://www.spyvee.com/SAPHTML5_DemoKit/#doc
s/api/symbols/sap.ui.table.Table.html#bindRows>

it seems that the second parameter is oTemplate which extends from
sap.ui.commons.element. , where did you get the documentation that says
selection criteria can be passed as json object "parameters" which in turn
contains a key "select"?



b)Object literal that was passed for parameters-sPath, oTemplate, oSorter,

text:
Hi Alviss,



what data do you provide as a json model?



Data should enclosed with brackets - means it's an object.

For exmaple...

"lastname":"Anikeev","firstname":"Konstantin" - wrong

["firstname":"Konstantin", "firstname":"Maria"] - wrong

License
text:
Dear All,



is there any other license of sapui5 sdk than 30days evaluation from SCN? Is
it already possible to develop commercial apps if customer has purchased SAP
products like netweaver?



thank you
author: Pawel Skiba
Graham Robinson
text:
Hi Pawel,



the SAPUI5 libraries are included with NetWeaver - so if the customer has a
valid NetWeaver license they should be able to use the SAP UI5 library without
any licensing implications. To be sure check with the SAP account rep.



Essentially the licensing strategy is that you can use SAP UI5 for any SAP
scenario.



Cheers

Graham Robbo

How to implement data lazy loading from a Oracle DB into Table
text:
Hi all!



I'm new in SAPUI5 and would like to get some help.



I need to select data from a Oracle database and show it in Table.

The sample consists about 13,000 rows.

It is important, that rows are loading into the table as needed (lazy
loading). Otherwise it would work too slowly.

I know, that directly access to the database is not possible. I must use a Web
service, which will apply to the database and return the selected data.



What is the best way to solve this problem?

I understand that so, when i scroll table content, Web service needs the
current position (offset) to return the relevant portion of the data. Is that
correct? How does it work?

Maybe there are ready solutions?



I have one condition: the solution must be compatible with Java.



Thank in advance for your help!
author: Alexander Isaev
Graham Robinson
text:
Hi Alex,



this functionality is one of the reasons SAP has chosen the OData protocol at
their standard for creating and consuming data APIs. The OData specification
includes directives like $filter, $top and $skip that are used so the client
can specify in the call exactly what data it needs.



So, for example, a call such as `[http://services.odata.org/OData/OData.svc/Pr
oducts?$top=5&$skip=2](http://services.odata.org/OData/OData.svc/Products?%24t
op=5&%24skip=2) `would return the 3rd though the 7th entry in the entity set.



Obviously the support for these directives needs to be implemented in both the
client-side controls and the API itself. For a pure SAP implementation this
means SAPUI5 at the front end and NetWeaver Gateway services on the back end.



So your API that exposes the Oracle database records needs to support OData.



Cheers

Graham Robbo
title: Re:How to implement data lazy loading from a Oracle DB into Table

title: Re:Use jquery in view

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi,



> $(document).ready()



Will not work for Views which are displayed later (after the initial set of
controls) and will also not help with re-rendering.



> add element to the HTML in View Itself (not recommended)



This is very much not recommended, because createContent is supposed to return
the controls which are inside the View. What your proposal does is: it creates
an empty View which may be somewhere in the control tree but has no content.
And the View code creates a control which appears at a completely different
place.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Use jquery in view

author: Konstantin Anikeev
text:
Hi Andreas, Ben,



I did not mean to use $(document).ready() - just wantet to provide a hint for
understanding, that jQuery for the element should be used, when element
already in a DOM.



Best Regards

Konstantin
title: Re:Use jquery in view

author: Jibin Joy
text:
Hi Andreas and Konstantin ,



 Ur right

1. $(document).ready() works in First Time Display

2. Add element to the HTML in View Itself which will decrease the usability
of the view .





regards,

Jibin Joy

Security
text:
I really wonder about security in SAPUI5 and OData. Codes are all in client
and putting user name password in client side is not safe. Any way for
security?
author: Erhan Keseli
Christian Jianelli
text:
Hi Erhan,

You are right about this security issue but it is easily solved enabling SSL
in the WebAS.



**Configuring the SAP Web AS for Supporting SSL**

<http://help.sap.com/saphelp_nw04//helpdata//EN/65/6a563cef658a06e10000000a114
05a/frameset.htm>



Regards,



Christian
title: Re:Security

author: Erhan Keseli
text:
Hi Christian,



I dont think so it can be solved using SSL. You write your username/password
in a file that can be viewed on client side. Using SSL does not solve this
issue. When you use SSL sending this username/password hides only network
transport. But clients still can see this.
title: Re:Security

author: Simon Kemp
text:
Hi Erhan,



Wouldn't you delegate security to the container that was hosting the SAPUI5
application? I mean if that is a Java server you can use whatever security
mechanism is supported by the Java engine (e.g. basic, form, ticket, saml,
whatever...) similarly if the SAPUI5 app is hosted on an ABAP system (e.g.
with Gateway) you could use whatever security mechanism is supported by the
ABAP runtime, for example SAML (as is used for DUET Enterprise) or perhaps a
SAP Logon Ticket (access via a portal).



Putting username and password hardcoded in the source is really only for demos
where people won't take the time to bother about setting up proper security.
Even basic authentication via SSL provides security in that case the user
would be prompted for username/password when they first try to access the app,
then subsequent requests would already be authenticated.



I hope this makes sense
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/happy.gif)

Simon
title: Re:Security

author: Erhan Keseli
text:

![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/happy.gif)



But I think also posting issue. I didnt give a try(I will) but how about
post/put? When we try to post how can I achieve this?



And last point. If domains are not same(page served on Java server, data
served on GW) authentication is made only for Java. You only authenticated

title: Re:Security

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi Erhan

Reading the comment you left on my personal blog I can tell you "Really" don't
like putting User Name and Password's into code - neither do I, I completely
agree with what Simon wrote above, its acceptable for demos.



In the Developer Guide there is a really good section on [SAPUI5 Security Info
rmation](https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/SecurityGuide.h
tml), it covers off many of the layers of security that as developers we need
to consider.



wrt SAPUI5 not being mature and released too early, in the context of security
you may want to read the first paragraph, summarized below.

> It is important to understand that SAPUI5 is a clientside JavaScript
library..

>

>

>

> While this brings a lot of freedom and possibilities for the application, it
comes with a lot of responsibility with regards to security. Application
developers need to understand the security threats and actively prohibit
exploitation..  

>

>  

>

> This also means common security mechanisms, which are taken for granted,
like User Authentication, Session Handling, Authorization Handling or
Encryption are not part of SAPUI5 and need to be handled by the server side
framework and/or custom code of the application.

Cheers

JSP
title: Re:Security

author: Christian Jianelli
text:
Hi Erhan,

In the scenario described by you (page served by java and data by GW) besides
the authentication issue, you will have problems with Cross-Origin Resource
Sharing (CORS). I 'm struggling with CORS (chrome and firefox) over the last
few weeks and until now my conclusion is that the best choice is avoid it.



I do recommend the following material:  
<http://media.techtarget.com/rms/pdf/Web_application_security.pdf>



Regards,



Christian
title: Re:Security

author: Erhan Keseli
text:
At last someone understood me.



I think this is very common use? May be we need server side SAPUI5 :)

author: Leandro Muller
text:
Hi everyone.





I have searched the same answer but the document doesn't show a solution
outside SAP. I read about Proxy Servlet but it isn't work on server
application (jboss).

So, I created a class Proxy Servlet to call SAP and hide user and password on
backend because the front-end is suicide.





I created a CRUD following SAP HOW-TO

<http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/front-
end/blog/2012/12/07/building-a-crud-application-with-sapui5-and-icf-restjson-
service--part-1>





But that example the authentication applied by SAP, if I install that
application another environment I need to authentication on SAP (but How can I
do it?).





So I created a class Proxy Servlet and applied secutity zone on jboss, so if
you try access /scnblog2/home, jboss will ask JAAS authentication.

After authentication SAPUI5 is working but need to access SAP.

I changed the call to "/scnblog2/ProxyServlet?url=contact/"

Example: oModel2.loadDataNew("/scnblog2/ProxyServlet?url=contact/",
handleSuccess, handleError, oParameters, true, 'POST');





so, ProxyServer call SAP and return to browser the response.

=2&q=#makechanges](https://code.google.com/p/desapui5/downloads/detail?nam
e=scnblog2.zip&can=2&q=#makechanges)

title: Data binding problem in sap.ui.table.TreeTable
author: Graham Robinson
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Graham,



congratulations, you have found a bug in the TreeTable implementation. :-)

  
Your JSON format is perfectly fine, but the TreeTable has an issue when Data
is not initially available. This issue has been fixed yesterday for UI5
version 1.9.1 and later and a downport to 1.8.6 is also planned.



As a temporary workaround you could delay the "oTable.setModel(oModel);" until
the data is available, e.g. by using the "requestCompleted" event of the
JSONModel:



**var oModel = new sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel();**  
**oModel.attachRequestCompleted(function(){**  
** oTable.setModel(oModel);**  
**});**  
**oModel.loadData("test.json");**



Thanks a lot for finding this issue!



Best regards  
Andreas Kunz
title: Re:Data binding problem in sap.ui.table.TreeTable

author: Graham Robinson
text:
Thanks Andreas,



I'm not sure "congratulations" is what I was after.
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/wink.gif)



When I was young and easily distracted I regarded finding bugs as a badge of
honour. Now I am older (let's just say more experienced) and more task focused
I would prefer not to find any bugs at all.
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/confused.gif)



But thank you very much for your quick response and action on this. I really
appreciate it.



Cheers

Graham Robbo



p.s. Interesting that post in SCN got quicker results than my OSS message.
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/shocked.gif)
title: Re:Data binding problem in sap.ui.table.TreeTable

author: Graham Robinson
text:
Hi Andreas,



just to complete the loop for anyone else following this thread - the example
you gave me did not work - probably because I am an idiot.



I have taken your hints and have a workaround that involves calling the
setData method first followed by the loadData method.



**var oModel = new sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel();**

**oModel.setData(oData); // Put dummy data in oData**

**oModel.loadData("test.json");**



Cheers

Graham Robbo
title: Re:Data binding problem in sap.ui.table.TreeTable

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Graham,



I rather guess it did not work because I was not able to explain
appropriately.



This made me try to find a way to easily share SAPUI5 example code externally.

jsbin, pastebin etc. are obvious choices, but in this case I need an HTML
file, served as text/html and a JSON file, served as raw data - and those
sites don't do this.



On orionhub.org (of Eclipse Orion) it seems to work, though:

<http://treetablehtml-site.orionhub.org:8080/TreeTable.html>

(I'm just not sure whether this URL is permanent... it looks so non-unique...)

(Disclaimer: this is just a personal coding proposal, no SAP code delivery...)



All code is in the HTML file, SAPUI5 is loaded from netweaver.ondemand.com
(because this is https it **will not work in IE - try with Chrome or
Firefox**).

A TreeTable is created with no data, JSONModel.loadData() is called even with
5 seconds delay, and only when the data has arrived (in requestCompleted)
oTable.setModel() is called.

So I think this workaround is an option to avoid the bug.



However, the workaround you found is also valid.



Cheers

Andreas Kunz
title: Re:Data binding problem in sap.ui.table.TreeTable

author: Graham Robinson
text: Thanks mate ![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/cool.gif)
title: Re:Data binding problem in sap.ui.table.TreeTable

author: Christophe Benoit
text:
Hello Andreas,



I think I found a similar problem with the Carousel UI element.



I have a Carousel element with images bound to a model. When the carousel is
rendered the data in the model is not yet loaded. When my model receives its
data the carousel is not updated.



This post pointed me in the right direction for a workaround.



When I receive the data for my model and I have set it, I first have to update
the bindings of my model:



_products.updateBindings();_



And next rerender the carousel:



_sap.ui.getCore().byId("productCarousel").rerender()_



Then it works fine.



Regards,

Christophe

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getValue' of undefined
text:
Hi,



When i am trying to do a AJAX call i am getting the below error.



Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getValue' of undefined



[![Capture.JPG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-1403434
2-214609/450-103/Capture.JPG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImag
e/2-14034342-214609/Capture.JPG)

I attached the html file content. Any ideas?



Thanks,

Naresh
author: Naresh Veeramachineni
Vishweshwara P K M
text:
Hi Naresh,



There are two mistakes in the code, you have shared in this thread.

  1. Defining the input parameters named **oInput1** and **oInput2** for the **press **event handler of the button. The press even handler syntax does not support this and hence, when you try to access these two input fields, within the event handler, it is basically the undefined local variable that will be used.
  2. **this **keyword will be used in the controllers and views to refer to the current instance of the controller/view. It should not be used in the the html page.



So remove the two additional input parameters from the **press** event handler
and do not use **this** keyword to access the UI.



Below is the corrected code:

> var oButton4 = new sap.ui.commons.Button({

>

>  text : "Submit",

>

>  style: sap.ui.commons.ButtonStyle.Emph,

>

>  press : function(oEvent) {

>

>  var jURL =
'<http://XXXX.com:1080/Security/updateApp.xsjs';>

>

>  jQuery.ajax({

>

>  url:jURL,

>

>  method: 'POST',

>

>  dataType:'json',

>

>  data: '{"app_id":"' + oInput1.getValue() +
'","app_desc":"' + oInput2.getLiveValue() + '","locale":"en"}',

>

>  success: myFunction.onComplete,

>

>  error: myFunction.onErrorCall

>

>  });

>

>   }

>

> }).placeAt("content");

Regards,

Vishweshwara P.K.M.
title: Re:Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getValue' of undefined

author: Naresh Veeramachineni
text:
Hi, Thanks for the response. After doing those changes, i am getting the below
error. I am wondering why it is doing the Http Call using GET when we
mentioned POST there?



[![Capture.JPG](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-1403460
3-214655/450-127/Capture.JPG)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImag
e/2-14034603-214655/Capture.JPG)



Thanks,

Naresh
title: Re:Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getValue' of undefined

author: Vishweshwara P K M
text:
Hi Naresh,



In the **jQuery.ajax({** command, change the attribute **method** to **type**.
I mean change **method: 'POST'** to **type: 'POST'. **Also the internal server
error might be because of some runtime error in XSJS file running on the
server. Debug the xsjs file to correct the error. Follow this tutorial, [HANA
Native Development -- Exercise 10: Server-side JavaScript
debugging](http://www.experiencehana.com/docs/DOC-3037), for more information
on how to debug the XSJS file.





Regards,

Vishweshwara P.K.M.
title: Re:Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getValue' of undefined

author: Naresh Veeramachineni
text:
Hi Vishweshwara, Thanks for the response. Is there a way to get the response
back from XSJS? If i execute the xsjs directly form URL, i aam getting the
below response {"data":[["121","test","Data got inserted successfuly"]]} But i
want to show it the html where i am submitting. So how to get this response to
the html? Thanks, Naresh
title: Re:Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getValue' of undefined

author: Vishweshwara P K M
text:
Hi Naresh,



The **success **and **error **callback methods of **jQuery.ajax** query are
deprecated. So instead of success use **done() **callback method. Below is the
sample code snippet to read the json response object you have,

> jQuery.ajax({

>

>  url:jURL,

>

>  type: 'POST',

>

>  dataType:'json',

>

>  data: '{"app_id":"' + oInput1.getValue() + '","app_desc":"' +
oInput2.getLiveValue()+ '","locale":"en"}'

>

> }).done(function(jsonData){

>

>  var arrVal = jsonData.data;

>

>  var val1 = arrVal[0][0];

>

>  var val2 = arrVal[0][1];

>

>  var msg = arrVal[0][2];

>

> });

You can still use the success callback method and use the above mentioned
implementation of _done_ method. For more information on jquery.ajax refer
this URL, <http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax/>.



Thanks & Regards,

Vishweshwara P.K.M.
title: Re:Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getValue' of undefined

author: Naresh Veeramachineni
text:
Thanks Vishweshwara. I am struggling to read the output and now i can.
Thankyou Naresh
title: Re:Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getValue' of undefined

text:

I've recently stumbled upon this issue in my coding, whenever i add the
wrapping : sap.ui.core.Wrapping.on to my sap.ui.commons.TextArea I get the
error message outlined on the attachment.



It works fine if i remove that singular line with the "**wrapping :
sap.ui.core.Wrapping.On**"

text:

Have you tried using sap.ui.core.Wrapping.Hard or sap.ui.core.Wrapping.Soft
instead of sap.ui.core.Wrapping.On?



Cheers,

Ian
title: Re:sap.ui.core.Wrapping.On generating an Uncaught Type error?

author: Vishweshwara P K M
text:
Hi Rafael,



sap.ui.core.Wrapping enumeration has only 4 possible options. You can use only
one of these properties for wrapping text in TextArea UI.



  1. sap.ui.core.Wrapping.Hard
  2. sap.ui.core.Wrapping.None
  3. sap.ui.core.Wrapping.Off
  4. sap.ui.core.Wrapping.Soft



Refer the [Demo kit](https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/api/symbo
ls/sap.ui.core.Wrapping.html) for more information on wrapping.



Thanks & Regards,

Vishweshwara P.K.M.

NETWRK ERR - XML Exception 101 on safari browser/iOS device while testing ui5
application.
text:
Hi ,



We are testing **oData** ui 5 application on safari browser and on iOS devices
by bundling with phonegap ( 2.6.0 / 2.0.0 )



we are getting error as follows :-



**NETWRK ERR - XML Exception 101**



Same application works on



1\. chrome browser - by disabling web security via command prompt .

2\. android devices - by whistling URL in config.xml file .





We have tried using white list concept for iOS applications as mentioned in
ui5 documentation , but to no Success
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/sad.gif)





Stuck on this for long time .



How can we tackle this issue because i am assuming many people will be coming
across this.





Thanks ,



Amit Nalawade.
author: Amit Nalawade
Jan Penninkhof
text:
Hi Amit,



This is not really related to SAPUI5 but more to the browser or rather Cordova
issue in this case. Most modern browser are protecting its users from so-
called cross-site scripting attacks.



You're right, in order to make these REST calls, you should whitelist the
domain in the config.xml file. A how-to on how to do this can be found here:

<http://docs.phonegap.com/en/2.7.0/guide_whitelist_index.md.html>



An important thing to note is that if you are using storyboards, you must
override initWithCoder to call [super init] in order to make Cordova load
settings from config.xml.



Cheers,

Jan
title:
Re:NETWRK ERR - XML Exception 101 on safari browser/iOS device while testing
ui5 application.

author: Amit Nalawade
text:
Thanks Jan ,



I have already done that referring to phone gap documentation , but things
just don't seem to work on iOS platform.I really dont know what is the issue.
title:
Re:NETWRK ERR - XML Exception 101 on safari browser/iOS device while testing
ui5 application.

author: Sean Campbell

text: Nobody? ![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/sad.gif)
title: Re:SAPUI5 and user roles / authorizations

author: Simon Kemp
text:
Hi Mathieu,



Can you explain in more detail what you are asking? I don't fully understand
your question.



SAPUI5 is a client side JavaScript library used for creating user interfaces,
roles and authorizations tend to be handled by the server side application you
are dealing with not the client side UI framework....



I would be interested to understand you question a better.

Thanks,  
Simon
title: Re:SAPUI5 and user roles / authorizations

author: Mathieu S.
text:
My question was: how to handle authorizations and roles when developing SAPUI5
applications?

Are there any tools or libraries to handle this?



For example, is there any client-side library that would communicate with a
server-side one in charge of granting the right authorizations to the
connected user?



In server-side technologies, like Web Dynpro, it's pretty easy to handle this
(of course), so I was wondering if SAP developed something to make it easier
when developing client-side apps.
title: Re:SAPUI5 and user roles / authorizations

author: Morgan Apelqvist
text:
Hello Mathieu!



You can read about the authorisation and security at:

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/SecurityGuide.html>



I paste some information bellow:

###  User Management / Authentication

SAPUI5 doesn't provide any authorization or user management. An application
which implements such facilities based on SAPUI5 has to make sure that SSL is
enabled to prevent cleartext passwords sent over the wire. Applications must
not store any logon information on the client.



Kind regards!



Morgan Apelqvist
title: Re:SAPUI5 and user roles / authorizations

author: Bertram Ganz
text:
Hi Morgan, our UI add-on for SAP NetWeaver provides so-called Productivity
Services for SAPUI5:



**Productivity Services**: ... Productivity services (formerly named as _Integration and Interoperability_ services) facilitate the interoperability of technologies and infrastructures across shell (such as SAP NWBC) and standalone browser scenarios. Services for navigation, launchpads, PFCG content, UI adaptations, building pages, authoring and content provisioning are available today (with SAP NetWeaver UI services v1.0 part of UI add-on for SAP NetWeaver), more UI integration services are planned. _Read more: new _[_Developer's Guide for SAP NetWeaver User Interface services_](http://help.sap.com/nw-uiaddon#section3), _new_[_JavaScript Docs for SAP NetWeaver User Interface Services_](http://help.sap.com/nw-uiaddon#section3)



In the Developer Guide (linked above) you find a section 2.5 on **Creating an
Application Shell**

This section describes how to create an application shell that retrieves
system information, user information and a user menu from a back-end system
using the start-up service. When you integrate SAPUI5 applications into this
shell, you can easily propagate user-specific settings retrieved from the
back-end system to your SAPUI5 applications.

An application shell is an SAPUI5 application that provides the following
capabilities:

  * Allow users to log on to a back-end system
  * Display system information and user-related information that has been read from the back-end system
  * Display a user menu as defined in the logon system
  * Allow users to navigate in the menu and open applications in the shell's content area
  * Propagate user-specific settings that have been read from the back-end system to SAPUI5 applications that have been started in the content area



Regards, Bertram
title: Re:SAPUI5 and user roles / authorizations

sap.m.Carousel not working within sap.m.SplitApp
text:
Hi experts,



is anybody able to get a sap.m.Carousel working within the details view of the
new sap.m.SplitApp? Only the paging is visible, but no content



[![splitapp_carousel.jpg](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage

author: Stefan Ltterle

text:
Hi Stephan,



I had a similar problem with Carousel content.

I found that, using Chrome dev-tools, the height or the width (I don't
remember at this moment) of the carousel's inner element is set to 0px (no
matter that you previously set to 100% in your code). If you manually set a
fixed size in px, you should see the content of the carrousel, but that is not
a good solution.

title: Re:sap.m.Carousel not working within sap.m.SplitApp

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Alejandro,

please see my response below.

It's not a bug, but you have to decide whether the Page content are should be
as tall as its content or vice cersa.



Andreas
title: Re:sap.m.Carousel not working within sap.m.SplitApp

author: Alejandro Ezequiel Leoz
text:
Hi Andreas,



Thank you for your detailed explanation!

I will try to test it as soon as possible.



Regards,

Alejandro.
title: Re:sap.m.Carousel not working within sap.m.SplitApp

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Stefan,



is the hierarchy something like



SplitApp -> Page -> Carousel?



Because then I suspect the Page is where a setting needs to be corrected on
your side:

By default the Page is scrollable (vertically). This means the height depends
on the content.

But the Carousel by default takes 100% height to cover all available space.
This means the height depends on the parent.

And you'll notice this is a loop: child and parent make their height depend on
each other. The result is that the height collapses to zero (or in this case
to the Carousel ruler which has a defined height).

This is a standard problem in CSS: 100% height needs a parent with defined
height.



If this is the cause, the fix is simple: just set the "enableScrolling"
property of the Page to "false". This means it will no longer depend on the
size of the content, but the height of the Page content are will be fixed to
100% of the Page.

And the Carousel then knows how much 100% height are.



You don't want to scroll the Carousel vertically, after all, do you? If you'd
want that, you'd need to set it to a fixed height (as proposed by Alejandro).



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:sap.m.Carousel not working within sap.m.SplitApp

author: Stefan Ltterle
text: It works, thank you for the detailed information!

author: Graham Robinson
title: Re:Eventing in MVC

author: Amit Nalawade
text:
you can have a main controller where you define all your views and link
methods to them .





so when in your first view you take a action , inside its controller in a
method trigger something like this



**this.getView().fireEvent("goToDetailsEvent", {bindingContext:obj});**



binding context has value that is to be passed to other view .



In your main controller listen for this event .Attach this event to say your
detail view like this



this.detailsview.attachEvent("**goToDetailsEvent**", this.moveTo_DetailPage,
this);



So when it listens write your code in moveTo_DetailPage method.



Hope this helps.
