SAP UI5 to reconstruct SAP Business ByDesign UI?
text:
Hi,



I am trying to compare the SAP UI5 and silverlight based UI for SAP BYD
because it's reported BYD UI is going to be re-constructed with SAP UI5. For
BYD UI, there is Oberon client and Oberon Runtime. To reduce the interaction
roundtrip and formalize backend interaction pattern, Oberon client can
accumulate backend requests, compare data and derive the data change list, and
bind client action to backend operation of server controller(ECO or new
controller with CIP), then the backend controller(master controller) can
control the interaction lifecycle. One roundtrip also is the backend
transaction unit. But with UI5, all these things are missing, or developers
have to write custom model to include the backend service calls. one could
foresee more server requests are required and interaction is not formalized,
which might brings mess for product development, but not a problem for small
project.



UI5 is based on MVC, while BYD UI is more like ASP.Net(Server controlled UI),
are there any best practice to balance the cons and pros of 2 UI patterns? Or
UI5 is going to consider this to make the reonstruction of BYD UI easier?



Regards

Patrick

author: Marco Plebani

title: Is there some sort of layout resize manager for the SAPUI5?
text:
I know there is the hidden and private sap.ui.core.ResizeHandler but it looks
like a naive implementation.

[![resizing.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-139813
90-205679/450-241/resizing.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showIm
age/2-13981390-205679/resizing.png)

1\. The Charts are fixed after rendering.

2\. Notification Widget has it's own resizing attached to the dom and it's not
even being throttled



Offensive Code Below:

    
    
    //Snippet From sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar-dbg.js
    sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar.prototype.init = function() {
    ...
     jQuery(window).unbind("resize", fnOnResize);
    }
author: Jeffrey Dang
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Jeffrey,



most browsers only fire "resize" for the entire window, not for individual DOM
elements. But sometimes elements resize without the window being resized and
you need to know that.

For this case the "naive implementation" which repeatedly checks element sizes
seems to be the standard solution.



You are right that reaction to the "resize" event of the window should better
be throttled.



The "afterRendering" adaptions are of slightly different nature: as rendering
means the creation of an HTML string without knowing the location in the page
and the available space, _some _things need to be done once size and
dimensions of the control are known.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Is there some sort of layout resize manager for the SAPUI5?

author: Jeffrey Dang
text:
The idea is that you have the notion of a parent-child relationship. There
are various container like classes (HorizontalLayout, VerticalLayout,
MatrixLayout) that could propagate resize events without everything querying
the dom or having to attach listeners to specific dom elements.



Also, one thing to consider is leveraging documentFragments to improve browser
rendering time.

<http://jsperf.com/doc-fragment>

Sizing in afterRendering calls is likely to trigger reflows that could have
been avoided.
title: Re:Is there some sort of layout resize manager for the SAPUI5?

Hi there,



Some time ago [Stefan Beck](http://scn.sap.com/people/stefan.beck) published

very nice examples.

& feel of those controls on a real device than on my computer's browser.

  2. If not: am I infringing any law by releasing this application on Android market (and Apple store maybe) so my teammates could easily install it as well? I'm asking because UI toolkit for HTML5 is an _evaluation package_. So I'm not really sure what we have the right to do _publicly _when we download it from SCN.



Cheers,

Nicolas Busson.

SAPUI5 TestSuite samples do not work when using IIS 7 or higher
text:
Hey Folks,



I installed the static SAPUI5 content under my local webmatrix IIS ( version
8.5 ) so I could display the developer documentation and related 'TestSuite'
...

I noticed though that the TestSuite was empty and no content was shown ...



That seemed a bit strange as I saw other people posting with references to
samples from that testsuite ... After a bit of digging I found out that IIS
blocks the file 'discovery/all_tests' as it does not recognise the mime
content ( the file has no extension )... and assumes it is a static file with
no proper handler ( error 404.17 ).



Under a normal IIS you can change the mime handling but with the webmatrix
local IIS I couldn't find that option ( might be me ) .. anyways here is a
quick fix to get it working:



  * rename the 'all_tests' file to 'all_tests.js' ( extension javascript )
  * edit the 'welcome.html' file in the root folder and search for the 'all_tests' ... add the '.js' extension ..



Now it works and all test samples are loaded properly ...



Steven
author: Steven De Saeger
John Patterson
text:
Hi Steven





> Under a normal IIS you can change the mime handling





I am not sure what Webmatrix is but the same things happened for me on
Windows7



To enable mime handling you have to turn on some of the management tools.



To do this goto

Control Panel\Programs\Programs and Features ->Turn Windows features on or
off



Choose

Internet Information Services -> Web Management Tools - select the features
you want



Now you can see "MIME Types" and "Handler Mappings" as an options

[![iis0.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-13963371-2
02434/450-270/iis0.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-13
963371-202434/iis0.png)





The file "all_test" has no file extension

I created an extension "." assigned "application/json", but txt or js would
work too I guess

[![iis1.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-13963371-2
02435/450-202/iis1.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-13
963371-202435/iis1.png)

Then in the Module Mapping extend "StaticFile" to use the asp.dll executable

[![iis2.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-13963371-2
02436/450-379/iis2.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-13
963371-202436/iis2.png)

Stop and Start IIS and reload UI5.



HTH

Table Filters not working with numbers (SAPUI5)
text:
Hi all,

i have a table which contains data from an odata source (SAP HANA).

I have one Column called "Program Type" which can contain characters (like
"F") or numbers ("1" = executable program). The Column is defined as string.

The filterProperty is set - the filter is shown when i click on the table
header.

If I filter for F, the results are fine.

The generated OData URL is:

...&$filter=((indexof(ProgramType,'F') ne -1))...



But when i filter for 1, the URL is:

...$filter=((indexof(ProgramType,1) ne -1))...

As you can see, the ' and ' are missing. Thats why the OData throws an error:

No applicable function found with the specified arguments. The function
considered is: indexof(Edm.String,Edm.String).

As a result, no data is shown in the table at all.

I tried setting the type of the Binding explicitly with type: new
sap.ui.model.type.String() but still the same.



Another problem: Did anybody ever try setting the filterOperator to 'BT"
(between)? The problem is there is only one filter input-field. Therefore, the
"to" value is always undefined and the filter also throws an error.



Anybody able to help?

Kind Regards,

Fabian

Jeffrey Dang

I'm using sapui5 version 1.8.4 and I'm not having the same issue as you.



All I specified was the label, template, sortProperty and filterProperty.

ToolPopUp arrow
text:
Hi together,



I have a question about the ToolPopUp in SAPUI5. Is it possible to place the
little arrow of the ToolPopUp on the right side instead of left?



Thanks in advance!
author: Chris Wohlbrecht
Ruben Tuider
text:
Hi Chris,



you mean that you would like to position the ToolPopup on the left side of an
element?

In this case you have to use other docking points of the Popup.

Please see the demokit-documentation -> Controls -> ToolPopup

Here you find different docking possibilities. In your case you could do the
following:





var oToolPopup = new sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup();

oToolPopup.open(sap.ui.core.Popup.Dock.EndTop,
sap.ui.core.Popup.Dock.BeginCenter);



If you have set the opener proberly the ToolPopup sould be opened left from
the opener and the arrow is therefore on the right side of the ToolPopup.



I hope this helps.





Kind Regards,

Ruben Tuider

text:
Hi all,

 I am starting to work in sapui5. I want to populate table uielement with
output data of RFC in SAP. Can u brief me the steps how to achieve the data
binding from SAP R/3 to SAPUI5. Kindly answer my query at the earliest.





Thanks in advance.

Kiruthika P
author: kiruthika Periyasamy
migarate tulsi
text:
Hi,



I am also going to start UI5. Please provide me initial steps which I have to
perform for making the setup.



Thanks
title: Re:how to populate ui elements in sapui5 from output of RFC data from SAP R/3

author: Graham Robinson
text:
Hi Kiruthika,



this is exactly what NetWeaver Gateway is for. You can build your own service
in ABAP to expose this data yourself but Gateway has been built from the
ground up to do this for you.



[Bertram Ganz](http://scn.sap.com/people/bertram.ganz) wrote a great tutorial
that covers the full end-to-end process for creating a Gateway service and
consuming it in a SAPUI5 user interface. You can find the link to it in his
[blog](http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/front-end/blog/2012/12/10
/new-e2e-tutorial-gain-hands-on-developer-experience-with-sapui5-and-
netweaver-gateway).



Cheers

Graham Robbo

author: Lucy Liu
text:
Hi,Abesh,

After I update my sapui5 to 2013.1.11 version, all the workItem in the
shell(sap.ui.ux3.Shell) not response to the click, as if the event can not be
listened, oShell.attachWorksetItemSelected(selectWorkItem); my function
selectWorkItem is not reached,While the shell is ok in other project, what do
you think caused this problem? Thank you
title: Re:Data binding using javascript ?

author: Graham Robinson
text:
Hi Abesh,



think I have cracked this. You need to bind the property as follows.



**_dataset1 = new sap.viz.ui5.data.FlattenedDataset();_**



**_var dimObject = new sap.viz.ui5.data.DimensionDefinition();_**

**_dimObject.setAxis(1);_**

**_dimObject.setName("Product");_**

**_dimObject.bindProperty("value","Material"); /* Use this instead of setValue method */_**



**_dataset1.addDimension(dimObject);_**



**_var measObject = new sap.viz.ui5.data.MeasureDefinition();_**

**_measObject.setName("Quantity");_**

**_measObject.bindProperty("value","PercQuantity"); **_/* Use this instead of setValue method */_**_**



**_dataset1.addMeasure(measObject);_**



**_dataset1.bindData("/Rowset/Row", "");_**



Cheers

Graham Robbo

How to connect to database
text:
Hello Experts,



I am new to SAP UI5 and have few questions:

  1. Can we connect directly to any Database (SQL Server, Oracle, SAP BW etc) and bring data to SAP UI5 app?
  2. Can we connect to a Web Service to get live data in SAP UI5 app?
  3. Are there any SAP official tutorials for UI5? Could you share the link?



Would appreciate if you can share any guides or tutorials and help me to start
with SAP UI5.



Thank you.



Regards,

Vinay Mhaske
author: Vinaykumar Mhaske
Graham Robinson
text:
Hi Vinay,



SAPUI5 is built upon JQuery as it's foundation. You can perform connectivity
to any backend that JQuery supports and in addition SAP have built in extra
handling for OData. You can also add any other framework you like to support
other data sources - it is after all just HTML & Javascript.



The evaluation package for SAPUI5 includes tutorials and documentation. You
can find more at <http://developers.sap.com>.



Cheers

Graham Robbo

title: sap.m.List does not maintain display position after returning from detail view
text:
Hello experts,



I'm not sure if this question has been asked many times... Basically, we can
click an item in a sap.m.List object to go to details view. When we go back
from details to the list, the list does not maintain its display position. For
example, let's say we create a long list and we have scrolled down to the
bottom. After we come back to the list, the screen always shows the items at
the top of the list, like first time creating the list. This is kind of
annoying as we have to scroll down to the position we just worked with.



This is observed in both the SAPUI5 testsuite and our own apps. In native
mobile apps, the display position of a list is always maintained, so we can
easily start browsing the list from the latest position.



Could anyone please advise a solution. Thanks,



Jay

Table row strangeness
text:
Hello,



I have a table with a xml model underneath it. Couple of the columns have
filters. The table has 10 visible rows and about 19 rows of data.

Not all the data of the xml model is shown on the table. I'm trying to get a
value from the model that isn't visible/binded in the table:



    
    
    var path = table.getRows()[table.getSelectedIndex()].getCells()[0].getBindingContext().getPath(); //return /document/0 for the 1st row
    var name = xmlModel.getProperty(path+"/@name"); //return the value I want to use 



this works great as long as the selected row is among the 10 visible rows.
Scrolling down to the end of the table and executing this code will give an
error because getRows() only returns an array of the visible rows (10 in this
case) but getSelectedIndex() will return eg 18.



Q1. Is this intended? I'd rather say these 2 should work on the same set of
data. getRows() should return all the rows. Or getSelectedIndex() should
return an integer within the range of the table, in this case 0-9 .



Changing the code to something like this:



    
    
    var name = xmlModel.getProperty("/document/"+table.getSelectedIndex()+"/@name");

This does work for the problem above.



This goes horribly wrong the minute I use filters. If I apply a filter and the
result of this is 1 row and I execute the 2nd codesnippet I will always end up
with /document/0 because I click on the first row.



Q2. How to select the proper row in the model from a filtered dataset? I could
use the first codesnippet to get the proper path. But to implement a check to
see if the filter is on and use one of these examples feels more like a cheap
workaround.



regard,

Matthias
author: Matthias Gamsjager
Matthias Gamsjager
title: Re:Table row strangeness
Limit for displayed items in sap.m.List
text:
Hello guys,



I observed that sap.m.List only shows the top 100 rows if I got a query result
with more than 100 rows. Data of the list is binded from a JSON model. I'm
sure that data in the model is correct.



I didn't see anywhere to set the limit or automatic paging for a list. Could
anyone give a hint how we can show all data in the list?



Thanks!



Jay
author: Jay Xue
Jay Xue
text:
I have got the solution to this. We need to set limit using
sap.ui.model.Model.setSizeLimit() to enable a list to bind more items.
title: Re:Limit for displayed items in sap.m.List

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/ThemingFAQ.html>

in particular the sections:

 "How can I provide additional CSS which is not overwritten by the UI5
CSS?"

and

 "I am adding a style class, but it does not work! Why?"

\- usually this type of issues comes from CSS precedence rules: your style is
there but some other style is considered more important by the browser.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:SAPUI5 Dropdownbox class?
Tabstrip in XML view
text:
Hi everyone,

I've coded the following:

    
    
    <core:View xmlns:core="sap.ui.core" xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc" xmlns:table="sap.ui.table" xmlns="sap.ui.commons" xmlns:cl="sap.ui.commons.layout" controllerName="core_web_crm.controllers.OrderManagement"
     xmlns:html="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" resourceBundleUrl="assets/i18n/i18n.properties" resourceBundleAlias="i18n">
     <TabStrip width="200px" height="300px" tooltip="test">
     <tabs>
     <Tab id="mytab" title="test" tooltip="test">
     </Tab>
     </tabs>
     </TabStrip>
    </core:View>

but at runtime I'm getting an error:

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getTooltip_AsString' of null



Any ideas?

Thanks you!

Regards



I managed to find where the issue was. There was a missing attribute in the
Tab element tag (which the documentation didn't qualify as mandatory...):
<Tab id="mytab" title="test" tooltip="test" text="Header" >
</Tab> Message was edited by: Marco
author: Marco Paciucci
Marco Paciucci
text:
I managed to find where the issue was. There was a missing attribute
text="Header" in the Tab element tag (which the documentation didn't qualify
as mandatory).

The correct declaration is therefore:

<Tab id="mytab" title="test" tooltip="test"
text="Header">





Regards
title: Re:Tabstrip in XML view

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Marco,



you are partly right: the Tab throws an error when it does not have EITHER the
"title" or the "text" set. This is a bug and will be fixed. Thanks!



Now you could say: "well, but I _did _configure a title". But this is not the
case:the "title" is not a string property, but an agregation of type
"sap.ui.commons.Title".

(See <https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.commo
ns.Tab.html> and navigate to the Panel control where this aggregation is
defined)

So title="text" does not lead to a valid result.



You could call this API "historically grown", but basically it allows two ways
of giving a tab title text: either by simply setting a string ("text"
property) or by giving a more complex object which can hold other information,
like an icon, in addition to the title text ("title" aggregation).



Regards

Andreas

JQuery instead of SAPUI. But when i use SAPUI5 the data is not fetched from
the SAP system via service. I have tested the OData and the service DEMO_BANK
is fine. There has to be some issue with my calling the service in HTML.



[![sapui5_demo.jpg](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-139
16270-195050/517-262/sapui5_demo.jpg)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/
showImage/2-13916270-195050/sapui5_demo.jpg)

author: Ravi Aswani
saurabh vakil
text:
Hi Ravi,



I too have faced this issue. I got this to work in IE 8 (but neither in
Firefox nor Chrome).



You have to enable cross domain data access in IE settings. In Internet
Explorer go to **Tools **-> **Internet Options **-> **Security** tab
-> select **Internet **and click on the button **Custom level**. Under the
**Miscellaneous** section, for the property **Access data sources across
domains **select **Enable **and then try to open the application. It will
fetch the data. Refer below image.



[![CrossDomainDataAccess.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadI
mage/2-13917109-195040/353-400/CrossDomainDataAccess.png)](http://scn.sap.com/
servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-13917109-195040/CrossDomainDataAccess.png)



Regards,

Saurabh

title: Re:How to get reference to View Elements from Controller class?

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Sandip,



please note that this is valid for JSViews where you directly give the ID of
the contained controls.



In XMLViews/JSONViews all such IDs are automatically prefixed with the View ID
to ensure uniqueness even when several instances of the same View are used
within one application. In this case you can say:

controller.byId(...) or view.byId(...)

instead of asking the Core. This automatically adds the prefix.



Regards

Andreas

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi Konstantin



I believe Mike is right and that the browser defaults to whatever input help
is associated with <input type="date"> .You may want to check that link
in different browsers on mobile devices



Other areas of SAPUI5 use a custom version of the jQuery UI Date Picker, I can
see why they didn't use this, something like [Mobiscroll-
datetime](http://demo.mobiscroll.com/datetime#theme=android-ics+light) which
has various configurable features making the date picker more device
applicable would be better.



my findings testing the sap.m input type date for those interested

\- my Galaxy tab using the stock browser defaults to Android DatePicker with
Calendar with ICS light theme and works fine

\- on my Galaxy s3 phone using stock browser or Dolphin Browser both default
to Android DatePicker with ICS dark theme, consistently the new date gets
truncated along with old date

\- on my Galaxy s3 phone using Google Chrome for Mobile defaults to js date
picker library and works fine

\- on my Galaxy s3 phone using Firefox browser for Android no associated date
picker

\- on Android Emulator using the stock browser there is no associated date
picker - same webkit version as tab and phone.



[![Stock.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-13868905-
188412/150-266/Stock.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-

author: Sandip Agarwalla

title: Re:How to assign actions to sap.m.Buttons

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi Sandip

What scope are you referring to here?



The simplest way to explain Javascript scope is it refers to your current
location and '**this**' refers to the parent of your location.



In my code i noticed when i used

tap: oController.clickBackButton \- this.message was undefined as **'this'**
was the tap event and not the controller



tap function() {oController.clickBackButton()} - this.message works because
**'this**' was the controller



<http://coding.smashingmagazine.com/2009/08/01/what-you-need-to-know-about-
javascript-scope/> a good article on 'this' topic



Cheers

JSP

title: Re:Error in installation

author: Raul Romero
text:
Hi guys.





Well today I've installed SAP Application Development on Eclipse Juno.
Remember that SAPUI5 Framework works alone with a Apache Tomcat Server, and
with any Eclipse IDE (from Indigo to the rest) nor Visual Studio 2010.





1\. Check if you have installed Eclipse IDE with Apache Tomcat Server. If
don't please fix it,

2\. Once you've downloaded the .zip file with the tools, unzip this to a local
directory ( like Desktop or C:/TEMP). By default the name of this folder is
"HTML5Evaluation_complete"

3\. Open your Eclipse IDE and go to Help-->Install new software....

4\. In that popup click on "Add" button. A popup with header "Add repository"
appears.

5\. Click on "Local..." button and write the path of the "tools-updatesite"
folder (this is in the "HTML5Evaluation_complete" folder you unzip in step
2.).

6\. Click OK

7\. Now there is a node named SAP UI Development Toolkit for HTML5. Check on
it or click on "Select All"

8\. Now click on "Next".

9\. Accept the license user agreement and click "Next".

10\. Follow the next steps and wait until the IDE installs the SAP Project.

11\. After all these steps, restart your Eclipse IDE.

12\. You can check your installation if follow the steps
File->New->Other... and there will be a node with the name SAPUI5
Application Development, with its nodes (Application Project and View)





All this information is in Readme_and_InstallationInformation.html file placed
in the .zip. And about the JDK, in my case is the jdk1.7.0_05.



Hope it was helpful for you.

Bye.

author: Dhivya Baskaran

author: Raul Romero
text:
Hi.

Well, any web app in Eclipse in order to be deployed and debugged needs a web
server. In my case, and based on my experience, Apache Tomcat Server is all
what you need. Try to download the last version of this web server.



Please, I need these information:

1\. Did you download the Eclipse IDE, Juno version? If not, please do it.

2\. After you've installed Eclipse IDE, in your Eclipse IDE go to
Help-->Check for updates.

3\. If you want to install the last Apache Tomcat web server from Eclipse, go
to File->New-->Other.

4\. In the next window, type "Server". Select the Server node and click Next.

5\. Select from the listbox the server "Tomcat v7.0 Server".

6\. Clic in option Download and Install.



Hope I help you.

Is there a comprehensive guide on how to use models, binding and context? For

author: M. Overmeijer

text:
Each Model has a method.



getProperty(sPath, oContext_?_)



Implement in inheriting classes

Parameters:

{string}| **sPath**| the path to where to read the attribute value  
---|---|---  
{object}| **oContext**_?, Default: null_| the context with which the path
should be resolved

title: Re:Models, bindings and context

author: M. Overmeijer
text:
Hi Konstantin,



According to the documentation sap.ui.getCore().setModel() sets the model
globally for all controls of the view. But when I have a sap.m.List, I must
set the model to the list as well (list.setModel), otherwise the list will not
get filled from the model.



Do you know why this is? Why having a global setModel() ?



Kind regards,

Mike Overmeijer
title: Re:Models, bindings and context

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Mike,



controls are only connected to global models after the UI5 core is
initialized, which happens in the jQuery(document).ready() event after the
browser has finished parsing the body.



If you wait until then, the global model will be available in the List as
well:

jQuery(function(){ // this waits until the core is initialized

 alert(list.getModel());

}



See

<http://jsbin.com/aku_mobile_list/1/>



By the way: this is the exactly same for UI5 desktop controls. Trust me: the
UI5 core is really, really, really identical (I mean: you load the same file,
right?)and the difference is only that controls are optimized for only one of
the platforms. :-)



Regards

Andreas

UI5](http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/front-end/blog/2013/02/22

Hope it will help.



Regards,

I prefer not to set the Model to the Core of SAPUI5, but bind it direct to

isolated.



Best Regards

title: UI5 SAP Help on Safari
text:
Hi,



I was under the impression that if we have an application in HTML5( SAP UI5 in
SAP world), then it would adjust to the end device(desktop, tablet,
phone,etc). However, starngely, even the SAP
help(<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#content%2FOverview.html>) on
UI5 does not show correctly on a Safaribrowser(iPad). The content below a page
gets truncated. Even rotating the device does not help.



I presume this SAP help site is itself built using SAP UI5.



Are we going a step back or is it a bug? Do we have other users having a
similar issue?



Thanks

Jayant
author: Kumar Jayant
Konstantin Anikeev
text:
Hi Kumar,



indeed, [https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/](https://sapui5.netweaver.onde
mand.com/sdk/#content%2FOverview.html) does not work properly on iPad.

But I think, that's just a css/js design and some customer js-handling only
for help application. There is a iframe for content, which may be not correct
processed by safary on touch screens.



Native app with sap.ui.ux3.Shell works fine on iPad (content is scrollable).



Best Regards

Konsatntin
title: Re:UI5 SAP Help on Safari

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi,



you are of course right that HTML content can be displayed across a wide range
of devices.

But when the content/controls get more powerful and interactive, then also a
lot of JavaScript gets involved. And in general you don't get everything for
free on mobile devices.



As one example: you can't just have a <div> with overflow:auto to make
the content scrollable, as you are used to do in desktop browsers. Mobile
browsers just won't scroll. The newest versions try to make up for that with
other CSS properties, but support is buggy and inconsistent.



Anyway, I just wanted to point out that there is some effort involved to make
web UIs work across devices. And when we talk about something like responsive
layout, then this doesn't mean everything happens by magic, but someone has to
actually do something to make it behave as desired.



You may have noticed that most JavaScript libraries have a version for desktop
browsers and one for touch devices (e.g. jQuery UI and jQuery mobile, ExtJS
and Sencha Touch,...). I guess that technical differences as well as different
target user experience were the reason for this.



Even in SAPUI5, another such library, there is a control set (the "sap.m"
library) optimized for touch devices only, while the other controls are mainly
targeting desktop browsers. Note that the library core itself is identical in
the case of SAPUI5, which makes cross-platform development easier.



The SAPUI5 demokit which you have tried on iPad has been built with those
desktop-optimized controls. They have a fair share of touch enablement (e.g.
if the screen is narrow, you can scroll the workset items on top of the Shell
with your finger and Konstantin pointed out that the control itself actually
would allow scrolling). But there are things which do not fully work yet and
you have spotted one of those, where the SDK application seems to have broken
the scrolling behavior.

Thanks for letting us know - this should indeed be improved.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:UI5 SAP Help on Safari

author: Kumar Jayant
text:
Hi Andreas,



Thanks for the explanation.



Just to be clear, Are you saying that even before the start of development, we
need to be clear about the device on which the application is to be used?



If this is true, then we have different set of choices to start with. For
example, for desktop applications in SAP, we could use WDA(comes in the game
as it being enhanced to have better look and feel  Update from SAP in one
of the workshops attended in Waldorf ). Similarly, for mobile devices, we
would have native languages(iOS, Android, etc) to be considered.





OR, we design for one device and have the possibility to extend it to other
devices with minor changes?

This is what I believe(or say expect) of SAP UI5.



Its quite important to have good understanding on what will/will not work on
which device while designing and developing. Where is the best source for this
information?



Being with technology governance team, knowing the limitations and roadmap for
a technlogy is very important.



Thanks

Jayant
title: Re:UI5 SAP Help on Safari

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi,

the best source of information for platform support is the documentation here:

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/BrowserSupport.html>



You are right that SAPUI5 could be the SAP UI technology of choice when you
want to support multiple platforms from desktop to smartphones with ONE
development paradigm and with a certain level of code reuse between platforms.

I think in this reuse and adaptation area SAPUI5 can get even better in the
future. The common core for all platforms is a good foundation for that.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:UI5 SAP Help on Safari
No navigation using app.to
author: M. Overmeijer
Konstantin Anikeev
text:
Hi Mike,



I'm using a pointer to view instead of its string name, and for me works
fine...

In the Dev Guide it is also so...

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/MVC.1.html>



May be just an error in API Reference...



Best Regards

Konstantin
title: Re:No navigation using app.to

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Mike,



both, the ID or a pointer work, as documented.



The issue in your case is that IDs of controls within XMLViews are always
prefixed with the ID of the XMLView itself, to avoid duplicate IDs in case a
View is used several times within one application.



The second View does therefore not have the ID "timelistView", but something
like "rootView--timelistView". Hence the to(...) does not find the control
with the given ID.

The easiest solution is to always resolve IDs using the View when accessing
XMLView/JSONView controls in the respective controller:



app.to(this.getView().byId("timelistView"));



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:No navigation using app.to

author: M. Overmeijer
text:
Hi Andreas,



Even via byId() it does not work. I checked and byId() returns an undefined..
The only way I have it working now is by point each screen to a global
variable and use this global variable in the app.to call.. This way navigation
works as the screen exists. The screen is unknown when calling
this.getView().byId() or sap.ui.getCore().byId(). This seems very odd to me;
you must specify the screens in the App object, but the screens are not
accessible..



Kind regards,

Mike
title: Re:No navigation using app.to

author: Konstantin Anikeev
text:
Hi Mike,



actually you must not specify all the screens. You can load them after login
and attach to app.

So you can achieve a faster app load till the first screen.



Actually application have all your pages, and you should be able even Navigate
with app.to(app.mAggregations.pages[0])...



In your case it will not work, because you call a processing on Button Event.

this.getView() retuns in this case a pointer to the view, where the button
placed - e.g. LoginView. byId() - will not find your next view, because you
next view not included into your current view (it included into application
view).



try to call app.to("testApp--timelistView"), will it work?



Best Regards

Konstantin
title: Re:No navigation using app.to

author: M. Overmeijer
text:
Hi Konstantin,



Such call does work !



Thanks,

Mike
title: Re:No navigation using app.to

author: Andreas Kunz
text:

They have loads of features which are not available when debugging e.g. Java.



Maybe you can elaborate on your debugging pain.

title: Re:Does UI5 is Developer friendly?

author: M. Overmeijer
text:
Hi Andreas,



I'm used to IDE's like xcode, Visual Studio etc. Here you can debug by
stepping through the code. In the SAPUI5 environment I have not seen such easy
way of debugging, only alerts and console output seem possible.



Kind regards,

Mike
title: Re:Does UI5 is Developer friendly?

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Mike,



sorry, I do not understand your point. What you describe as "SAPUI5
environment" is normal web development (with all its advantages and
disadvantages). There is nothing different from debugging and doing
development in let's say jQuery, YahooUI, Sencha Touch or Dojo.

But certainly you can do MUCH more than using alert and console. Just see the
above comments from others.



You can use the IDE of your choice and the browser of your choice. Browsers
have great development tools which allow you not only to debug code step by
step, watch variables, set conditional breakpoints, watch call stacks etc.
(all the normal debugging), but also do some stuff which goes far beyond that
(inspect and modify DOM and CSS, analyze memory behavior, timelines of
repainting and relayouting, etc.



The only difference to debugging languages liek ABAP and Java is that in web
development people normally do not do the debugging stuff in their IDE. Even
that is possible with some specialized IDEs, but the integrated development
tools in browsers allow for the browser specific under-the-hood analysis.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Does UI5 is Developer friendly?

author: M. Overmeijer
text:

Just tried Firefox with firebug, but it is giving me several errors when
running the SAPUI5 application:

<http://localhost:49441/IdeoMwm/resources/sap-ui-core.js>

Line 41



The character encoding of the HTML document was not declared. The document
will render with garbled text in some browser configurations if the document
contains characters from outside the US-ASCII range. The character encoding of
the page must be declared in the document or in the transfer protocol.

<http://localhost:49441/IdeoMwm/mindex.html?sap-ui-xx-fakeOS=ios>

Line 0



Do you know how to solve this?



Kind regards,

Mike
title: Re:Does UI5 is Developer friendly?

author: Robin van het Hof
text:
Hi Mike,



regarding the SecurityError, are all requests coming from the same domain
(localhost), port (49441) and protocol (http)?



As for the HTML character encoding, you can add



`<meta charset="UTF-8"> `

**  
**

in your HTML HEAD section

SAPUI5 installation on apache webserver
text:
Hi,

 We would like to have production applications running on apache webserver
rather portal or ABAP app servers. As apache is officialy supported by SAP how
to get the static libraries to install it in apache. Or is there any work
around ?



Thanks in advance,

Abdul Raheem
author: Abdul Raheem
Sandip Agarwalla
text:
To get the UI5 libraries, you need to install the following UI5 files to the
server

1) sapui5.war

2) demokit.war



regarding the productive usage, I am bit apprehensive as the UI5 version is
still in beta version. That does not stop you from developing your Ui5 apps,
but rather the support part...



Lets see what the experts have to say.



Sandip
title: Re:SAPUI5 installation on apache webserver

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Abdul,



technically, the sapui5-static.zip file from the SDN download would be the
appropriate one to unzip and put on an Apache web server.

The WAR files are for Java servers - the content is the same, but the "static"
version just is one big compressed directory tree, while the WAR file contains
JAR files as further archives inside and some Java-specific metadata.



Regarding the official process and license I can't really give an answer. The
SDN download is only meant and licensed as a trial version, even though it
contains the same functionality as the SAPUI5 version which comes in your ABAP
server.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:SAPUI5 installation on apache webserver
sap.m vs sap.ui
text:
Hi,



According to the documentation, the mobile applications using sap.m are
basically the same applications as desktop applications using sap.ui with the
main difference the sap.m controls are optimized for mobile devices. I created
two applications using these packages but ran into some issues and I am
wondering whether documentation is wrong, I found a bug or I made a mistake:



_Resource bundles_

When calling jQuery.sap.resources to read a resource bundle, the sap.ui
application will be able to read resources.en-US.properties, but the sap.m
application will not find the resource. I have to rename the resource to
resources.en.properties.



_Binding_

In the sap.ui application, I set a JSON model in the controller via
sap.ui.getCore().setModel(model); In the view I bind this to a TextView via

value: "{/test/value}". This works fine.

In the sap.m application, I set the same JSON model the same way, in the view
I bind the value to a sap.m.Input control via:

value: "{/test/value}". This will lead to an error: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot
set property 'value' of undefined



Any ideas?

  
Kind regards,

Mike Overmeijer
author: M. Overmeijer
Konstantin Anikeev
text:
Hi Mike,



Error: Cannot set property 'value' of undefined

Says, that you could not get a reference to input control before assigning
the value.

Search for error earlier...



Best Regards

Konstantin
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: M. Overmeijer
text:
Hi Konstantin,



It looks like it has to do with the model not being available in the context.
In the controller I set the model, when I retrieve the model in the view, it
is undefined...



Kind regards,

Mike
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: Konstantin Anikeev
text:
Hi,



need a code...

How you set it, and how you get it?



And of course, what do you want to achieve...



Best Regards

Konstantin
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: M. Overmeijer
text:
Hi Konstantin,



What I want to archive is to bind a model to the screen; when I enter data in
an inputbox, the value will be stored in the model which then can be used in
the controller to do the processing.



In the desktop version of SAPUI5 this works exactly as I described, in the
mobile version the binding of model to the input box seems not to work.



Kind regards,

Mike
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: M. Overmeijer
text:
Hi Konstatin,



One other strange thing I noticed is the following:



I have this mobile SAPUI5 project which has a view with a page. The page has a
button; a function is attached to the tap event. I implemented the method in
the controller of the view. When I run the application and tap the button, the
method of the controller is executed. So far so good, but when I perform
alert(this) in the controllers method, it says the current object is the
button, not the controller...



This way I cannot call app.to, because the app instance is not known in the
button, only in the controllers.



Kind regards,

Mike
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: Andreas Kunz
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: M. Overmeijer
text:
Hi Andreas,



Thanks for the explanation. The way I set up the application is with a clear
separation of concern, where the controller is called by the button.



In my case I had "tap: oController.method" which called the controller method,
but with the button context apparently. Not being a webdeveloper, but used to
WPF/Objective-C, this context behaviour I did not expect.



I updated my code and now I get the controller context. Thanks for your help!



Kind regards,

Mike
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Mike,



yes, the whole thing around the "this" context and statements like "var that =
this" can be really confusing, when not being used to JavaScript
development...



Good to know that it helped!

Andreas
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: Konstantin Anikeev
text:
Hi Mike,



this is correct. Event happens for button, that is why _**this**_ is a Button.

As for application. I prefer to save a reference to Application as a global
variable. In that case, application is always available for me.



Please check my blog [post regarding Google
Maps](http://scn.sap.com/people/konstantin.anikeev/blog/2013/02/11/sapui5
-with-google-maps)

Parts 3 and 4.



  1. sap.ui.controller("v.appView", { 
  2.  onInit : function() { 
  3.  // remember the App Control 
  4.  oApplication = this.getView().byId("appMaps"); 
  5.  } 
  6. }); 



In that case you can use oApplication as an sap.m.app anywhere in your code.



Best Regards

Konstantin
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Mike,



for your second point please check these examples:

<http://jsbin.com/aku_plain_databinding/1/edit>

<http://jsbin.com/aku_plain_databinding_mobile/1/edit>



So basically it works fine. I guess inthis case there's an issue within your
application.



The second point is not that easy to recreate in jsbin, but the mechanism for
loading the resource bundles is in the UI5 core which is identical in both
cases, so there should also really not be a difference.



And regarding sap.m vs. sap.ui.commons: it's true that from a technical
perspective those are all just control libraries and the difference is only in
the control implementation.

When the sap.m library is loaded and also when the sap.m.App control is
instantiated, they do some modification to the page like setting viewport for
best display on mobile devices, so the resulting look may have be affected by
whether or not sap.m is used, But these differences are not related to the
overall UI5 concepts and their usage.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: M. Overmeijer
text:
Hi,



What I noticed is after calling sap.ui.getCore().setModel(model) in the mobile
SAPUI5, the model is not available to the controls of the view. Only when I
directly set the model to f.e. an input box, I wont get the error "Uncaught
TypeError: Cannot set property 'value' of undefined".



Kind regards,

Mike
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Mike,

please check my other reply to this observation.



As a further proof I built a small app where both desktop AND mobile controls
are used!

<http://jsbin.com/aku_mobile_and_commons_list/1/>

(a sap.m.List and a sap.ui.commons.Button)



Both have their text bound to the same data model in the same way. And for
both an alert shows the value of getModel() BEFORE and AFTER UI5 Core
initialization.



You see they behave exactly the same.



You also see the commons Button looks ugly. This is because the Mobile theme
("sap_mvi") is not available for the desktop controls, which is one way in
which they are specialized for their target platform, and which is one reason
to _please _not mix them in applications (apart from the overhead of loading
lots of unneeded stuff).



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: M. Overmeijer
text:
Hi Andreas,



I finally found out what is happening.. I have declared two views in my mobile
application. Both views have their own model initialized in the onInit() of
the controller. Apparently when the application is started, both views are
initialized even though the first screen is set as initial screen. The second
onInit sets its model and overwrites the model of the first onInit as I don't
merge the models (I did not expect this behaviour).



This behaviour is different for desktop SAPUI as it does not call onInit for
all controllers at startup..



Kind regards,

Mike
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Mike,

  
the onInit method of a controller is called as soon as the View is
instantiated.

See this example:

<http://jsbin.com/etekek/1/>

This is independent of any mobile/desktop decision. View/Controller are again
part of the UI5 core, not of a mobile or desktop library.

  
There is a "desktop" Button added to the View in this case, so you could call
it a desktop app. But adding a sap.m.Button to the View instead, making it a
"mobile app" would not change its initialization behavior.



The difference you observe is probably caused by how/when you instantiate the
View: maybe you have a sap.ui.ux3.Shell on desktop and the views are
instantiated lazily once the user clicks on the respective workset item. So
onInit is only called for the one View you choose to instantiate immediately.

And in your mobile app you instantiate all Views at the same time and add them
to the App control. So onInit is called on all immediately.



This would lead to the behavior you mention, but is solely caused by your
choice when to instantiate the View. You could also create the mobile Views
lazily and the desktop Views all instantly, then the behavior would be
inverted.

  
Regards

Andreas
title: Re:sap.m vs sap.ui

Update View X from controller Y
text:
Hi, I want to Bind data model of View "X" from controller "Y". On selection
of event in View "Y" i should get the context of view "X". Can someone help
me on this. I tried below code but did work out.
helloworld.onNodeSelectionChangeHandler = function(oData) {
this.oView = new helloUniverse({viewName:"helloUniverse"}); } This leads to
below error Uncaught Error: Error: adding element with duplicate id
'oPromptValueList-vsb' because this view is already place in my panel and i
want to re-populate the Bind data model. Thanks in advance Regards, Pallavi
author: Pallavi K.R
Konstantin Anikeev
text:
Hi Pallavi,



you should not create a View each time you need it. Create only once.

I use following approach.



1\. Define Global object as



var oApplication = {};



2\. Also views object for it



oApplication.views = {};



3\. and then by creating any new view just assign it to Application.



oApplication.views["helloUniverse"] = new
helloUniverse({viewName:"helloUniverse"});



If you need a view reference somewhere later - just use
oApplication.views.helloUniverse



Best Regards

Konstantin
title: Re:Update View X from controller Y

duplicate id 'oPromptListTable-vsb' - sap-ui-core-nojQuery.js:8 Uncaught
Error: Error: adding element with duplicate id 'oPromptListTable-vsb' Do you

Issue with localStorage in HTML5 page
author: saurabh vakil
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Saurabh,



I think there is much more not working, including the localStorage.

When you say "Save Page..." in a browser, it will save the current HTML as a
file and a number of related resources as well.

When you load the same, the error message you saw says that even the core of
SAPUI5 could not be loaded because of security restrictions. Browsers are a
bit different, but basically they will often not allow loading stuff from the
file system, sometimes they will if the page is also on the file system.



Even if access was allowed, I wouldn't bet that sap-ui-core.js has been stored
there. Well, maybe it has, because it is directly referred to in the page. But
all the resources loaded with AJAX requests? Browsers cannot easily save whole
web pages so they do fully work from a file system. At least that's my
experience.



Anyway,there is no UI5 at all in the page. If it looks like there are UI5
controls, then this is the case because the HTML they produced (and probably
the CSS files) has been saved. Maybe even your value from localStorage is
actually part of the HTML file and not fetched again. LocalStorage is done per
site I thought, which would mean the saved page cannot access the same data.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Issue with localStorage in HTML5 page

author: saurabh vakil
text:
Hi Andreas,



What I was basically trying to achieve was this - the user opens the page,
enters some value and saves it in the local storage. Then he should be able to
save this page offline. When he again opens up the saved page while being
offline, he should be able to see the value that was entered while he was
online. The purpose is to be able to display the page with the data in it even
when there is no network connectivity available.



I am not fully sure whether localStorage is the right approach for this, I was
just exploring this possibility though.



Regards,

Saurabh
title: Re:Issue with localStorage in HTML5 page

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Saurabh,

please open the saved HTML file in a text editor.

You will see the entered value hardcoded in the HTML!

This is because Firefox stores the current page state. There is no need for
localStorage.



Chrome, on the other hand does not immediately take over the user value, it
seems to store the initial value. I didn't test the other browsers, they may
all behave differently.



For your use-case it is probably best to make sure the HTML in the page
contains everything you want to see later. Or you can dynamically create some
inline script which restores a certain state.



But be warned: both browsers I tested do NOT store any UI5 control files. The
UI in a saved page may look ok, but it is "dead". UI5 controls will not react
on clicks or so.



Regards

Andreas Kunz
title: Re:Issue with localStorage in HTML5 page

author: saurabh vakil
text:
Thanks Andreas for the clarification .



The code that I included in my first post was just to test the localStorage
concept.



In my actual scenario, I will be having a page which shows some data in a
table UI and I want to make sure that users are able to access this particular
page with the same data in the table while being offline. So in this case when
the users opens the HTML page online, the data is present in the table and its
just that I want to ensure that user is able to see the same even when he is
not connected to the network.



I should also clarify that our users will be viewing these HTML pages on
mobile devices, not on desktop systems. So I am looking for a way to enable
users access these pages even when data network is not available on their
mobile devices.



Regards,

Saurabh
title: Re:Issue with localStorage in HTML5 page

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Ok, to clarify even more with your concrete example:

The user might be able to see the data in the Table in a stored HTML page, but
the Table would not be scrollable (because it uses JavaScript-driven virtual
scrolling/paging and that JS is not saved with the page).



However, you now talk about Mobile, which makes things more interesting. :-)

There is a feature called "[offline web
applications](http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-
work/multipage/offline.html)" where web apps can mark certain files as
important (in a kind of manifest file), so the browser would guarantee to
store them (just like in a cache, but reliably).

So the user would not have to save files, he could just launch the app
normally and it would run without server connection. In this scenario you
could use localStorage, and UI5 should run normally - if the cache manifest
contains all required files.

Caveat: as far as I have heard, this browser feature does/did not seem to work
properly in all cases.



Another option would be to use the hybrid app approach, wrapping the UI5 app
in PhoneGap. Then it also runs without network and you can store data locally.



But I think testing with the "Save Page" functionality in desktop browsers
will not help you to understand either of these scenarios.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Issue with localStorage in HTML5 page

author: saurabh vakil
text:
Thanks Andreas, your inputs have indeed been valuable!!



I will try out the offline web applications approach you have suggested and
update this thread with the results. I think this approach involves including
a manifest file with a list of the files that need to maintained by the
browser locally.



Regards,

Saurabh
title: Re:Issue with localStorage in HTML5 page

SAP UI5 in NDWS?
text:
Hi All

As far I know SAP UI5 is currently in beta mode. When is the GA mode planned
and also the plug in for NWDS?



Thanks

Sandip
author: Sandip Agarwalla
Erhan Keseli
text:
\- SAPUI5 plans an update of the SDN delivery within the next 2 weeks. The
content will be the runtime version 1.4.2



\- The UI5 tools (eclipse plug-ins) will not yet be included. Some
formal/legal processes are required and we do not exactly know when they will
be settled. The next SDN update including tools will be done 1-2 weeks after
settlement.





The official SAP shipment channels for SAPUI5 will be:



\- SAP NetWeaver Cloud formerly called JPaaS/Neo. The tools will be added in
roughly 2-3 months, runtime is already shipped.



\- NW Java 7.31 SP5 planned for Q4/2012 (SAPUI5 runtime version 1.6). 7.30
later.



\- non-modifying NetWeaver ABAP add-on called NW UI Extension V1.0 currently
scheduled for  
September 2012 (runtime + tools version1.6).

Data not getting fetched from demo gateway system
text:
Hi Experts,



I have implemented the blog article **Consume NetWeaver Gateway services via
SAPUI5 - Part 1** given at <http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center
/front-end/blog/2012/10/15/consume-netweaver-gateway-services-via-sapui5> by
Ivan Fermia.



I am working on **NWDS 7.3 SP08 PAT0003 **and I have installed SAPUI5 toolkit
(**version 1.8.4) **within my NWDS.



As suggested by Raul Romero in the comments section, I added a prefix into the
Gateway Service URL and wrote '**/proxy/**<http://gw.esworkplace.sap.com/sap/o
pu/odata/IWBEP/RMTSAMPLEFLIGHT_2>'

instead of
'<http://gw.esworkplace.sap.com/sap/opu/odata/IWBEP/RMTSAMPLEFLIGHT_2'>



Also according to Kaloyan Raev's suggestion in the comments section, I
replaced the line

**oTable.bindRows('FlightCollection'); **

with **oTable.bindRows('/FlightCollection'); **by writing a leading slash
before FlightCollection.



I am running this application from NWDS by right clicking on my SAPUI5
Application Project and selecting Run As -> Web App Preview as shown below.



[![RunAs.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2-13812156-
179919/417-400/RunAs.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-

1:1 OData binding (NW Gateway demo service)
text:
Hi,



I'm using the NW Gateway demo service to play around and create a sales order
application.

I have succeeded to list all sales orders using the NW Gateway service and
also, when clicking on an order, to display details about the order and all
order items.

What I'm trying now is to get also data from the Business Partner relation.



So here's my main view:



    
    
    var serviceUrl = "http://gw.esworkplace.sap.com/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZCD204_EPM_DEMO_SRV";
    [...]
    oModel = new sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel(serviceUrl, asJson, username, password);
    this.getView().setModel(oModel);
    var oTable = this.byId("orders_table");
    oTable.bindRows("SalesOrders");
    var oDetails = this.byId("details");
    var oItems = this.byId("items");
    oTable.attachRowSelectionChange(function(oEvent) {
     var oContext = 
     oTable.isIndexSelected(oEvent.getParameter("rowIndex")) ? oEvent.getParameter("rowContext") : undefined;
     oDetails.setBindingContext(oContext);
     oItems.setBindingContext(oContext);
     });



My details view is updated with the clicked sales order's data as whished.

What I now want to do is to also get information of the Business Partner of
the Sales order.

In the metadata of the service, the Sales Order entity has a relationship to
the Business Partner:



    
    
    <EntityType Name="SalesOrder" sap:content-version="1">
     <Key><PropertyRef Name="SalesOrderID" /></Key>
     ...
    <Property Name="BusinessPartnerID" Type="Edm.String" Nullable="false" MaxLength="10" sap:label="Bus. Part. ID" /> 
    <NavigationProperty Name="BusinessPartnerID"
    Relationship="ZCD204_EPM_DEMO_SRV.SalesOrderBusinessPartner" 
    FromRole="FromRole_SalesOrderBusinessPartner" 
    ToRole="ToRole_SalesOrderBusinessPartner" /> 
    ...
    <Association Name="SalesOrderBusinessPartner" sap:content-version="1">
    <End Type="ZCD204_EPM_DEMO_SRV.SalesOrder" Multiplicity="1" 
    Role="FromRole_SalesOrderBusinessPartner" /> 
    <End Type="ZCD204_EPM_DEMO_SRV.BusinessPartner" 
    Multiplicity="1" Role="ToRole_SalesOrderBusinessPartner" />
    </Association>



So in my details view, I try to bind the property City of the Businesspartner
to a text field:



    
    
    var bpCity = new sap.ui.commons.TextField({ 
    // value : "{/BusinessPartner/City}",
    width : "100%",
    editable : false });
    bpCity.bindContext("/BusinessPartner");
    bpCity.bindProperty("value","/City");



I think I tried any combination now ("/BusinessPartner/", "BusinessPartner/",
"City/", "/City/", "/BusinessPartner/City") but none of them gave me the city
of the business partner. But when I made a GET try in my browser I got the
city back:



GET:

/ZCD204_EPM_DEMO_SRV/SalesOrders('0500000000')/BusinessPartner/City?$format=xm
l

Response:

    
    
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> 
     <d:City xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices" 
     xmlns:m="http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices/metadata">Walldorf</d:City> 



What am I doing wrong when binding?

Any help is appreciated!



Best regards,

Melanie

SAPUI5 - Beta?
text:
Hi All,



Does anybody know's when the non-beta release is going to be of the SAPUI5
framework.

Is it possible to make a combination of HTML5 and SAPUI5 components or is this
not the purpose?



Greetings

Nick
author: Nick Thienpondt
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Nick,



what you can download from SCN is a "trial version" of SAPUI5, but this does
not mean the library as such is in beta stadium. I think it rather means that
the license for the SCN version only allows you to use it for testing, not for
productive scenarios.

SAPUI5 comes with several SAP products/platforms (like SAP NetWeaver Cloud)
and to my understanding that version of SAPUI5 has the proper license also for
productive use. There are certain parts marked as "experimental", but I don't
think the library as such is still considered "beta".



The real question is what exactly you expect from a non-beta version: a
certain (informal) level of maturity/stability? A certain level of formally
guaranteed support?





Of course you can combine plain HTML5 elements and SAPUI5 controls. In fact,
SAPUI5 controls are composed of and make use of HTML5 elements, but you are
always free to use as much HTML(5) as you want - or other HTML/JavaScript
libraries - in combination with UI5.

The same is valid for the usage of other web standards which are closely
related to HTML5, like CSS3.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:SAPUI5 - Beta?

[crosspost] SAPUI5 in web application bundle
text:
I'm struggling to get sapui5 working properly in a web application bundle (see
the details here: <http://scn.sap.com/thread/3300733>). Guessing from the log
messages I think maybe the contents from my bundle are not considered by the
ResourceServlet. Maybe the resource lookup works for plain war files because
it uses the class loader (does it?) and doesn't work in the bundle case
because it uses the bundle contents (from which bundle?). Just guessing here
...
author: Tobias Hammerschmidt
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi,



SAPUI5 by default loads everything from a path relative to the sap-ui-core.js
file.

If your resources are at a different location (this often happens for the
application Views and Controllers when you load SAPUI5 from "somewhere else"),
you have to tell UI5 where to find them.



You can use

 [sap.ui.localResources(<somePackagePrefix>)](https://sapui5.netweaver
.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.html#.localResources)

to make UI5 load every module/control/class starting with the given prefix
from a location relative to your index.html file.

There is also a more general "[registerModulePath](https://sapui5.netweaver.on
demand.com/sdk/#docs/api/symbols/jQuery.sap.html#.registerModulePath)" to
configure arbitrary locations for modules.



So maybe jQuery.sap.registerModulePath("foo", "js/foo") will help by making
UI5 request everything starting with "foo" from inside your js/ fodler.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:[crosspost] SAPUI5 in web application bundle

author: Tobias Hammerschmidt
text:
Hi Andreas,



thanks for your reply. I also found the module path definition in sapui5
today. I already tested it and it seems like a good workaround. The thing is
that I followed the convention in sapui5 to have the controller/view hierarchy
in the resources folder which is itself located in the bundle/war root. Also
when you look at the log output in <http://scn.sap.com/thread/3300733> you can
see that the right path/location is constructed. I still think this might be a
problem in the sapui5 ResourceServlet which has an url pattern of
'/resources/*' so that it should also handle the resources in my bundle/war.
Anyway I think in the future I'm going to use sapui5 deployed on the netweaver
cloud and use the module path definition for my controllers/views.



Best regards,

Tobias



Edit:



I just recognized that there is a bundle fragment called
com.sap.ui5.resource.osgi in the eclipse plugins folder. I'll try to add this
to my WEB-INF/lib folder and check whether it works then.



Message was edited by: Tobias Hammerschmidt

how to retrieve data from a REST service to a JSONModel in a SAPUI5 page?
text:
Hello everybody,



I have 2 projects :



1- Web Dynamic project using default datasource (similar to the persistence
example here :<https://wiki.wdf.sap.corp/wiki/display/NDW/Adding+Persistence+U
sing+JPA+(SDK+1.x)> ), with JPA entity and w REST webservice that permits to
execute CRUD operations.



2 - SAPUI5 project.





What I want to do is to obtain the data from the service to put it into a
table (JsonModel).



How to do that? I tried some examples that I found here but it didn't work.





Cheers,

Dhia





My jsp code is like this in the header :



    
    
    var aData = jQuery.ajax({ type: "GET", contentType: "application/json", url: "http://localhost:8360/ServerSide/retail/customers",
    dataType: "json", success: function(json) {
     oModel.setData(aData); // fill the received data into the JSONModel
     alert("success to post");
    },
    error: function(json) { alert("fail to post"); } });
author: BOUFAHJA Dhiaeddine
Chris Wohlbrecht
title: Re:how to retrieve data from a REST service to a JSONModel in a SAPUI5 page?

author: DJ Adams
text:
Hi Dhia



Chris is right: (If you're going to use an explicit ajax request:) make sure
you reference the right json variable.



Alternatively, SAPUI5 supports this for JSON Models:



oModel.loadData("data.json");



You could replace your whole code snippet above with



oModel.loadData("<http://localhost:8360/ServerSide/retail/customers>");



Cheers

dj

Consuming Portal Data using API / Webservice in SAP UI5
text:
Dear Experts,



Is there a method of consuming Portal UME , UWL data etc using Some API /
Webservice on SAP UI5.

Please let me know if this is possible. If not possible then what is the
recommended approach to consume this data on SAP UI5.



Regards,

Zeeshan
author: Zeeshan Khan
Christian Jianelli
text:
Hi Zeeshan,



SAPUI5 is a javascript library that runs in the client side, i.e., in the
browser. In SAPUI5 the better approach to consume data is to use oData, but to
use it you need a service that support the oData protocol.



Regards,



Christian

text:

3\. UME data

Zeeshan
title: Re:Consuming Portal Data using API / Webservice in SAP UI5

author: Christian Jianelli
text:
Hi Zeeshan,

Sorry, but the only oData provider I know is the SAP Netweaver Gateway.
Perhaps in the portal's forum you can get help about this.



Regards,



Christian

Asynchronous version of sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel
text:
Has anyone played around of making asynchronous call to get the OData web
service call? I saw this <http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-center/front-
end/blog/2012/11/20/extending-sapui5-json-model> but it's quite different than
ODataModel class.
author: Iwan Santoso
Christian Jianelli
text:
Hi Iwan,

In my opinion the methods used to read data from server in the oDataModel and
myJSONModel are quite similar.



**oData Model**



  * read(sPath, oContext_?_, aParams_?_, **bAsync**_?_, **fnSuccess**_?_, **fnError**_?_)



**myJSONModel**

**  
**

  * ** loadDataNew** (sURL, **fnSuccess, fnError**, oParameters, **bAsync**, sType, bMerge, bCache){ 



In both cases you have to inform **bAsync = true** and make use of the
callback functions for success and error.



**oData read method**

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.model.odat
a.ODataModel.html#read>





Regards,



Christian
title: Re:Asynchronous version of sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel

var pricemodel = new sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel(url_price, false);

oTable1.setModel(pricemodel);

oTable1.bindRows("/lt_price_mat_r");

var iNumberofRows = oTable1.getBinding("rows").iLength;

oTable1.setTitle("Price Details : Total Records = " + iNumberofRows );





The time it takes from the title change to the records displayed in Table UI
controls is 5 secs, 18 secs, 33 seconds, and google chrome time out 2 min 38
secs respectively. As you can see the time increase significantly correspond
to the number of records(rows) to be displayed.



This sounds like Table UI control performance issue, unless I am missing
something.



Has anyone experience this and what's the rule of thumb to display large
amount of records using SAPUI5?



Thanks,

Iwan
author: Iwan Santoso
Konstantin Anikeev
text:
Hi Iwan,



I think, the main issue is th issue for you browser to built a DOM for 1000+
items.

I have the same problems building Lists for **sap.m** with more than 50+
items...

Mobile processors are not so fast
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/sad.gif)



SAP usually implements a restriction to 500 results for search helps to boost
performance - user must specify parameters to restrict a number of selected
rows.

Unlike to WebDynpro, where every new part of selected data are transported
from the server to Browser, in SAPUI5 You receive all the data and map them to
DOM.

First question, of course, what for do You need 1000+ rows to display to the
user.



Best Regards

Konstantin
title: Re:Table UI performance

author: Iwan Santoso
text:
Thanks Konstantin,



That's what I worried about. Unfortunately yes. The solution is to allow a
customer to look their pricing catalog and a customer may have 10k-30k
material associated with it.



Maybe I have to apply some filter or manual paging so it display in reasonable
run time. If you have any other idea, please let me know.



\- Iwan
title: Re:Table UI performance

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Iwan and Konstantin,



the sap.ui.table.Table control does NOT render all the DOM for all items. Only
the visible items are present in DOM.

And with the ODataModel paging is supported, so no more than the 20 or so
items to display are even sent to the browser.

Using this combination, the Table should be able to handle a very huge number
of items.



And in fact I just used the Table to browse through the 160050 items from the
public Netflix database without any rendering delay:

Displaying the Table takes about a second, filling in the data asynchronously
after the data has been sent by netflix another second.



You can find the code here:

<http://jsbin.com/anodet/3/edit>

But note: you need to overcome the cross-domain barrier to actually get data.



You could check in your Chrome development tools how much data is actually
transferred in your slow example.





The sap.m.List indeed currently renders ALL items to the DOM. So currently the
mobile List should be used with some custom paging solution when handling big
amounts of data.

But this is being worked on.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Table UI performance

author: Iwan Santoso
text:
Hi Andreas,



Thanks for the sample. Unfortunately, the connection from my client's office
is blocking anything to netflix. I'll take a look later when I'm back at my
hotel.



From the sample code, I thought I perform the same steps as yours. My
understanding is exaclty what you explain i.e. ODataModel support paging and
Table UI Control handle paging automatically i.e. we do not need to handle
programmatically. Which I think what your sample shown and I used the same
approach.



However, in my result, the is quite a big lag when displaying the entry. I'll
keep tweaking and if you think of something, please do let me know.



Thanks,

Iwan
title: Re:Table UI performance

author: Iwan Santoso
text:
Andreas,



Another observation: Is it possible this is caused by the web service itself?
I exposed an RFC from ECC using gateway. When I use $top query, it doesn't

When I did the netflix, $top query works.

UI 5 Mobile FlexBox is not rendering
author: Arvind Purohit
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi,



the <div> wapping the whole <html> document is surely only an
accident?



You do not need to load "sap.ui.core" as a library, it is always present.



What is a "sap.m.T"?

Using this as constructor will cause a JavaScript error.

The first thing you should check when something does not work is whether there
is a JS error...



The other main issue is that createContentD() is invoked before the code is
executed which creates the oMyFlexbox. If you move the oMyFlexbox code up, it
will be defined and contain the Button.



Another issue is that your first script block creates an App and adds a View,
but then a second App is created. This doesn't break the application, but the
first one is of course ignored, as it is not added to the UI.



This version works:

<http://jsbin.com/ebegal/1/edit>

(try in Chrome or Safari, as IE8/9 don't support loading UI5 from a remote
server)



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:UI 5 Mobile FlexBox is not rendering

author: Arvind Purohit
text:
Thanks for your reply. It is working now,



One more thing suppose i have created two pages in myview.view.js file how
will add this paged to app which is created in my html file
title: Re:UI 5 Mobile FlexBox is not rendering

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi,

if your two pages are somehow in one unit, like in one common Carousel, add
them to it and return the Carousel.

If they are really separate pages, you should create two separate Views.

If you want to keep things closer together and avoid too many different
entities and files, you could also create ONE View for the whole application,
though (creating the App and the two Pages) - this depends on how you want to
structure the application.



Regards

Andreas

title: Re:Accessing SAP Data via Portal APIs in HTML5

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Kalyan,



in contrast to Web Dynpro, JSF or JSP, SAPUI5 itself is a pure client-side UI
technology. This means the UI5 code and all code you write in JavaScript runs
inside the user's browser.



If you want to access any Java functionality (which runs on the server), the
client-side code must call some web interface of the server, e.g. do AJAX/HTTP
calls to a REST interface. The server needs to expose its functionality in
such an interface - it may be a REST API, a SOAP web service, any custom
servlet, anything that can be reached via network (usually using HTTP).



(This decouples UI layer and application logic in a way that enables frequent
updates of UI components (even UI technologies) and user experience without
enforcing expensive upgrades of the application servers.)



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Accessing SAP Data via Portal APIs in HTML5

author: Venkata Kalyan Karanam
text:
Hi



Thanks for the reply.

What I am trying to do is i have created a view with 2 input boxes two take
two numbers with a button say '' ADD " .I have implemented a simple java class
with in the Java Resources of the Project folder itself. Now I mapped the
Button onPress functionality to a method in OData Controller.

There i am using java script Tag "Java Importer" to import the class created.
My class just a simple class containing one method which takes two numbers and
returns the result as addition of two numbers. So in the function tagged to
button am creating the instance of the class and calling the method.But this
is not running when I execute.

Here I have some quesions.

1\. HTML5 not able to consume a simple java class at client side using the
Java script?

2\. Almost all HTML5 coding resembles java script code, Then in java script we
have tags like Java Importer , Object to use java classes. Will these tags
not supported to use in HTML5.

3\. If that is the case I can not embed or write my custom code----processing
data using Java.

4\. I am not understanding to just execute simple class why do we need to Go
for converting Data model like REST/JSON or like webservices.

5\. Is HTML5 designed only to just call some data in the server after
converting the data into Gateway /JSON/REST-----> Then this is the case
what are the benefits of HTML5 actually except that code executes at client so
performance is more (COMMON to Java script)



Please let me know.



Regards

KALYAN
title: Re:Accessing SAP Data via Portal APIs in HTML5

author: Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi,



in HTML (whether it is HTML5 or 4 or any browser code - which is executed in
the user's browser on the user's computer) you cannot directly execute Java
code which runs on a server.

There may be technologies which blur this separation by offering "runat"
attributes and there may be libraries encapsulating remote calls so much they
look very light-weight and just like calling local functionality. But those
are server-side technologies which may bring send code to the client, but
often execute their logic mostly on the server and need a server roundtrip for
almost every user interaction (Web Dynpro is one example).

But technically execution in the browser and on the server are completely
separate. This is not specific to SAPUI5, this is how code run in browsers
works.



Java code CAN also be run in browsers on client side, but this is then Java
Applets, a quite different thing than business code running on a JEE server.
And probably not what you want. Java applets could also be used from within
UI5 (UI5 does not put any limits on what you can do).



Advantages and disadvantages of keeping the natural separation between server
and client could be discussed in length, but apart from responsiveness the
separation can also help keeping the application more cleanly structured and
maintainable, it enables backend code to stay stable for years while UIs are
enhanced, updated and exchanged much more often to keep a pleasing user
experience making use of the newest browser features.

And of course this separation makes the UI technology independent from server
technologies: when you know a client-side framework like SAPUI5 (or YahooUI or
whatever), you can write web UIs for Java servers as well as for ABAP or
Microsoft .net servers. With JSPs on the other side you could only code UIs
for Java servers.



You do not NEED to use JSON with REST, but you need to somehow offer data at a
web interface, yes. OData with Gateway is just a proposal how different server
technologies can offer data and functionality in a way so different client
technologies know how to consume and use it.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Accessing SAP Data via Portal APIs in HTML5

Hi All,



How can I put a placeholder for the TextField component in SAPUI5 ? HTML5
provides an property placeholder to make use of this functionality.



Any hints?



Regards,

Noufal
author: Noufal Abdulkareem
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Noufal,



unfortunately this HTML5 attribute is not supported in IE9 and IE8 which also
need to be working with functional parity in SAPUI5.

A workaround could be built in, but this has not been done yet.



In the new SAPUI5 mobile control set, the sap.m.Input control _does _have a
placeholder attribute (IE9 does not need to be supported there...).



If urgently required, you could inherit from TextField, add the "placeholder"
attribute and in your renderer use the original renderer, but implement the
"renderInnerAttributes" method and render the placeholder attribute there.

But remember to remove this again once the UI5 TextField officially gets this
attribute.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:Placeholder for input field

author: Noufal Abdulkareem
text: Thank you. I shall try it out

How to get the file size using FileUpload Element in UI5
text:
Hello,



I am trying to work on the fileupload ui element in UI5. I am able to upload
the file and get the name of the file. But I am not able to get the file size
before upload.

Can somebody help me with this. I am trying to do some validations on the file
type and file size. Please help me in getting the file size.



Regards,

SrinivaS
author: srinivas sistu
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Srinivas,



the FileUploader control is basically wrapping HTML's

<input type='file'>

element. For security/privacy reasons browser limit JavaScript access to the
file very strictly. The user has to actively trigger the upload and the file
name, content and length can be only read on server side.

You should find information on the internet about what you could do on server
side.



Using HTML5's Local File API you can get more information and even the size
and content of files, but this is not supported in all browsers and requires
different user interaction.



Another alternative would be using a Flash plugin... but...



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:How to get the file size using FileUpload Element in UI5
