title: ListBox in iPad: selecting multiple values
text:
Hi,

When I create a ListBox using SAPUI5 for a WebApp (running it from my laptop)
I can select multiple values from the ListBox by pressing the "CTRL" key of my
keyboard.



The problem is when i run the application from the iPad: i cant press "CTRL"
for selecting multiple values.



Is it possible to set the ListBox to select multiple values by simply clicking
on them (without pressing CTRL).



Thanks!

Julian
author: Julian Ogando
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Julian,



sorry for the delayed reply.

The "sap.ui.commons" controls are mainly targeting desktop browsers. They are
enabled to run on touch-operated tablets like iPad, but this support is
limited and multiselect in a ListBox is currently a limitation.

For the best user experience on mobile/touch devices you could have a look at
the new "sap.m" control library.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:ListBox in iPad: selecting multiple values

author: Julian Ogando
text:
Hi Andreas,

Thanks for your help.

I found a workaround: create a panel and dynamically create checkboxes inside
of the panel to simulate the ListBox.



I took a look to the sap.m library, but i couldn't find much documentantion,
just a demo of the things you can do (which by the way, looks amazing).



Regards,

Julian

SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.
text:
Hello SAPUI5 people,



I'm still having some issues with posting to the SAP backend.



**The Problem:**

I am using jQuery to post to the SAP backend via the following code:



<http://pastie.org/5477802>



I added a debugger to the incoming webservice call in SAP and it says
**Method: OPTIONS** instead of **Method: POST**.



I have tested this from my local webserver & via the sap cloud portal.





**The big But**

When I simply run that code via an HTML file in Internet Explorer, and look at
the debugger it says **Method: POST **and adds my data the my table.



My local code: <http://pastie.org/5477806>



Now the big But, when I run the same file in Firefox / Chrome, the Method
turns to **OPTIONS** again.





**What needs to happen (don't know how)**

  
SAP needs to enable cross-origin resource sharing on the online webserver.

Or someone needs to suggest me a better way of doing this.





**Temp Fix (bad practice)  
**

  
I can replace the Method Options to Method Post, hard coded. But this is dirty
nasty code.





**Temp conclusion**

**Works: **

  * Post to SAP Backend via Internet Explorer and simple HTML File



**Does not Work:**

  * Post to SAP Backend via Firefox & Chrome via simple HTML File
  * Post to SAP Backend via IE, FF and Chrome on Local SAP Eclipse Webserver.
  * Post to SAP Backend via IE, FF and Chrome on SAP Cloud Trial account





**More information about CORS:**

  
<http://enable-cors.org/>



<http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1099787/jquery-ajax-post-sending-options-
as-request-method-in-firefox>





**  
**



I hope someone can help me, because I spend a lot of time figuring this out.





**Kind regards,**

**Vincent  
**



  





  



**  
**
author: Vincent Wouters
Vincent Wouters
title: Re:SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.

author: Christian Jianelli
text:
Hi Vincent,

Check the following link.



**HTML5 ROCKS - Using CORS**

<http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/cors/?redirect_from_locale=en>



Preflight Request:

> The preflight request is made as an HTTP OPTIONS request (so be sure your
server is able to respond to this method)



Hope it helps.



Regards,



Christian
title: Re:SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.

author: Vincent Wouters
text:
Hello Christian,



This will not work.



I need todo something with a proxy.





Kind regards,

Vincent
title: Re:SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.

author: Bernhard Siewert
text:
Hi Vincent,

your coding works in IE due to your IE settings (Internet Options ->
Security -> <select your zone> -> Custom Level -> Miscellaneous
-> Access data sources across domains). If you activate it, you should be
aware, that all requests across origins are allowed - I suppose that is
something you do not really want. By the way, select the "Prompt" options
doesn't really help, since IE doesn't tell you which origin tries to send a
request to which origin. In IE (less than 10) there exists the XDomainRequest
object, which implements CORS (but it has a number of limitations in contrast
to XMLHttpRequest with CORS).

But since most of the existing services currently do not support CORS, I would
suggest to configure / install a reverse proxy (Apache, SAP Web Dispatcher,
...), which directs the requests to the correct origin (and simulates a single
origin to the browser).

We are currently working on an extension to the End2End Tutorial
<http://scn.sap.com/docs/DOC-33792>, which will cover the cross-origin topic.

Hth, Bernhard
title: Re:SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.

author: Vincent Wouters
text:
Haay Bernhard,



I will look into your document, read it and post back any questions I still
have.



Kind regards,

Vincent
title: Re:SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.

author: Bernhard Siewert
text:
Hi Vincent,

sorry, but the document itself just describes the implementation and
consumption of OData Services with SAPUI5 within the same system (so there is
no validation of the Same-Origin Policy). We have to extend that tutorial with
an "Cross-Origin Access" addendum, but it's not ready today.

Do you have some experience configuring Apache or Web Dispatcher?

Kind regards,

Bernhard
title: Re:SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.

author: Vincent Wouters
text:
No I have not .



A friendly developer has described what I am supposed to do in these steps:



1) Send AJAX Call to an url of my webapplication

2) At the controller you need to SEND that request with POST data to the SAP
Server (via curl or whatever)

3) The answer you get from the SAP server you need to resend as an local
Request.



Short said I need to create a proxy to get this to work.But I don't know how,
so I'm currently a little stuck
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/happy.gif)





Kind regards,

Vincent
title: Re:SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.

author: Bernhard Siewert
text:
OK - you can implement your own proxy (I would name it a tunnel in that case)
... or you can install and configure one. Here is the installation description
for Apache on Windows:
<http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/platform/windows.html> or if you already
know, that you have to deal with SSL, maybe it's easier to install an xampp
(includes Apache, php, mySQL and the like and it just has to be downloaded and
unpacked): <http://www.apachefriends.org/en/xampp.html>. Having done this you
have to configure the Apache as a reverse proxy - here is the corresponding
Apache tutorial: <http://www.apachetutor.org/admin/reverseproxies>.

Hth, Bernhard
title: Re:SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.

author: Vincent Wouters
text:
Hello Again Bernhard,



Sorry for my late reply, but this will not help me when I am running
applications online on SAPUI5.

So I will need to make something similar to this:



<http://jquery-howto.blogspot.de/2009/04/cross-domain-ajax-querying-with-
jquery.html>



But in Javascript so I can use it online at SAPUI5. Do you have any other
examples of jQuery Proxy, this will be most helpful.



Kind regerads,

Vincent
title: Re:SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.

author: Bernhard Siewert
text:
Hi Vincent,



to avoid misunderstandings, please indicate, where you will place your
SAPUI5/jQuery code (I suppose its a web server) and which service you would
like to use (I suppose it's the _urlString_ in your sample code).

If that's the case you have simply to place your HTML/JavaScript code in the
server root of Apache/xampp (e.g. htdocs) and configure a
ProxyPass/ProxyPassReverse for your "web service" server.

And I'm really convinced that will help you and it will help you much better,
than a self crafted proxy implemented in php or Flash (e.g. what's about
authentication - if your service needs that, your proxy has to handle that).



Kind regards,

Bernhard
title: Re:SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.

author: Vincent Wouters
text:
Hi Bernhard,



Well I'm currently using the SAPUI5 Trial webserver, this will be the
webserver I think?



So when we get our own SAPUI5 webserver, you think it is as easy as just
configuring, that specific webserver.



When I get access to the server can't I simply do this:



<http://enable-cors.org/server_apache.html> \--> Enable Cross Origin
Resource Sharing on APACHE Server.



Kind regards,

Vincent
title: Re:SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.

author: Bernhard Siewert
text:
Hi Vincent,



if you use the Apache as a reverse proxy you don't have to deal with CORS. If
the HTML/JavaScript resides on a remote server, you have to add a ProxyPass
configuration for this as well:

Pseudo-Example:



ProxyPass /sapui5/ [http://<yourUi5Server>:yourUi5Port/sapui5/](http://v
eui5infra.dhcp.wdf.sap.corp:8080/sapui5/)

ProxyPassReverse /sapui5/ [http://<yourUi5Server>:yourUi5Port/sapui5/](h
ttp://veui5infra.dhcp.wdf.sap.corp:8080/sapui5/)



ProxyPass /sap/bc/youconsulting/ [http://<yourWsServer>:<yourWsPort&g
t;/sap/bc/youconsulting/](http://scn.sap.com/<yourWsServer>:<yourWsPort>/sap/b
c/youconsulting)

ProxyPassReverse /sap/bc/youconsulting/ [http://<yourWsServer>:<yourW
sPort>/sap/bc/youconsulting/](http://<yourWsServer><yourWsPort>)



If you have to pass a network proxy additionally, you have to add the
ProxyRemote configuration as well.



Another advantage of this solution is, that you don't have to deal with
absolute URLs in your coding - you are working everytime relative to your
server (which is in fact the reverse proxy).



The above mentioned solution works just for simple requests (and your POST
needs a so-called pre-flight request, which is a HTTP OPTIONS). And if you
have already an Apache, why not configuring it as an reverse proxy (which is
common use).



Hth, Bernhard
title: Re:SAPUI5 Cross-origin resource sharing issues while Posting to backend.

How to disable TAB navigation from controls/elements?
text:
Hi,



I was wondering, is there a way to disable the TAB navigation from SAPUI5
controls/elements?

I have a sap.ui.commons.ProgressIndicator element of which I would have the
tabIndex removed.



In JQuery you would use something like



$("#progressIndicator").attr("tabindex", -1);



but that doesn't seem to work...



Is there a way I can achieve this the SAPUI5-approved way?



Best,

Robin van het Hof
author: Robin van het Hof
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Robin,



you can do the same thing in SAPUI5, but you have to keep two things in mind:

  * the HTML of UI5 controls is created only when the page hs been loaded, so doing that jQuery call too early (or maybe even directly in the <head>, when the browser has not even parsed and created the <body> yet) will not find any HTML element.
  * SAPUI5 controls can remove and re-create their HTML at any time (triggered by a modification of their state, and usually delayed, to only have ONE re-rendering for multiple modifications)

\- so your call needs to be done late enough and also re-done when the
ProgressIndicator re-creates its HTML.



To support this, on all controls the "afterRendering" event is fired and you
can also get informed about this when adding a delegate to the respective
control.

The "addDelegate" API in SAPUI5 1.8.x is a private one (but still works if you
want to test), in SAPUI5 1.9+ there will be a public "addEventDelegate"
method.



So you can do:

** myProgressIndicator.addDelegate({**

** onAfterRendering: function() {**

** $("#progressIndicator").attr("tabindex", -1);**

** }**

** });**

\- this will be executed whenever the ProgressIndicator HTML has been
(re-)created. And make sure to switch to "addEventDelegate" when the next
version of SAPUI5 is released.





Note that this feature can also be used to listen to browser events (mouse,
keyboard,...) happening on the respective control (by adding methods like
"onclick" to the delegate object).

And it can/should be used for other modifications of SAPUI5 control HTML as
well.



Regards

Andreas
title: Re:How to disable TAB navigation from controls/elements?

text:
Hi,



I am trying to change the SAPUI5 standard theme to use a somewhat smaller
font-size.

For the most part I managed to do so by overriding the font-size attributes of
the respective CSS classes.



The text in tables are now smaller too, which is perfect. However, the row
height is still set at 28px, resulting in a lot of space around the table cell
text.

And no matter what I tried, I can't set this height to a different value.



I suspect it has something to do with the implementation of the table rows;
upon inspection of the rendered HTML, both the DIV elements which renders the

Is there a way to bypass the height specified in this HTML style attribute, or

setting I provided being overruled by this HTML attribute...)

Add Controls & Content to NavigationItems
text:
Hello SAP People,



I want to make an SAPUI Application with multi NavigationItems. These
NavigationItems are already in place and on the first item I've added content.



**But the question now is, how to add content to the second item + format it?**



Via: " mContent[key] = new sap.ui.commons.Button({text:"This Button is the
content of the Sales Orders Workset"});" a single button is added but I'm not
able to add more items or to place the items in a specific location
(formatting).



All the online examples that I've found are only 1 paged SAPUI sites.



Except for this example: <http://scn.sap.com/community/technology-
innovation/blog/2012/05/04/using-neo-and-sapui5--part-2--hi-sap-ui5-may-i
-introduce-you-to-neo>



But that code does not seem to work.





This is my current code: <http://pastie.org/5447548>





Kind regards,

Vincent
author: Vincent Wouters
Andreas Kunz
text:
Hi Vincent,



as a sort of intro explanation: the sap.ui.ux3.Shell is supposed to be used
flexibly in very different ways. An application may choose to display entirely
different content for each NavigationItem, or alternatively to just use these
items as filters and modify the data displayed in the content. Or an
application may completely destroy content that is currently not displayed (to
save memory) or just use CSS to make that content invisible, without even
really removing it from the Shell (to save re-rendering time or avoid other
problems).  
Hence there is no direct connection between NavigationItems and the content
which belongs to them. Instead, the Shell just fires events and the
application can/must do whatever is required to display the right content.



So what you want to do is to write a handler for the "worksetItemChanged"
event of the Shell and then act depending on the selected item. It is good
practice to set the "key" of all the items and to then read it in the event
handler.  
The getContent() method and the mContent[key] map is one suggestion how to
manage/lazycreate/cache the different sets of content.  
Your pastie code already does this, actually works fine, and already displays
different content for different NavigationItems, so you seem do do it right...





To add another toplevel item, you could add it in the Shell constructor:



**worksetItems:[ // add some items to the top navigation**  
** new sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem({key:"wi_people",text:"People",subItems:[ // the "Home" workcenter also gets three sub-items**  
** new sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem({key:"wi_people_overview",text:"Overview"}),**  
** new sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem({key:"wi_people_add",text:"Add"})**  
** ]}),**  
** new sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem({key:"wi_mine",text:"My Own")**  
**]**



And in getContent() you just add another else-if:  
** } else if (key == "wi_mine") {**  
and return the appropriate content.



If you want to display more than one Button and to lay out those controls, you
should look into the Layout controls provided by SAPUI5.



Best regards  
Andreas
title: Re:Add Controls & Content to NavigationItems

author: Vincent Wouters
text:
Thanks for your reply Andreas! This makes it clear to me and other people.



Kind regards,

Vincent
title: Re:Add Controls & Content to NavigationItems

author: Arun Jacob
text:
Thanks both. It helped me as
well![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/happy.gif)

author: Gerrit Lober

title: Minimizing the javascript footprint
text:
Hi,





How can I discover which files my javascript loads so I can ship only those
files as I need to minimize the size of the javascript footprint.

Is there a tool such as requirejs
(<http://requirejs.org/docs/optimization.html>) to optmize the loadtime
performance of UI5?
author: Paul Todd
Bertram Ganz
text:
Hi Paul,



actually SAPUI5 does not yet support asynchronous module loading; some expect
a performance boost from this. This is not guaranteed but has to be proven
with corresponding measurements. Nevertheless it might be desirable to enhance
or replace the actual UI5 module loading with an alternative like RequireJS or
AMD (Asynchronous Module Definition). We are investigating async module
loading in UI5 but I cannot say whether or when it will be available.



For the time being I recommend to look at the following SAPUI5 Developer Guide
documents related to your question ...



  * on the bootstraping process: ['Loading / Initializing SAPUI5 within an HTML Page](https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/Bootstrap.html)'. There you can find more details on the given alterantives to load SAPUI5 resources in your application (extract: "_There is a broad range of alternatives, how the SAPUI5 runtime and controls can be integrated into an HTML page. Common to all alternatives is the need to load and execute at least one UI5 specific JavaScript resource."_) 
  * on [modularization and dependency management](https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/docs/guide/ModularizationConcept.html): extract: _"The UI5 framework has built-in support for modularizing comprehensive JavaScript applications. That means, instead of defining and loading one large bundle of JavaScript code, an application can be splitted into smaller parts which then can be loaded at runtime at the time when they are needed. These smaller individual files are called Modules. ..." _



Regards, Bertram
title: Re:Minimizing the javascript footprint

JSON MODEL - function to handle server response
text:
I did not find in the SAPUI5 documentation how to access the server response
text using a function to handle the request complete event (method
attachRequestCompleted of the sap.ui.model.Model).





**Example scenarios**



Please consider the successful JSON response below. The user could see this
information in the view controls through binding, right? So he or she will
know that the server returned something.



{

 "success": true,

 "data": [

 {

 "name_first": "christian",

 "name_last": "jianelli"

 }

 ]

}



Now consider this second JSON response:



{

 "success": true,

 "data": []

}



The communication with the server was successful but it returned an empty
result. The user will not see any information in the view, right?

If I wanted to handle this response by showing a message box like "No data
found for this selection criteria"....



Consider now this last scenario:



{

 "success": false,

 "data": [],

 "msg": "Access denied"

}



If I wanted to show this message to the user in a message box...



How can i do that?



Thanks in advance



![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/wink.gif)

title: Server-side logic?
text:
Hello everyone,

I'm new to SAP UI 5 and i wanted to ask you what do you recommend for writing
server-side code.

I need to develop an SAP UI 5 Application and deploy it to NEO.

I also need to pull data from HANA, so what do you recommend? Servlets?



Thanks!

Julian
author: Julian Ogando
Sandip Agarwalla
text:
With my limited info on UI5,

SAP UI5 is a client side framework. I do not think you can write server side
code with this framework.



However, its very much possible to deploy UI5 apps on
NEO(<http://scn.sap.com/community/technology-innovation/blog/2012/05/04/using-
neo-and-sapui5--part-2--hi-sap-ui5-may-i-introduce-you-to-neo>) and also write
apps which pull info from HANA.



Sandip
title: Re:Server-side logic?

author: Julian Ogando
text:
Hi Sandip,

Thanks for your help.

I'm aware the SAPUI5 is for the client-side, but there must be a way to write
server-side code to pass out information into the client-side.



Thanks again,

Julian
title: Re:Server-side logic?

author: Kaloyan Raev
text:
Hi Julian,



You have already made the right choice by deploying your application on Neo.
This means you can write your server-side code in Java. I highly recommend to
implement your server-side code as RESTful services. There is a nice tutorial
[Exposing a REST API from #SAPNWCloud](http://scn.sap.com/community/developer-
center/cloud-platform/blog/2012/05/25/exposing-a-rest-api-from-sapnwcloud)
written by an SAP Mentor that can give you a quick overview how to do this.



Good luck and enjoy!



Greetings,

Kaloyan
title: Re:Server-side logic?

author: Julian Ogando
text:
Hi Kaloyan,

I had just achieved to publish a Servlet into Neo.

I'll take a look at the document you sent me.



Thanks for your help!

Julian

deleting.



My example does show hard-coded user credentials, not good practice. I hope
that anyone who is serious about using SAPUI5 and Gateway in a productive
environment already has in place multi layered security policy like the OSI
Model and that the application and services associated adheres to its
constraints. If by security you meant authentication and what options are
available, i believe that is probably not a SAPUI5 question rather a
Gateway/WebAS Admin question, i would be guessing a variety covering basic and
whatever IWA, certificate and claims method of SSO the ABAP SICF supports.



Cheers

JSP

Problem with calling Gateway with input parameters
text:
Hi,



The situation is as follows:



I am trying to call the GW service through SAPUI5 and fill the table with the
received data.

The problem is that I can fill the table when all the input parameters in GW
are hardcoded.

My code looks like this then:



var oModel = new sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel("[http://hostname:port/sap/opu/
odata/sap/Z_RFC_UI5_HR_MA/](http://hostnameport)", false, "user", "pw");

oTable.setModel(oModel);

oTable.bindRows("z_rfc_ui5_hr_maCollection");



This works just fine.



When one input parameter is not hardcoded, I do not seem to find a way to fill
the table.

However I am sure GW is setup correctly. When I try out the following URI in
RESTClient in Firefox, it retrieves the data:

[http://hostname:port/sap/opu/odata/sap/Z_RFC_UI5_HR_MA/z_rfc_ui5_hr_maCollect
ion?$filter=pernr](http://hostnameport) eq '00000002'

So the problem is not coming from GW. It must be something in my code but I do
not seem to find out what.

My code in that situation:



var oModel = new sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel("[http://hostname:port/sap/opu/
odata/sap/Z_RFC_UI5_HR_MA/](http://hostnameport)", false, "user", "pw");

oTable.setModel(oModel);

var filter = new sap.ui.model.Filter("pernr", sap.ui.model.FilterOperator.EQ,
"'00000002'");

oTable.bindRows("z_rfc_ui5_hr_maCollection", null, [filter]);



Do you guys understand why it is not working?



Thanks.



Nicolas
author: Nicolas Lipinski
Raul Romero
text:
Hi.



In my case I add a prefix in any call to my Gateway service:



(1) var url = "proxy/http/hostname:port/sap/opu/odata/sap/[Z_RFC_UI5_HR_MA](ht
tp://hostnameport/)/

or

(2) var url = "proxy/http/hostname/sap/opu/odata/sap/[Z_RFC_UI5_HR_MA](http://
hostnameport/)/



rModel = new sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel(url, false, "GW@ESW", "ESW4GW");
title: Re:Problem with calling Gateway with input parameters

author: Nicolas Lipinski
text:
Hi Raul,



Thank you for your answer but the prefix is not the problem.

The problem is that I do not know where to put this part of the URI in my
code: "z_rfc_ui5_hr_maCollection?$filter=pernr eq '00000002'".



If I hardcode my input values in GW then the application works just fine as
follows:

oTable.bindRows("z_rfc_ui5_hr_maCollection");



The problem is that it does not work like this (when the input value is not
hardcoded anymore):

oTable.bindRows("z_rfc_ui5_hr_maCollection?$filter=pernr eq '00000002'");



So I started looking and thought I could resolve the problem like this:

var filter = new sap.ui.model.Filter("pernr", sap.ui.model.FilterOperator.EQ,
"'00000002'");

oTable.bindRows("z_rfc_ui5_hr_maCollection", null, [filter]);



But it does not seem to work. Do you know how to give an input value through
the application to GW?



Br,



Nicolas
title: Re:Problem with calling Gateway with input parameters

author: Raul Romero
title: Re:Problem with calling Gateway with input parameters

author: Nicolas Lipinski
text:
Hi Raul,



Thank you for your time and help.

The issue seems to be different than I thought. I was thinking that there was
only something wrong with my code.

But it does not seem to be the only reason.

This is how it looks now; I just made the binding path absolute.



var filter = new sap.ui.model.Filter("pernr", sap.ui.model.FilterOperator.EQ,
"'00000002'");

oTable.bindRows("**/**z_rfc_ui5_hr_maCollection", null, null, [filter]);



When I run the application in firefox and use firebug I can see the created
URI.

The created URI is correct, except for the quotes. The code above returns a
very long URI with the following filter parameter: `pernr eq ''00000002''`



The problem is that he constructs the URI with two pairs of single quotes and
I do not understand why.

If I do like you said and put the input value in double quotes without adding
single quotes, like this: sap.ui.model.Filter("pernr",
sap.ui.model.FilterOperator.EQ, "00000002"); it gives the following filter
parameter: pernr eq 00000002



So it gives a filter parameter without quotes at all, and this is not accepted
by my RFC.

I do not understand why SAPUI5 is acting like that. I already tried with the
escape character but it does not help.

Do you have any idea why it is behaving like this?



Regards,



Nicolas

author: Raul Romero

author: Nicolas Lipinski
text:
Hi Raul,



Unfortunately that is not the solution. In that case it just gives me the

I find that the creation of the URI acts very strange. The result of the code
below will return this parameter:

$filter| `((pernr eq ''00000002'))`  
---|---  
  


var quote = "'";

var filter = new sap.ui.model.Filter("pernr", sap.ui.model.FilterOperator.EQ,
quote + "00000002");

oTable.bindRows("/z_rfc_ui5_hr_maCollection", null, null, [filter]);



Why does he put two single quotes in the beginning and one at the end? This is
very strange for me.



Cheers,



Nicolas

Can I use sapui5 as presentation layer and use webdypro as my controller?
text:
Does sapui5 only get data from netweaver through webservice or creating data
model? Can I use webdypro as controller and send data to SAP UI5?
author: Yinyang Wang
Raul Romero
text:
Hi.



(1) SAPUI5 get data via Gateway Services (not via webservices) by OData
protocol.

WD covers the three layers and the way it manages contexts of GUI and BL is
totally different as now is SAPUI5.



Keep in mind that SAPUI5 is a new HTML5 framework, hoped to be open source.
And it is executed in a separated web server apart from SAP Netweaver (like
Apache Tomcat or Glassfish). This is another restriction if you want to
integrate both enviroments.



At the end, we cannot be sure now how is gonna work because this project is
under development, but according to the documentation and experience with
samples of this framework, I think WD will not be supported in a future by
SAP. SAPUI5 is more eficient and go in the line of the paradigm of web
developers of another technologies (PHP, RUBY, Jquery,etc)
title: Re:Can I use sapui5 as presentation layer and use webdypro as my controller?

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi Vinit



To create an instance of an ODataModel you pass the Gateway Service URL.



eg

Var sServiceURL = "[http://servername:8000/sap/opu/sdata/sap/INBOXITEMS/](http
://servername:8000/sap/opu/sdata/sap/INBOXITEMS/InboxWorkItems?%24filter=Login
ID)",

 oModel =  new sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel( sServiceURL, false,
"testuser", "test123");



In your example you have passed the collection url with a filter operation.  



One of the first things the ODataModel code does is request the services
metadata, it does this by adding $metadata to the sServiceURL



eg.

[http://servername:8000/sap/opu/sdata/sap/INBOXITEMS/$metadata](http://servern
ame:8000/sap/opu/sdata/sap/INBOXITEMS/%24metadata)



this would explain why you were getting status of 404 (not found)



You can add additional parameters like &sap-client=100&$format=xml to
the service URL so that they are present on every call.



see

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/ODataModel.html>



For an example of using filters

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#test-
resources/sap/ui/commons/databinding/DataBindingSortingFiltering.html>



Cheers

JSP

How to read data from SAP
text:
Hi all,



I'm new to SAPUI5 so I hope this not very stupid question
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/wink.gif)

I would like to get data from my SAP instance (Netweaver 7.31) and show them
in some kind of table. So what I've done till now is:



1\. I've downloaded Eclipse 3.7 for J2EE

2\. I've downloaded SAPUI5 - UI development toolkit for HTML5

3\. I've installed data from folder tools-updatesite in Eclipse

4\. I've downloaded and installed Apache Tomcat 7.0

5\. I've copied some test example



As a result I was able to run simple Hello World demo, but how can I get data
from SAP? All 4 steps doesn't look like they were in any way related to SAP
server. I've read something about OData
(<http://scn.sap.com/people/dj.adams/blog/2012/02/13/sapui5-says-hello-odata-
to-netweaver-gateway>), so I guess I need SAP Gateway. I've found this
version
<http://www.sdn.sap.com/irj/scn/downloads?rid=/library/uuid/f091b083-c2d0-2e10
-dfaf-d39b95b312d1> but this is big. Installation file has size of 15GB. Do
I really have to download it and install only to read data from SAP tables or
execute BAPI (I could do it easier with RFC)?

From time to time I've seen some information about UI Services (for example in
Note 1759682). Is it in any way connected with SAPUI5?



I would appreciate any guidance.



Best Regards

Marcin Cholewczuk
author: Marcin Cholewczuk
Simon Kemp
text:
Hi Marcin,



There is never such a thing as a stupid question, just a stupid answer! I will
endeavour to avoid the latter here!
![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/laugh.gif)



SAPUI5 is based on JavaScript, HTML and CSS and in particular AJAX is used to
"get data", my understanding is that this is usually done over HTTP(s) so
there is no provision to all a Function Module or BAPI via RFC as this uses a
different protocol.



You can of course use Gateway to expose data in a consumable format such as
odata, but you could also just write your own custom ICF service (in ABAP) to
return data in a format that you want e.g. odata, json, xml all of which I
think SAPUI5 can handle. One of the benefits of Gateway is the scale and speed
at which you could generate such services.



I hope this helps you understand this fast changing area. I hope others will
add their thoughts too.



Thanks,

Simon
title: Re:How to read data from SAP

author: Marcin Cholewczuk
text:
Hi guys,



So as I understand there is no "strong connection" between SAPUI5 and SAP
solutions based on Netweaver. I should look on it as a totally new Product.
But if that's true, then what is the benefit of using SAPUI5? In what way is
it better then other HTML5 based frameworks?



Best Regards

Marcin Cholewczuk
title: Re:How to read data from SAP

author: Raul Romero
text:
The main benefit is: (1) its features and commands (label, textbox,
checkboxes, etc) and CSS styles are similar to the common GUI elements of a
SAP apps. (2) You won't need another HTML5 framework in order to create apps
on the web that are related with a SAP plattform (HANA, Webdynpro, BSP)
because SAPUI5 is joined with Jquery so if you know about Web development on
Jscript or Jquery so SAPUI5 would be great for you. And (3) if you are an
abapper who worked with hard code of WebDynpro JAVA or ABAP or BSP (primitive
way in my own opinion) this new framework gives SAP solutions a new field to
compete with another famous web frameworks.
title: Re:How to read data from SAP

author: Marcin Cholewczuk
text:
Hi,



regarding 2 and 3. Ok, but how is SAPUI5 connected with mentioned HANA, WD or
BSP? Earlier it was pointed out by you and Simon that if I need to communicate

defining such interfece I could use it from any other framework not necessary
SAPUI5.



Best Regrds

title: Re:How to read data from SAP

author: Raul Romero
text:
Hi Marcin.



Guys try to remember that SAPUI5 is part of the GUI level of your application.
Considering that, and in terms of web apps security, I do not recommend to use
the source code embedded in SAPUI5 to extract information from SAP R/3, except
of course in the case you need to show some data but ina a report mode.



A better and well-known way to deal with that is the JConnector. So you can:

1\. Work with the connection of JConnector and implement your code with the
logic you need.

2\. With SAPUI5 you can export the information in HTML for your customers.



or



3\. Play with Gateway and OData opr ICF or via web services. Just remember the
restrictions around a framework oriented to presentation level.

title: Re:How to read data from SAP

author: Raul Romero
text:
Hi.



Well not exactly. I think SAPUI5 is coming to say WDJ and WDA R.I.P. Because
those frameworks are quite obsolete, consume more resources from the web
server and with the evolution of the HTML5 and JS now modern web apps are
getting faster.



In my case, WDJ at the beginning was interesting and quite procedural. But
with the new apps and mobile platforms such as Blackberry, IPhone and social
networks, SAP WDJ was not fully soported to encourage that integrations.
Thinking on that, mentors decided to work around a new-modern-fully-web
development framework hoping to be "open source".



With SAPUI5, you can deliver directly your information from your SAP R/3
installation (using RFc, Gateway services, etc) into 100% HTML5 and JScript
applications. So, the control of the behaviour of your app is depends exactly
from your SAP platform, only by you... that sounds amazing..



Finally, the best way how you can integrate your SAP R/3 environment with
SAPUI5 is playing with code. I invite you to do that, and believe me when I
say that you can find great possibilities to deliver your info to more than
one kind of mobile platforms.

concept - you have to do it all by yourself.

being paid for ![](http://scn.sap.com/1382/images/emoticons/wink.gif)).

I think that I finaly got very general picture how this thing is working.

Please let me a final reply.

1\. WDA sometimes consumes much resources from web server, so in terms of
performance and according with rest of apps is quite obsolete.

2\. OK, I'm agree with you in the sense of going back to the BSP era. But now,

RadioButtonGroup preselect first radiobutton
text:
Hello,



I binded a JSON model to a RadioButtonGroup (rbg) which works just fine. The
thing is sapui5 selects the first radiobutton.

There is a method on the rbg to select another item in the list
(setSelectedIndex) and you can use this in the initalizing of the rbg with
selectedIndex.



The method setSelectedIndex works fine from the debug console in Chrome but
not from the JSONModel.RequestComplete event and the selectedIndex does work
as long as there is not a model in place but a hard coded array of items.



My goal is to have a rgb with NO radiobutton selected because without this the
first button is selected and can NOT be selected again which renders the
select event useless in my opinion.

And to select another item and THEN select the item the user would like is not
user friendly.



To summarize:

  1. Initalizing parameter selectedIndex does not work properly with a model in place in a construction like this:
    
    
    var oItem = new sap.ui.core.Item({
     text : "{CARE_UNIT_DESCR}", 
     tooltip : "{CARE_UNIT_DESCR}",
     key : "{CARE_UNIT_ID}"});
      
      oV1Radiobuttons = new sap.ui.commons.RadioButtonGroup("Radiobuttons", {
      items: {path:"/CARE_UNIT", template:oItem},
      select: function(){oController.setCareUnit(oV1Radiobuttons.getSelectedItem())},
      selectedIndex 2 
      });

2\. set the index after the data is loaded does not work (timing issue?) with
index greater then the numbers of items

 To deselect any radiobutton I found out that an index greater then the
number of items in the rgb deselects all.

 This works from the Chrome debug console.

    
    
    onInit: function() {
     oCareUnits = new sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel("proxy/care_unit");
    oCareUnits.attachRequestCompleted(oCareUnits, function(event, data){
     sap.ui.getCore().byId("Radiobuttons").setSelectedIndex(200); // fake number to deselect
      sap.ui.getCore().byId("Radiobuttons").setModel(oCareUnits);
      });

 On the other hand

    
    
    sap.ui.getCore().byId("Radiobuttons").setSelectedIndex(1);

 Works just fine (selects the 2nd from a list of 3)



Any idea's how to get a rbg working with nothing pre selected? The thing is a
set of radiobuttons (without the group) are not pre selected. This should be
the default in my opinion!

title: Re:Missing wizards

author: Raul Romero
text:
Hello everyone.



No problem. The steps are easy to get the Eclipse SAPUI5 Wizard. Just remember
that with these wizard you can create web projects in a MVC pattern.



Well today I've installed SAP Application Development on Eclipse Juno.
Remember that SAPUI5 Framework works alone with a Apache Tomcat Server, and
with any Eclipse IDE (from Indigo to the rest) nor Visual Studio 2010.



1\. Check if you have installed Eclipse IDE with Apache Tomcat Server. If
don't please fix it,

2\. Once you've downloaded the .zip file with the tools, unzip this to a local
directory ( like Desktop or C:/TEMP). By default the name of this folder is
"HTML5Evaluation_complete"

3\. Open your Eclipse IDE and go to Help-->Install new software....

4\. In that popup click on "Add" button. A popup with header "Add repository"
appears.

5\. Click on "Local..." button and write the path of the "tools-updatesite"
folder (this is in the "HTML5Evaluation_complete" folder you unzip in step
2.).

6\. Click OK

7\. Now there is a node named SAP UI Development Toolkit for HTML5. Check on
it or click on "Select All"

8\. Now click on "Next".

9\. Accept the license user agreement and click "Next".

10\. Follow the next steps and wait until the IDE installs the SAP Project.

11\. After all these steps, restart your Eclipse IDE.

12\. You can check your installation if follow the steps
File->New->Other... and there will be a node with the name SAPUI5
Application Development, with its nodes (Application Project and View)





All this information is in Readme_and_InstallationInformation.html file placed
in the .zip. And about the JDK, in my case is the jdk1.7.0_05.



Hope it was helpful for you.

Bye.

DataTable : column order?
text:
Hi all,



I created a script that will parse an XML in a specific format (MII) and
generates the dataTable automatically.

This is working just fine but I am missing one feature: how to reorder columns
based on their current index or based on their ID/name?



something like oTable.setColumnOrder(["name1","name3","name2"]);
author: Willem van Lammeren
Peter Muessig
text:
Hi Willem,



the order of the column is defined by the order you added the columns to the
table - first added column is displayed as first column. If you want to
reorder them later on you can remove them and insert them at another position.



If you already create the table and its columns dynamically you could bring
the columns in the correct order before adding them to the table.



Best regards,

Peter

Issues with OData Model Filters and Gateway services
text:
Following on from [http://scn.sap.com/message/13559229](http://scn.sap.com/mes
sage/13559229#13559229) I started to test some of the OData Filter operations
and found a couple of issues when calling Netweaver Gateway services.



The first one is the String Operators StartsWith, EndsWith and Contains.



From ODataListBinding-dbg.js ->
sap.ui.model.odata.ODataListBinding.prototype.createFilterParams



    
    
    case "Contains":
     sFilterParam += "indexof(" + oFilter.sPath + "," + sValue + ")%20ne%20-1";
     break;
    case "StartsWith":
     sFilterParam += "startswith(" + oFilter.sPath + "," + sValue + ")%20eq%20true";
     break;
    case "EndsWith":
     sFilterParam += "endswith(" + oFilter.sPath + "," + sValue + ")%20eq%20true";
     break;



This is the code that creates the filter query string.



Netweaver Gateway from SP04 supports the operations startsWith and endWith,
however as you can see above SAPUI5 includes "eq true" at the end, and this is
not supported. I removed the "eq true" and they kind of worked (see second
issue below)



Contains uses indexOf which returns "Invalid function 'indexOf' detected" when
used against a Gateway service. I believe it should be using substringof
instead which works as I would expect contains to work (I, CP, *<val>*
in IT_FILTER_SELECT_OPTIONS ).



The second issue I found was that SAPUI5 removes the first row of the query.



eg. if i use sap.ui.model.FilterOperator.EQ like

    
    
    var oModel = initModel(sURI, false),
     oBinding = oModel.bindList("Categories"),
     oFilter = new sap.ui.model.Filter("CategoryName", sap.ui.model.FilterOperator.EQ, "Beverages");



For the above call, one row is returned from the Gateway service, however this
entity is not returned in the bindings context. If more than one entity
returned all but the first is available in the context.



Looking at ODataModel.qunit.html I get the feeling that both are known issues.
Looking at the code in SAPUI5 Runtime 1.6.3 on
<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#content/Overview.html> which is
still not publicly available, I am not sure that these have been resolved yet.



Cheers

JSP

Bug report data binding DropDownBox v1.6.3
author: Martin Jonsson
Peter Muessig
text:
Hi Martin,



did you copy this code from the earlier version of SAPUI5? Or did you also
find it in the official documentation? In our demokit:
<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk>?



Your example can be fixed with one little minor change:

oDropdownBox3.bindItems("**/**hardware", oItemTemplate1);



You need to use the path "/hardware" instead of "hardware". We had to do an
important cleanup here before we roll out SAPUI5 to a wider community.

> **Required changes in the application when moving from 1.4 to 1.6:**

>

>

>

> To fix the application, you have to change all bindings, which have a
relative path (without a slash at the beginning), but are not used within a
list-binding template, or an area where a binding context is explicitely
defined with either "bindContext" or "setBindingContext".

>

>

>

> So whenever you want your path to be resolved starting with the root-Element
of the data model, you have to add a slash at the beginning of the binding
path:

>

>

>

> bindValue("name") ---> bindValue("/name")

>

> bindRows("Orders") ---> bindRows("/Orders")

>

> { value: "{name}" } ---> { value: "{/name}" }



The new syntax also work in the SAPUI5 1.4 version - so in general it might be
much safer to adapt to the above mentioned principle. In any case you do an
absolute binding to the root element of the model just put add a leading slash
to the path.



Best regards,

Peter
title: Re:Bug report data binding DropDownBox v1.6.3

author: Martin Jonsson
text:
Hello Peter.



You are absolutely right, I did check the new documentation but honestly could
have looked for days without seeing this subtle difference. I did take the
code example from the 1.4 documentation.



This binding works now, thanks a ton for your quick reply! Otherwise I would
have been stuck. I wish all SAP support could be this quick.



Could it be a good idea to put up some "this has changed" page? So that people
like me that already got used to do things in a certain way can see where we
have to rethink.



Cheers

Martin
title: Re:Bug report data binding DropDownBox v1.6.3

author: Peter Muessig
text:
Hi Martin,



we maintain our release notes / changes in our documentation / demokit. You
can find them here:

<https://sapui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/#docs/guide/ReleaseNotes.html>



It is unfortunately not very clear represented but it contains the remark that
the databinding syntax has been changed with the Runtime version 1.5.1:



CHANGE: Databinding syntax changed, so that absolute bindings now must have a
leading slash. For compatibility reasons, method [setLegacySyntax()](https://s
apui5.netweaver.ondemand.com/sdk/docs/api/symbols/sap.ui.model.Model.html#setL
egacySyntax) can be used to enable the old binding syntax.



We still have room for improvements here... Thanks for the feedback.



Best regards,

Peter
title: Re:Bug report data binding DropDownBox v1.6.3

author: Martin Jonsson
text:
Hi Peter.



I actually saw this entry in the release notes.



However, it says absolute binding and since I always used relative binding I
did not thought it applied to this problem. Now I know I always have to use
absolute binding.



Thanks

Martin
title: Re:Bug report data binding DropDownBox v1.6.3
Bug report XML view HorizontalLayout v1.4.2
author: Martin Jonsson
Peter Muessig
text:
Hi Martin,



thanks for reporting this issue - it has already been fixed in the 1.6
versions of SAPUI5. The default aggregation of the HorizontalLayout was not
defined in the metadata of the control.



The SAPUI5 1.4 version downloadable via the SDN is a test and evaluation
version. It is not maintained anymore. So we provide the fixes only for the
1.6 version. The 1.6 version can be consumed via NW Cloud Eclipse Update Site
by installing the SAPUI5 components and creating a SAPUI5 application project.



Here a workaround for the 1.4 version is:



 <layout:HorizontalLayout id="hLayout1">

 <layout:content>

 <Button id="a" text="generate" tooltip="generate"/>

 </layout:content>

 </layout:HorizontalLayout>



You can simply specify the used aggregation via the layout:content element in
between the layout and the Button control.



Best regards,

Peter

title: Re:Non-english characters are not displayed properly

author: Ivan Andreev
text:
Hi Peter,

After reading your suggestion I changed a static label in Cyrilic and it
worked. I realized that I have this problem only with dynamic data and
moreover with data, created using ODataModel. I have one rest service which
creates data using POST and json payload and afterwards this data is displayed
properly. However, when using ODataModel.create and ODataModel.update the data
is stored in DB in unreadable form, that's why it is not displayed correctly
afterwards.

After some debugging in odata4j I found the problem. ODataModel sends request
with header "Content-Type: application/atom+xml" and odata4j assumes HTTP 1.1
default charset ISO_8859_1, which causes the problem. When I manually issue
post request with header "Content-Type: application/atom+xml;charset=UTF-8" it
works fine.



However, after some more debugging I solved my problem by 'hacking' ODataModel
as follows:



myapp.functions.createODataModel = function() {

 var oModel = new
sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel(myapp.functions.getODataURL());

 oModel.oHeaders["Content-Type"] = "application/atom+xml;
charset=UTF-8";

 return oModel;

}



So I am still not sure if the problem is in SAPUI5 or datajs or odata4j...
what do you think?



Regards,

Ivan
title: Re:Non-english characters are not displayed properly

DataTable & XMLDocument
text:
Hello,



Could anyone provide examples for binding the sap.ui.table.DataTable control
to an XML-Document (e.g. XML Response from SOAP request)?

I found lots of examples to bind the sap.ui.table.DataTable control to a OData
Datasource or JSON. But not a single one to bind to XML-Datasource.



I tried with sap.ui.model.xml.XMLModel() but could not get it to work.



...

var oModel = new sap.ui.model.xml.XMLModel();

oModel.setXML( xmlSource );

oTable.bindRows("item");

oTable.setModel(oModel);

...



Would be thankful for samples or link to samples.



Andreas
author: Andreas Hufnagel
Willem van Lammeren
text:
These is no "standard" way to do this but it is certainly feasable!



The porblem is that an XML is more of a DOM object rather than a javascript
object which is why it ieasier to work with JSON.



Solution 1: get your server to return JSON

Solution 2:parse the XML on the client using one of the best DOM manipulation
tools: jQuery!



A quick search:

-Make all of your XML to JSON:<http://www.fyneworks.com/jquery/xml-to-json/#tab-Overview>

-Simply go through the XML and get the data you need in the format you need: <http://api.jquery.com/category/traversing/>



Example on how to go through a XML:<http://jsfiddle.net/9ysgw/>

FileUploader event uploadComplete help!!
text:
Hi,



I have attached a event handler for uploadComplete of a fileUploader Element.
I am having some issues with this..



FileUploader Event uploadComplete is being called even on sending response
code other then 200.

The response code that i am using for an invalid file is 201 but the
uploadComplete event is called even for this. Please point out if i am missing
something in the response or is there any other way to handlle it?
author: Anil Prabhu
Ivan Andreev
text:
Hi Anil,

What I suggest is just a guess. In general 2xx codes mean success, so to me it
looks completely fine to have uploadComplete called. Try to return 4xx (client
error) or 5xx (server error) code.



Regards

Ivan
title: Re:FileUploader event uploadComplete help!!

author: Peter Muessig
text:
Hi Anil,



the uploadComplete event is fired always once the uploading process is
finished nevertheless what the response code of the request is.



There are two options to check if a upload was successful or not is to check
the content of the document inside the hidden iframe. The second option would
be to pass some key as additional data which is used after the uploadComplete
event was raised to use a second XHR request to query for the success state of
the upload process.



Best regards,

Peter

Custom Controls Eclipse
text:
Hello.



This is for the SAPUI5 development team.



In the first release of SAPUI5 documentation there were pages of how to build
SAPUI5 custom controls in eclipse with wizards.



Link:<http://www.spyvee.com/SAPHTML5_DemoKit/#docs/guide/ControlDev.html>



Some people commented on this and the answer then was that this would be
available in a later release.



Now when I look into the current documentation (release 1.6.2 or 1.4 for that
matter) those pages referring to this has been removed.



Is it no longer intended to be able to develop custom controls with eclipse
wizard? Or will this come at the same time as the control layout designer
functionality that has been mentioned a few times?



For me personally, this functionality would be really useful.



Regards

Martin
author: Martin Jonsson
Oliver Graeff
text:
Hello Martin,



We do have the intention to support UI control development with the SAPUI5
Eclipse tools and wizards. Unfortunately the current status of these tools
have some drawbacks, both from a functional and also from a user experience
point of view. Therefore we decided to ship these tools at a later point in
time, which currently is not fixed yet.



You might have noticed that instead we offer a different way of creating new
Controls with a much easier handling. Kindly check the current SAPUI5 Demo Kit
-> Developer Guide -> SAPUI5 Runtime -> Programming &API ->
Control Development Topics -> How to Develop UI5 Controls Within
JavaScript. This page explains how to create new Controls in JavaScript on the
fly (so-called "Notepad Controls"). For this basic development approach, it is
not necessary to define libraries or to run generation steps. It is possible
to extend existing Controls and to create completely new Controls.



Hope this helps and thanks for your understanding.



Best regards,

Oliver
title: Re:Custom Controls Eclipse

author: Martin Jonsson
text:
Hello Oliver.



I indeed saw the "notepad" approach.



I'll dig into it tonight and see how far I can stretch it.



Thanks for a very quick reply!

Cheers

Martin
title: Re:Custom Controls Eclipse

title: SAPUI5 Application Development Tool
text:
Hi,



I have been trying to get the SAPUI5 Application Development Tool for Eclipse
installed, but I cannot seem to get the Wizards to work. Everything looked
like it installed fine, but when I look closer now in the Eclipse Product
Configuration I see errors for the SAPUI5 features and others:



[![2012-08-01_2039.png](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadImage/2
-13435620-125319/450-236/2012-08-01_2039.png)](http://scn.sap.com/servlet/Jive
Servlet/showImage/2-13435620-125319/2012-08-01_2039.png)

I tried to disable one of the SAPUI5 features, that worked... but when I try
to re-enable it I get the error as shown in the screenshot saying that it
requires Jetty 8.0.0:



Requested operation cannot be performed because it would invalidate the
current configuration. See details for more information.

 SAPUI5 Application Development (1.4.3) requires feature
"org.eclipse.jetty.core (8.0.0)", or compatible.



Has anyone had success getting these working? I am at a bit of a loss. The
documentation says I should have all the following features:



Name| Feature Plugin| Minimal Version| Available in Eclipse JEE Bundle  
---|---|---|---  
Eclipse Platform| org.eclipse.platform| 3.6.0| yes  
Eclipse Faceted Project Framework| org.eclipse.wst.common.fproj| 3.2.0| yes  
Eclipse Faceted Project Framework JDT Enablement|
org.eclipse.jst.common.fproj.enablement.jdt| 3.2.0| yes  
Eclipse Java EE Developer Tools| org.eclipse.jst.enterprise_ui.feature| 3.2.0|
yes  
Eclipse Java Web Developer Tools / JST Web UI| org.eclipse.jst.web_ui.feature|
3.2.0| yes  
EMF - Eclipse Modeling Framework Runtime and Tools| org.eclipse.emf| 2.4.2|
yes  
Graphical Editing Framework GEF| org.eclipse.gef| 3.6.0| yes  
JavaScript Development Tools| org.eclipse.wst.jsdt.feature| _1.2.0| yes  
**WST Common Core**| **org.eclipse.wst.common_core.feature**| **_3.2.0**| **yes**  
(valid for Juno version) Jetty - Core: servlets and webapps|
org.eclipse.jetty.core| _8.0.0| no  
  


All of which I have except for the highlighted one and according to this table
I don't need Jetty unless I am running Eclipse Juno (I am on Indigo).



If anyone can lend a hand that would be great.

  
Thanks,  
Simon
author: Simon Kemp
Silke Arians
text:
Hi Simon,



have you installed the SAPUI5 Application Tool into a **JEE Eclipse bundle**
version as mentioned in the Readme_and_InstallationInformation.html file?

This JEE bundle already contains the WST Common Core and also all other needed
features and the SAPUI5 Application Tool should work fine then. Jetty-Core is
only needed for Juno, for Indigo and Helios we need org.mortbay.jetty.server
and org.mortbay.jetty.util.

As you mentioned, your Eclipse does not seem to have the WST Common Core. For
later installing WTP Common Core you can use the WTP update site
<http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/repository/indigo/> (for Indigo) but our
recommendation and the safest way would be to use the JEE bundle and install
then the SAPUI5 Application Tool as maybe also some other features are
missing.



Kind regards,

Silke
title: Re:SAPUI5 Application Development Tool

author: Simon Kemp
text:
Thank you Silke,



I ended up downloading the Juno JEE bundle and then everything worked fine. My
Indigo wasn't originally the JEE bundle but I "updated" it with the JEE
features, I thought, I guess this didn't quite work correctly. Anyway it was
much easier to start with a fresh JEE bundle as you recommended.



Thanks for your help.

Simon

author: Stefan Beck
text:
Hello Dagfinn,



let me share the current delivery plans for SAPUI5 (obviously with the usual
disclaimer "all statements are subject to change and may be changed by SAP at
any time for any reason without notice "):



\- SAPUI5 plans an update of the SDN delivery within the next 2 weeks. The
content will be the runtime version 1.4.2



\- The UI5 tools (eclipse plug-ins) will not yet be included. Some
formal/legal processes are required and we do not exactly know when they will
be settled. The next SDN update including tools will be done 1-2 weeks after
settlement.





The official SAP shipment channels for SAPUI5 will be:



\- SAP NetWeaver Cloud formerly called JPaaS/Neo. The tools will be added in
roughly 2-3 months, runtime is already shipped.



\- NW Java 7.31 SP5 planned for Q4/2012 (SAPUI5 runtime version 1.6). 7.30
later.



\- non-modifying NetWeaver ABAP add-on called NW UI Extension V1.0 currently
scheduled for  
September 2012 (runtime + tools version1.6).





In parallel, we plan to update the SDN package accordingly.



Means for the time being, please use the JS Editor that you prefer. SAPUI5
tools will come soon with additional support (in the first version with
Wizards, MVC support, code-completion, preview functionality)



Best regards  
Stefan
title: Re:IDE support for javascript and sapui5 beta?

author: Steffen Schwark
text:
Hi Stefan,



Thanks for the update! From my initial trials it was quite obvious that the
tool support will make a big difference to development productivity, so
looking forward to the full release.



Regards,

Steffen
title: Re:IDE support for javascript and sapui5 beta?

author: Dagfinn Parnas
text:
Thanks for sharing the plans in this area. The transparency related to new
technologies makes a big difference
title: Re:IDE support for javascript and sapui5 beta?

author: Durairaj Athavan Raja
text:
_ non-modifying NetWeaver ABAP add-on called NW UI Extension V1.0 currently

September 2012 (runtime + tools version1.6)._

title: Re:IDE support for javascript and sapui5 beta?

author: Stefan Beck
text:
Hello Raja,



it will be 2 Eclipse Plug-Ins that offer a kind of Team Provider support
known from Eclipse that allow you to use BSP pages as repository on ABAP
servers.

As said, on top there are Wizards and additional helpers like a meaningful
code completion, that will help you to be more productive. More code templates
and WYSIWYG coming at a later point of time.



Plug-ins will also work together with other Eclipse based IDEs coming from SAP
like the HANA Studio or ABAP in Eclipse.



So direction is more towards a "new design tool". However, the usage is not
mandatory, working with BSP directly is also possible.



Best regards

Stefan

and drop features **for the HTML items?

For example, can we drag a button and drop it to the HTML file we are
developing, set the property values such as colours, action methods etc., and
the codes are generated for us?



Thank you.



Best regards,

Haridev, Nadarajan
title: Re:IDE support for javascript and sapui5 beta?

author: Oliver Graeff
text:
Hello Harideva Anand,



yes, we're planning a WYSIWYG editor for SAPUI5. It is meant to support
drag&drop of SAPUI5 Controls onto a screen, set their properties, connect
them to the respective data sources and enable to work with a mixture of
generated and own code.

Unfortunately there is no fixed timeline for this yet, but we will let you
know once this important feature become available. We are working on this with
high priority.



Thanks for your understanding and best regards,

Oliver Graeff
title: Re:IDE support for javascript and sapui5 beta?

author: Andrej Medic
text:
Hi,



Since oData/HTML/JS is heavily used in this model, any plans to  
support Microsoft tools such as Visual Studio LightSwitch 2012:
<http://blogs.msdn.com/b/lightswitch/>



-AM
title: Re:IDE support for javascript and sapui5 beta?

author: Stefan Beck
text:
Hello Andrej,



there are currently no development efforts at SAP to move into that direction.
However, there are 2 research topics:

  * around Windows 8, people look into such an integration
  * around OAM (<http://www.openajax.org/member/wiki/OpenAjax_Metadata_Specification>) we might get such an opportunity. SAPUI5 most likely will provide OAM and in case tools from other vendors understand OAM...



Best regards

Stefan

XML code completion not working
text:
Hi all,

i have installed the SAPUI5 development toolkit and it is working well so far,
but when i create an XML view with the wizard

the code completion (or tag completion) does not work ...

have i missed something ? has anyone had the same problem and managed to fix
it ?



thanks for your support.



Patrick.
author: patrick atanassian
Oliver Graeff
text:
Dear Patrick,



Thanks a lot for your question. Unfortunately with the SAPUI5 Tools version
1.6 we do not provide functionality for code completion within XML views. We
do have it for JavaScript views, but not for XML and JSON format. There are
technical reasons why we so far were not able to implement this with a
reliable quality and reasonable effort. We are well aware though that this is
a functionality is urgently needed.



To work around this, we look towards code templates/snippets to make the
developer more effective. Also these we currently offer for JavaScript and not
yet for XML. (At least as a little help it could be feasible for you to create
a template yourself?)



Thanks for your understanding and best regards,

Oliver
title: Re:XML code completion not working

author: patrick atanassian
text:
Hi Olivier,

thank you for your feedback.

this answers my question as i thought that i did something wrong during the
installation of the toolkit.

i believe the UI5 team is working hard and will deliver a solution soon.



bests regards,



Patrick.

sapui5 OData Model Binding Mode support
text:
I am wondering if in future releases of sapui5 whether Two Way binding be
supported for OData Model Binding.



In the currently available version of the UI Development Kit for HTML5 the
following modes are supported

> **Model**| **One Way**| **Two Way**| **One Time**  
> ---|---|---|---  
> _Resource Model_|  - |  \- |  X  
> _JSON Model_|  X |  X |  X  
> _XML Model_|  X |  X |  X  
> _OData Model_|  X |  \- |  X  
>  
>

>

>   * `One Way` > The model implementation supports one way binding which
means from model to view (value changes in the model will update all
corresponding bindings and the view).

>   * `Two Way` > The model implementation supports two way binding which
means from model to view and from view to model (value changes in the model
and in the view will update all corresponding bindings and the view,
respective model).

>   * `One Time` > The model implementation supports one time binding
which means from model to view once.



Will "Two Way" binding be supported for OData Model?



If the answer is yes, will we be able to use the SAPData Annotations to change
the default bind behaviour of individual controls?



I am thinking this could be done either by property

eg editable = sap:updatable



or by formatter or mode



// propertyname, formatter function, binding mode

// bindValue(sPath, fnFormatter_?_, sMode_?_)

oText.bindValue("firstName",null, sap.ui.model.BindingMode.OneWay)



Cheers

JSP
author: John Patterson
Abhilash Gampa
text:
Hi JSP,



In my view the OData Model may not support two way binding. The logic behind
my comment is; OData model binding is based on Query operation type. So for
READ and QUERY we will use HTTP GET, similarly POST for Create records and
etc.



We cannot distinguish the operations based on URI as the URI is common for all
operations. So we need to explicitly mention the type of operation we are
going to perform on the URI by mentioning method type.



The REST service has certain patters to follow, these become restrictions for
the Two way binding. For example the POST method which intern calls Create
operation requires all the parameters to be passed irrespective of usage. So
we might need to pass additional parameters to POST which may not be in GET.
And also we need to pass the X-CSRF-Token along with all update operations.



And as of now the OData Model class sap.ui.model.odata.ODataModel  is not
supporting with update operations.



This is my understanding on why OData model does not support two way binding.



Thanks

Abhilash
title: Re:sapui5 OData Model Binding Mode support

author: John Patterson
text:
Hi Abhilash



I am not sure I am following your logic.



There are a few client side frameworks which currently have controls that do
support two-way OData Model Binding, some of them appear to be Ajax based. I
am yet to see one which uses Datajs the OData library behind SAPUI5, I am
hoping this is only a matter of time.



Cheers

JSP
title: Re:sapui5 OData Model Binding Mode support

author: Abhilash Gampa
text:
Hi JSP,



That's really interesting to know. I have used datajs OData library but I was
able to communicate one way only. Please let me know if you get any success
with that.



Thanks for correcting me.



Regards

Abhilash
title: Re:sapui5 OData Model Binding Mode support

author: John Patterson
text:
UPDATE:

Found a javascript library which does two-way OData binding -
[http://jaydata.org/ ](http://jaydata.org/) It is similar to SAPUI5 in that
it uses the JQuery and Datajs libraries and declarative binding (knockoutjs).
It differs in the way it creates concrete types for the models.
title: Re:sapui5 OData Model Binding Mode support

author: Abhilash Gampa
text: Thanks for the update. I will explore further.
title: Re:sapui5 OData Model Binding Mode support
